question: What are views about SRM University katanlapur based on your experience I am about to join?
answers: From a fresher’s perspective, I’ll detail the pros as experienced by me: Pros: Huge campus: the campus is verg big and there are lot of cool buildings to see, the infrastructure is top class.Every floor has canteen and adequate RO Drinking water outlets are available.There are elevator facilities in every building (although you have to have some patience as they are full most of the times, and they stop at certain floors only)Atleast in the University Buliding, all the classrooms are Air Conditioned hence you don’t need to worry about the scroching summer winds.All classrooms have SMART learningContinue ReadingFrom a fresher’s perspective, I’ll detail the pros as experienced by me: Pros: Huge campus: the campus is verg big and there are lot of cool buildings to see, the infrastructure is top class.Every floor has canteen and adequate RO Drinking water outlets are available.There are elevator facilities in every building (although you have to have some patience as they are full most of the times, and they stop at certain floors only)Atleast in the University Buliding, all the classrooms are Air Conditioned hence you don’t need to worry about the scroching summer winds.All classrooms have SMART learning tools, they have projector and screen for interactive learningNO RAGGING whatsoever, ragging is a crime and I know of no instance of it here.The Java Green and Tech Park Annexure are great canteen that provide varitey of tasty foods at affordable prices.The Library: Infact this should have been the first point, the library is world-class, has an astounding collection of books on atleast 100 hundred different fields. Ranging from Physics, Maths, Sanskrit, Tamil, Law to almost anything, they have a book.The digital infrastructure is also excellent, the attendence and scores are updated and the app they use is also without complaints.You can get pretty much whatever you want, from the campus.There is great support from Research and Innovation, the clubs are very active, they have lot of activities everyday.

question: What are views about SRM University katanlapur based on your experience I am about to join?

question: What are the fees at SRM University for a B.Tech in CSE artificial intelligence?
answers: Turion fee is 250,000rs for people getting admitted in the academic year 18–19 The hostel fees would come around 1,10,000rs if you stay in non-ac rooms (shared by 3 or 4) The transportation costs (if you stay in Chennai) would be 50,000rs per year. The semester exam fee is around 3,000rs per semester. You'll end up spending 15–16 lacs, if you come through SRMJEE. And around 20 lacs, if you come through management quota There are also certain scholarships provided that you score good in board exam and your SRMJEE rank is under 10k. This should answer your question :)

question: What students from Kota Rajasthan who miss my narrow marks IITs join at SRM University got satisfied?

Food provided. Presentation made. The students joined had a rude disillusionment. Here is a video by on of my senior I wanted to post. Everyday you wake up with fake promises. You will not have water in the tap. You need to stand before the bath room which is used by 10. The Breakfast is so bald and prepared with total unhygienic is served to us. Our class isin 10th floor and I have satnd in the long queue for to go to class. The class is for 50 minites and only 10 minites for attendance. The advises. Only 12 minites will be class. The next class will be in a different room. WE have to go. Most of the teachers are poor and basic knowledge of physics mathematics and chemistry is missing. Teachers are from local self financing enginneering colleges with PhD from SRM University. Easy to get.  Once some the mathematics problems of IIT are requested by students to be solved by teacher. Many are solved by us at Kota. He told it is for PhD problems and here no one will solve? question: If I pursue a BTech from private institutes like VIT, LPU, or SRM, will I face any problem in applying for government jobs like IES, ISRO, DRDO, and Barc since these colleges are not AICTE approved?
answers: You will not face any problem while applying for govt. jobs if you are passing out from these colleges. For example:- if we are considering IES, then a candidate needs to have one of the following:- must possess a degree in Engineering from a recognized institute with the minimum percentage required. (which is in accordance with above)should have cleared sections A and B from the Institutions of Engineers (India).obtained a degree/diploma in Engineering from such foreign University/ College/ Institution and the certificate is valued as equivalent to the degree received in India.passed Graduate MContinue ReadingYou will not face any problem while applying for govt. jobs if you are passing out from these colleges. For example:- if we are considering IES, then a candidate needs to have one of the following:- must possess a degree in Engineering from a recognized institute with the minimum percentage required. (which is in accordance with above)should have cleared sections A and B from the Institutions of Engineers (India).obtained a degree/diploma in Engineering from such foreign University/ College/ Institution and the certificate is valued as equivalent to the degree received in India.passed Graduate Membership Examination of the Institution of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineers (India).passed Associate Membership Examination Parts II and III/Sections A and B of the Aeronautical Society of India.passed Graduate Membership Examination of the Institution of Electronics and Radio Engineers, London held after November 1959. These colleges are not AICTE approved because they are independent universities themselves. Though it does not matter, but your resume will look much better if you pass out from one of these universities which you mentioned.

question: If I pursue a BTech from private institutes like VIT, LPU, or SRM, will I face any problem in applying for government jobs like IES, ISRO, DRDO, and Barc since these colleges are not AICTE approved?
answers: No , You will not face any problems , since these all are deemed to be university and for this AICTE approval not required. As for being a university , it should be approved from UGC and these all universities is approved from UGC.

question: Is it worth doing Engineering nowadays (or in future)? Does the extreme hardwork and Talent pays back? If yes, then how? What are the pros and cons of being an engineer? Is something better which you could achieve with the same hardwork and practice?
answers: Ok, that’s a long stretched question. So, I will answer one sentence at one time. No fantasy words, no high hopes will be included in this answer.  Is it worth doing Engineering nowadays(or in the future)? Yes, it is worthy to learn engineering nowadays as well as in the future. The demand for engineers will be always high. But, you might be thinking, then why many are students after graduating from Engineering colleges are unemployed nowadays. Worthy to read this-When a student freshly graduates in Engineering major, many things play a crucial role, which decides whether he will be called unemplo Continue ReadingOk, that’s a long stretched question. So, I will answer one sentence at one time. No fantasy words, no high hopes will be included in this answer.  Is it worth doing Engineering nowadays(or in the future)? Yes, it is worthy to learn engineering nowadays as well as in the future. The demand for engineers will be always high. But, you might be thinking, then why many are students after graduating from Engineering colleges are unemployed nowadays. Worthy to read this-When a student freshly graduates in Engineering major, many things play a crucial role, which decides whether he will be called unemployed or employed. Like the dream job, the mentor, the other plans, the govt exams, the salary, the references, the accommodation, the environment, the city. Many out there have these things missing in them, which interrupt their whole course to join a company. Important in these are mentor, References, Dream job, And City. Either you have to make a balance between them or to sacrifice on to compensate other irrespective of an important one.  Do the extremely hard work and Talent payback? What’s a good example other than class toppers of every Engineering course. They are extremely hardworking persons, good in everything(assuming), so you might be thinking that what will go wrong with them right?. Just snatch reference, dream job, and campus placement from them and you will see them right next to you in a BPO job. Note this-Obviously, if you are talented and in a suitable place, where your talent is cared then yes, your talent will pay you 100 fold. But if you are honing your talent irrespective of any extra holds then maybe you will not get what you want. A prime example is- A part-time athlete, singer, artist from a good place with their part-time hobbies have a good chance to pursue their part-time dream but a person with a single dream from not so good place will face many problems before time. It’s because of a lack of exposure to the vast opportunity which can be seen from these examples. Worthy to read this- I have seen many friends of mine as well as many others who were too good in everything, I mean it. But they end up in not so likely jobs, which they never wanted or dreamt of. What goes wrong?, well as I say before, either you have to make a balance between things which you like or you have to sacrifice one for others. If you can't do one of them, ready to say goodby to your dreams.  Cons and Pros of being Engineer You will not get who you dreamt of ( in most cases). Either you end up in the second one or in a totally different one. But you will succeed 10 fold or you will be forced to change it in a few years; your dream.You will count only higher mountains but leave the rest just because they don’t come in the exam. But it will give you exposure to vast areas ( only exposure; In my thinking, engineering is also just a fat book of introduction chapters of various fields. You will never now what excite you the most, believe me).Also, Engineers are perverts to the core, they just attracted to new things every time they read or learn new and forget the previous one. But the good news is that In the end they even don’t know about any of them. Is something better which you could achieve with the same hard work and practice? Yes, you can do the same Engineering in a far greater way than you are doing it now. The things which I mentioned in 1st answer, one should carve them in their head. They are way too important for any of the students out there. I told you, those things decide whether someone will be called employed or unemployed in the end. Worthy to read-Taking your student life seriously, choosing good mentors to help you sail the job-seeking days, compromise accommodations, not the job, prepare everything in advance, build up a pile of references before you set foot in the outside world.

question: Is it worth doing Engineering nowadays (or in future)? Does the extreme hardwork and Talent pays back? If yes, then how? What are the pros and cons of being an engineer? Is something better which you could achieve with the same hardwork and practice?

question: Are SRM Chennai and VIT Chennai tier 1 engineering colleges?
answers: Okay lets start with the mutated obsession of Indians pertaining to the prestige and status of the college amd University being persued. Having said that, yes it is true that having the privilege of graduating from prestigious institutions of the likes of IIMs, IITs etc. it definitely gives a higher podium to start your career and gives a big springboard so to speak, but it does not give you wings for sure. The possibilities are endless, let me paint you a picture of my back story. I graduated from SRM University NCR campus with degree in electronics and communication engineering. I was lucky en Continue ReadingOkay lets start with the mutated obsession of Indians pertaining to the prestige and status of the college amd University being persued. Having said that, yes it is true that having the privilege of graduating from prestigious institutions of the likes of IIMs, IITs etc. it definitely gives a higher podium to start your career and gives a big springboard so to speak, but it does not give you wings for sure. The possibilities are endless, let me paint you a picture of my back story. I graduated from SRM University NCR campus with degree in electronics and communication engineering. I was lucky enough to bag an offer from Capgemini in campus placements and spent three years there trying to figure out the right skills to learn because I did not get much exposure and experience that would help me grow in the ultra competitive market. Then I spent a majority of my free time learning and upgrading myself so that I could equip my arsenal with the required arms to venture into my dreams and behold I landed an offer with Mercedes Benz. I Learned a lot during my stint with them, travelled the world, drove the most swankiest of cars I could only dream of and the rest is history. Till now I have worked with one of the best brands in the world and I am currently at the prime of my life. So the moral of the story is hardwork pays off and it absolutely doesnt matter which college or institution you pass out from. Keep learning and keep rocking!!!

question: I have an 83 percentage in PCM. Will I get admission in SRM KTR for a B.Tech in CSC, ECE or IT?
answers: SRMJEEE exam is the gate pass for the candidates applying for the undergraduate Engineering admissions at SRM. Since it is practically impossible to conduct an offline exam in this corona Pandemic, the exams are cancelled. In order to get into SRM, the candidate should have 50% aggregate of PCM/PCB in the qualifying examination, perhaps the board exams. question: Which university is worth joining among SRM, Manipal, Amity, UPES, VIT, Amrita, NIMS, or any other?
answers: Do this, but be aware - this takes effort, time and patience ;) There are two parts to it - 1 - A purely quantitative, statistical study. Conduct a quantitative study of YOUR OWN - compare and use rankings of not one or two, but a number of ranking systems - NIRF, THE, QS - there are a lot. Now don’t just go and compare and say “X is at rank 1 whereas as Y is at rank 2, so it is obviously better!” - dig deep. What metrics are they using? Are the metrics biased? Are the metrics inclined towards factors that don’t have a proper definition ? (like “reputation”) How have the rankings improved over th Continue ReadingDo this, but be aware - this takes effort, time and patience ;) There are two parts to it - 1 - A purely quantitative, statistical study. Conduct a quantitative study of YOUR OWN - compare and use rankings of not one or two, but a number of ranking systems - NIRF, THE, QS - there are a lot. Now don’t just go and compare and say “X is at rank 1 whereas as Y is at rank 2, so it is obviously better!” - dig deep. What metrics are they using? Are the metrics biased? Are the metrics inclined towards factors that don’t have a proper definition ? (like “reputation”) How have the rankings improved over the years? Is the university stagnant? Or worse are the ranks dropping? Does the university have appropriate accreditation? For placements, go through each of the university websites and collect data directly from them. Not from Quora, not from your neighbor but directly from their website. If for some reason, they don’t have the data, contact the college (also possibly a red flag) Go through their social media handles. Find what else the university does, research aspects, etc. It is easy to read Quora and read one guy saying “X is at rank 1 by ABC ranking - it is the best!!!” and some others saying the complete opposite. This is something you have to do because it is your responsibility to make sure that you don’t end up in a place where you don’t want to be. For comparing numbers, do not read people’s opinions, they are almost always biased and that is something you cannot afford for the first part of your study. It is, by no doubts, a painstaking long process but once you have a firm ground to stand, you can think of running :) 2 - A purely opinion based study The numbers play no part for this part of the study. By opinion of people, I do not mean random strangers you find on Quora or any website - I mean the students. Approach students from the colleges in question, preferably ask one from each year - 1st, 2nd, 3rd and final year (if it’s B.Tech) Ask them relevant questions - how is the campus atmosphere? Is the teaching diligent? Are assignments and exams conducted just for the sake of conducting? Is there ragging? How friendly are the seniors? Are there student clubs? How good are the student clubs? How good are the hostels? Are the faculty approachable? Is the administration too strict/ too lax? What are some common nuisances that you face? Try to connect with the alumni too, if possible, they would be undoubtedly much more wise. How can you connect with these people? Well the world is your oyster - Quora, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter - endless ways to do it. Try to ask as many people as possible, so you make sure you reduce the chance of bias. Don’t hesitate, because your future depends upon it! Doing this, you might make some friends who might just play a crucial role in your life ;) I will reiterate what I have said before for the previous section - This is something you have to do because it is your responsibility to make sure that you don’t end up in a place where you don’t want to be. On a final note, the numbers matter less, in my opinion, because numbers can’t capture each and every aspect of the hundreds of factors that go into play. For instance, campus atmosphere. What’s the point if a college claims top placements but most of the students in a class are engaged doing illicit activities like drugs? What a student says about a college has more weight. Because he has been there, lived there. He or she has already committed and put trust on the college and he or she knows more than just those rankings you see on college websites. Those things play a role of course, but don’t over emphasize. At the end of they day, it’s your call to make. Regarding Amrita, I can certainly help you with the second part since I study in Amritapuri. I’m a B.Tech (CSE) Student at Amrita, Amritapuri (2018–22). The strongest factor in favor of Amrita, in my humble opinion, is its student club culture. Amritapuri hosts two of India’s top student clubs - amFOSS and Team bi0s. amFOSS is India’s leading FOSS and Computer Science club and bi0s is India’s ranked 1 cybersecurity team in CTFs since the last many years. More info on respective websites. I joined amFOSS in 2018, in my first year. Since then, I have been a Google Summer of Code Student in 2019, a Google Summer of Code Mentor this year, gave a couple of talks at international conferences (funded) and have a had a hell of a time so far with seniors and peers who are nothing more than family now. I will clarify - I spent every day after class at amFOSS Lab, received guidance, worked my ass off - just like my peers and seniors there. It wasn’t magic. It took work. Days and weeks and months of work. But only work doesn’t pay it off, the right exposure and guidance helps, and it multiplies your effort exponentially. Now these aren’t the only clubs, there are other great clubs as well. For instance, Code@Amrita, which is a competitive programming club. The team has a history of participating in ICPC World Finals twice. Non-CS branches have active clubs as well - HuT Labs, Baja, Supra and so on - you will find details of them on the Amrita website. So campus atmosphere? 10/10 if you make use of it ;) Ragging? None. I personally haven’t faced a situation nor have most of my friends. The administration is pretty strict about it (as they should be) so no need to worry. The hostels are OK. The first year hostel isn’t awesome but it gets a lot better after first year. ( Also I think they are constructing a new one for first years ) Food? This is subjective. It’s not bad but it’s certainly getting better. Comparing to my first year, the food is much better. The seniors agree with me. It is not bland but the food serves its purposes but it does take some getting used to. There are, of course, hotels nearby. Internet? The college provides WiFi in and around the campus and the hostels. The speed is decent enough - anywhere from 1 to 5+ Mbps depending on time and location. Faculty? All of whom I’ve encountered so far have been very friendly and approachable and that could be said to all of them, in general. Most of the classes have projectors and stuff, the labs are cool and most of the time, doesn’t feel “outdated” (as my peers from other colleges tend to say) Overall, administration and faculty are OK. Any other questions? Drop them below. Good luck! If you’re interested, here are some more answers that you will find worth reading (from me/alumni/students/etc) - Akhil K Gangadharan's answer to I did not clear the JEE Mains. What should I do? Surya Seetharaman's answer to Is Amrita University, Amritapuri Campus a good place for BTech CSE? Tony Thomas's answer to Is Amrita University, Amritapuri Campus a good place for BTech CSE? Ar Vind's answer to Which is the best campus in Amrita university for CSE? Akhil K Gangadharan's answer to What is the order of campus preference for Amrita university?

question: Is there any specialization course in ECE (SRM Vadapalani)?
answers: Definitely Yes … They have introduced a new course called B.Tech ECE with Specialization in Data Science. Data Science has fast emerged as the most preferred field of study in India as well as abroad. Graduates in data science are high in demand in various industries globally. Data scientists or data analysts analyse the data and process it in a structured formation for understanding of the actual phenomena behind any process. Data scientists use digital signal processing algorithms to collect and understand the structure in data, looking for compelling patterns, and finding useful information. There are not so many institutes in India which offer courses in data science and there is a continuous rise in demand for data scientists. And, to this new field of study, SRM Institute of Science and Technology, Chennai has introduced an unique program by combining engineering with data science. The program called B.Tech ECE with specialization in Data Science has been introduced in the academic year 2020-21.

question: Should I take admission for BTech CSE in KIIT or SRM in 2020? An opinion from students would be preferred, an overview on placements would help a lot :-)
answers: I've studied at SRM (main campus) and have a lot of friends at KIIT and been there many times. I'll try to give you a comparison. Campus: Both of the colleges have great campus and infrastructure, but KIIT has better campus and facilities as it's located in the city. SRM is located in the district of kattankulanthur and has a equally good campus but it's far away from the main city, and I personally didn't like the outskirt area of SRM.Hostel and mess : KIIT hostels are better hands down. The rooms you get is great for the price you pay. SRM hostels are old and overpriced. Even the mess food was not upto the mark for the price you pay at SRM.Academics: I personally found SRM curriculum challenging and better than KIIT. Exams are taken quite seriously. Academics wise SRM is better.International Relations : SRM has great tie-ups and opportunities for people who really want a great exposure, there are plenty of clubs and students who are interested get great opportunities for going abroad.Faculty : Most of the faculty at SRM are from South India, mainly from Tamil Nadu. And most teachers at KIIT will be from North India.Placements: These days companies visit most of the private colleges for recruitment. I personally found that the placement scenario for was same for both the colleges, the selection was based on placement exams by respective companies. It won't make a huge difference if you join either of them.Personal Opinion : Both KIIT and SRM are well established colleges, and you won't go wrong with either of them. In my opinion, you should choose the college whose culture and location would suit you the best. Feel free to reach out for any other queries.

question: Is SRM Chennai a tier 1 engineering college?
answers: SRM is one of the most popular and top colleges in Chennai. If the quality of education is to be at its peak, then IIT Madras is the only college in Chennai that offers quality education and is considered as tier 1 college. Apart from that, there is Anna university, MIT and SSN are the second league of best colleges in Chennai. Then comes colleges like SRM, VIT, Panimalar, RMK, RMD, Rajalakshmi institutions. But the positive side of colleges like SRM and VIT are that they are autonomous, which gives them the edge over other colleges affiliated to Anna university.

question: Is SRM Chennai a tier 1 engineering college?
answers: No, it's not. It is just another Pvt college with huge fee and average placement that too only for IT/CS Branches. Try for some college in pune. Fee is reasonable and placement is also fine.

question: Can I trust any consultancy to join in SRM? They said they will arrange a seat for sure.
answers: See my advice would be don't go through any consultancy or broker because they can be fraud also. So it's safe that you contact the administration and go through a legal procedure for the admission. Because I have heard cases earlier that the broker took the money and fled away so it's a double sided loss neither you get the seat nor your money are going to come back. So it's ok if you don't get a seat rather losing 2–3 lakhs in the name of donation. You will also come around some students who have got admission through consultancy or broker but the chances are 50:50. Now the choice is yours. question: Which type of questions are generally asked in the SRM placement interview?
answers: So there are 2 interviews for most of the companies one is the technical round and the other is HR round. Some companies like mass recruiters take a common interview for both the rounds. In technical interview they will obviously ask technical questions based on your domain or branch and if you are sitting for an IT company then for sure they will ask coding questions. The level of the questions are very basic and not much in detail. They only test your knowledge and how much idea you have got in that subject. So have an idea of everything whatever you have written in your resume and about your Continue ReadingSo there are 2 interviews for most of the companies one is the technical round and the other is HR round. Some companies like mass recruiters take a common interview for both the rounds. In technical interview they will obviously ask technical questions based on your domain or branch and if you are sitting for an IT company then for sure they will ask coding questions. The level of the questions are very basic and not much in detail. They only test your knowledge and how much idea you have got in that subject. So have an idea of everything whatever you have written in your resume and about your domain , they might ask your favourite topic and ask questions about them. While HR interview is very normal they check your posture and way of communication. They might ask you about your family or hobby, even favourite song or actor. Nothing technical and very random questions. Finally they can ask about the location preference or why you want to work with us and all that repeated type questions. So nothing to worry once you have proceeded the technical interview, you are 95% placed. All the best. Thank you.

question: Which type of questions are generally asked in the SRM placement interview?
answers: “SRM placement interview” is a bit broad category when you ask this question. The questions depend on the interviewer from the varying companies. But the general pattern in SRM is: They first hold a online objective exam which could be Aptitude, Coding, Logical Reasoning, psychometric , etc. Upon clearing that comes the interview, GD etc. In interviews generally they would ask some general questions about yourself, then something related to the domain like coding, algorithms etc. Then they would ask things related to stuff you’ve written on your resume. In the end they finish it off with asking a Continue Reading“SRM placement interview” is a bit broad category when you ask this question. The questions depend on the interviewer from the varying companies. But the general pattern in SRM is: They first hold a online objective exam which could be Aptitude, Coding, Logical Reasoning, psychometric , etc. Upon clearing that comes the interview, GD etc. In interviews generally they would ask some general questions about yourself, then something related to the domain like coding, algorithms etc. Then they would ask things related to stuff you’ve written on your resume. In the end they finish it off with asking about your willingness about relocating and stuff.

question: Which is best for computer engineering, SRM KTR or PICT Pune?
answers: If you are someone from Pune or anywhere from Maharashtra, blindly go for PICT. Else SRM KTR is a good option as campus life placements are really good here for CS/IT branches . But there will be around 1–1.5k students in CS branch in SRM (Around 2k when all campuses combined). Hence there will be a huge fight for placements in SRM. In that perspective PICT would be a better option for you as there is ease of getting placed. You might even end up in a company that you desire. In the end its your choice whether you want quality campus life (SRM) or better placements (PICT). Curriculum wise both are great. If you are planning to do research projects then SRM would do better. Also if you are someone from north, it would be tough to settle here in Chennai initially do keep that in mind. Carefully select the best according to your requirements.

question: How is life in the 4th year ECE in the SRM KTR campus?
answers: 4th year starts with a tension of getting placed earlier only if you are sitting for the placements as few of them pursue higher studies. The company starts coming in the month of July - August . In the last week of July or 1st week of August the college will start a 1 month training for non-coding branches to gain some knowledge about programming so that students can qualify the coding exams of IT companies. This training is also important because 90% of the companies coming for recruitment in SRM are IT companies. So give full attention to this training and trust me guys this training is ver Continue Reading4th year starts with a tension of getting placed earlier only if you are sitting for the placements as few of them pursue higher studies. The company starts coming in the month of July - August . In the last week of July or 1st week of August the college will start a 1 month training for non-coding branches to gain some knowledge about programming so that students can qualify the coding exams of IT companies. This training is also important because 90% of the companies coming for recruitment in SRM are IT companies. So give full attention to this training and trust me guys this training is very beneficial for all the students. Simultaneously, the classes will also go on in your campus but the students attending the training will get full OD for it so no worries of attendance guys. The students of various branches of SRM also comes to the KTR campus for the placements and they are accommodated in SRM hostels or BEL building. Nothing will be reduced in the 4th year infact the work pressure and load will increase as you have to manage the academics also without attending the classes for 1 month and you have to sit for the placement exams also. Some of the days are such that you have to sit twice or thrice for the placement exams as many companies comes to the college on the same day. So this all happens in 7th semester. After the semester exams the college announce for holidays but the companies still come to college for placements so most of the students stay back and don't go home. Then comes the last semester i.e 8th semester. Placement continues but 80% of the students have been placed till now. So most of the student's time is spend in there rooms only as no classes are there in this semester and only major project is there so the students have to go once a week to the college for attendence. Finally by the month of April the Major project thing is done and students leave for there home in the month of May saying Goodbye to the college life forever. Thank you.

question: How is life in the 4th year ECE in the SRM KTR campus?
answers: 8th Semester in brief - Chill. We used to go to the college barely once a week. Just prepare well for project vivas and have something decent to show to the panelists. 7th Semester - Hectic if you don’t get placed quickly. But don’t worry about attendance, our department will take care of it! You’ll observe CTs getting postponed etc. due to placement exams.

question: I am taking the SRMJEE, KIITEE and VITEEE 2020 all together. I am feeling very stressed. Should I drop one exam? What do I do?
answers: The way I see it, the syllabus for these exams isn't vastly different from your jee preparation. Just think of them as practice exam for jee, they are not nearly as difficult. You might be stressed out thinking about strategies for various exams, and you'd be right. But the strategy for all these exams is mostly the same. It depends on how many questions your attempt in each. Sure there's negative marking, but try to answer as many as possible. The trade off isn't that bad. Just start with the subject you're confident with and move on to the less confident one's. Answer as many questions as pos Continue ReadingThe way I see it, the syllabus for these exams isn't vastly different from your jee preparation. Just think of them as practice exam for jee, they are not nearly as difficult. You might be stressed out thinking about strategies for various exams, and you'd be right. But the strategy for all these exams is mostly the same. It depends on how many questions your attempt in each. Sure there's negative marking, but try to answer as many as possible. The trade off isn't that bad. Just start with the subject you're confident with and move on to the less confident one's. Answer as many questions as possible. In conclusion, don't think of them as separate exams, they're all the same exams spread out on different dates. After you get the admission, it won't even feel like that big a deal. These exams aren't that difficult and no matter which of these Universities you end up choosing, your future will depend upon how hard you're willing to work for anything. All the best. Hope you do great. Feel free to contact me in case you need any help.

question: SRM grading system is different from other universities where 96-100 is considered as the highest while 50 is passing. So I got 7.1 GPA which accordingly is 79%. So should I consider percentage or GPA for calculating for MS abroad?
answers: Hey there! I had the same question when i was in my 3rd year so I’ll try to give you a detailed answer here. Let me just get this out first. You don’t have an option here. All universities that you can apply to ask you to submit a scanned copy or a courier (very few) of the official transcripts . That document contains you marks and grades for each and every subject for the entirety of you course. So your marks and grades will both be visible side by side (its even printed in bold). Now for some other information, only US will care for your grading system, that too very little. In Europe they hav Continue ReadingHey there! I had the same question when i was in my 3rd year so I’ll try to give you a detailed answer here. Let me just get this out first. You don’t have an option here. All universities that you can apply to ask you to submit a scanned copy or a courier (very few) of the official transcripts . That document contains you marks and grades for each and every subject for the entirety of you course. So your marks and grades will both be visible side by side (its even printed in bold). Now for some other information, only US will care for your grading system, that too very little. In Europe they have ECTS which is used to convert your grade into an 12 point system. In Australia, UK,Canada and other educational hubs they only take your scores as is without any conversions. Your scores do matter but not a lot. Just make sure you maintain a decent number but beyond that don’t waste your time on exams. Focus on having a steller CV get good LORs. Those will help immensely. Personal Tip: Only US needs your GRE scores and its wayy to expensive to have your money’s worth these days. Try other countries. BEST OF LUCK!

question: SRM grading system is different from other universities where 96-100 is considered as the highest while 50 is passing. So I got 7.1 GPA which accordingly is 79%. So should I consider percentage or GPA for calculating for MS abroad?

question: Which group are you studying right now in SRM? What is the fee structure of your course? Do you suggest low investment on BTech or heavy investment? Why did you choose SRM?

Normal qouta fees was 2,15,000 Rs and Management qouta fees was 3,60,000 Rs for all branches except Aerospace and Automobile, they were bit costlier than other branches. question: Should I go for MSc biotechnology in SRM University or sit and prepare for a year for IIT jam biotechnology?
answers: Thanks for A2A Dimple It completely depends on your mindset and what you want to do. If you have the patience to study and prepare till JAM examination it is always worth it and you would not regret your decision. Had I been at your place I would have definitely taken JAM one more time. Frankly speaking I do not have any idea regarding Bio-Technology at SRM but I know for sure that the facilities at IITs would be far better than what you would get at SRM. Now as far as India is concerned, job opportunities in Bio-Technology is limited as it is an emerging subject in our country. You would hardl Continue ReadingThanks for A2A Dimple It completely depends on your mindset and what you want to do. If you have the patience to study and prepare till JAM examination it is always worth it and you would not regret your decision. Had I been at your place I would have definitely taken JAM one more time. Frankly speaking I do not have any idea regarding Bio-Technology at SRM but I know for sure that the facilities at IITs would be far better than what you would get at SRM. Now as far as India is concerned, job opportunities in Bio-Technology is limited as it is an emerging subject in our country. You would hardly have any core Bio-Tech companies visiting campuses for recruitment. Can't say exactly about other institutes but at least that's the case in my college. Most of the Bio-Tech guys here either went for non core jobs like software and analytics or they went for higher studies like M.S and PhD. Personally if you ask me research in Bio-Technology has got a much wider scope and opportunities as compared to job sector in the same. Hence I am assuming you if you are planning to study Bio-Technology you would for your masters degree you would also try to go for higher study for which obviously IITs would be preferred by the majority because they are the amongst the best institutions for technical education in our country. Do not get me wrong, I am not saying that SRM is bad but whatever I spoke is based on the general perception. Hence it would be better if you could get in touch with someone who has studied at SRM before taking your final decision because he/she can only tell you the truth about the concerned department wrt to lab facilities, quality of faculties and most importantly the placement scenario over there. Hope this helps and all the best.

question: How's the ECE department in SRM Valliammai Engineering College?

Coming to academics, the department prepares a separate question bank for each and every subject, which can be used by students to learn subjects, with even more clarity and a better approach. The internals are based on the marks obtained in the periodical tests and the assignments you submit for each s Continue ReadingBeing a student of SRM Valliammai Engineering College, in ECE department, I would definitely give a yes. Coming to academics, the department prepares a separate question bank for each and every subject, which can be used by students to learn subjects, with even more clarity and a better approach. We can develop and build project models in our department and also make it better with the help of the staffs. The department conducts seminars, conferences and ,most importantly, enjoyable and informative symposiums where students can exhibit their talents, learn new things and bag a lot of prizes. Also, every semester, we will have a one day industrial visit to various companies which will improve the practical knowledge of students. The department has an excellent set of faculties who are always open to help for the betterment of the students, both in academics and non-academics. On the whole, the ECE department ,in SRMVEC, is one of the best place where education can be at its best.

question: Is it true that the University of Michigan does not offer a direct CS degree to Indian students without doing 2 years of undergraduate studies at SRM University?
answers: This seems to be a piece of incorrect information given to you. The University of Michigan is flexible in offering a major of your choice depending on meeting the eligibility criteria. Although CS being the most sought after subject, a student might find it difficult to get through with ease, as high cut off marks/ranks is required ( it is true for any other institutions as well). However, their minimum eligibility criteria for an Indian student for all major subject is as follows: A certificate representing 12 years of academic education (excluding pre-school or kindergarten years) with an equivalent of first division achievement in senior secondary school is required for freshman application. (Examples: All India Senior School Certificate, Indian School Certificate, Delhi Senior School Certificate, Higher Secondary Certificate). Consideration for transfer admission requires official, externally-issued university mark sheets with First Division achievement for each year of study. These must be sent directly by the “Controller of Examinations.”

question: Which university has more patents to its name amongst SRM and Chandigarh University?
answers: The answer to this is Chandigarh University and the below facts explain my only choice to the question. As per the latest UGC policies, the new Patent policy has pushed many universities to file more patents. Kindled by the call to have more Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs), the higher education sector has witnessed many reforms. The UGC’s call to universities (highlighted above), has come after a series of policy directives to introduce awareness about IP in higher educational institutions. The number of patents applied for, granted and commercialized by universities and institutes is factor Continue ReadingThe answer to this is Chandigarh University and the below facts explain my only choice to the question. As per the latest UGC policies, the new Patent policy has pushed many universities to file more patents. Kindled by the call to have more Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs), the higher education sector has witnessed many reforms. The UGC’s call to universities (highlighted above), has come after a series of policy directives to introduce awareness about IP in higher educational institutions. The number of patents applied for, granted and commercialized by universities and institutes is factored in in the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) rankings with no surprise that the top ranked engineering institutes in India are also the leading filers of patents. The National Assessment and Accreditation Council(NAAC), awards up to 24 points to an institute which sets up an innovation ecosystem and has a facility for identifying and promoting IPRs. Also, the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) model curriculum for its member institutions lays emphasis on the need for IPR education in technical institutes. Chandigarh University being the only university in achieving NAAC accreditation in lesser time strongly believes in filling the IPR’s very often and has moved up the ladder amongst various Universities in India. It has also been recognized for filing over 500 Patents and creating various new National Records.

question: Which university has more patents to its name amongst SRM and Chandigarh University?
answers: Universities have been motivating each of its researchers by providing them all the best possible resources. To answer this let me define what a patent is and why its important to file patents.  A patent is an exclusive right granted by a country to an inventor, allowing the inventor to exclude others from making, using or selling his or her invention in that country during the life of the patent.It does NOT give the inventor the right to use or "practice" the invention, and thus the right is subject to any prior rights that others may have to related inventions. So for example, if you have a paContinue ReadingUniversities have been motivating each of its researchers by providing them all the best possible resources. To answer this let me define what a patent is and why its important to file patents.  A patent is an exclusive right granted by a country to an inventor, allowing the inventor to exclude others from making, using or selling his or her invention in that country during the life of the patent.It does NOT give the inventor the right to use or "practice" the invention, and thus the right is subject to any prior rights that others may have to related inventions. So for example, if you have a patent on a “vessel to hold coffee” and I have a patent on a “handle for a vessel”, then I can prevent you from putting a handle on a coffee cup and you can prevent me from attaching a cup to my handle.A patent is issued to the individual inventor and not to a company, although it is typical practice to have employees assign inventions to their employer.Patent protection is available for any product, process or design that meets certain requirements of novelty, non obviousness and utility. For most categories of inventions, patent protection in the United States lasts for 20 years from the date the patent is filed (under prior law it was 17 years from the date the patent issued).Amongst many patents being filed by Universities in India, let me provide you with the details of recent patents filed by Chandigarh University which have the potential to make a significant impact on society on a local, regional, national and global scale.  Recently, many of the University students & researchers from Bio-technology and Pharmacy contributed greatly in the field of research by filing more than 25 patents in the field of medicine and health sciences making it the University with a maximum number of patents in India.

question: Which language is there in the 3rd semester of CSE at SRM University? What should a 1st year CSE student learn before going to 2nd year?
answers: I believe JAVA is part of the curriculum so you have to learn. Learn any one programming language(C++,Java,python) proficiently and learn the basics of DS and algorithms. Learn how to implement the DS using inbuilt libraries of your language of choice. Also, implement those yourselves to get a better understanding. (Hackerrank is a good platform as it contains questions based on the implementation of the above-mentioned things. Explore the various fields of CS curriculum(AI, Cyber Security, Low level system design, web development, android development etc.) and find your passion among these (I Continue ReadingI believe JAVA is part of the curriculum so you have to learn. Learn any one programming language(C++,Java,python) proficiently and learn the basics of DS and algorithms. Learn how to implement the DS using inbuilt libraries of your language of choice. Also, implement those yourselves to get a better understanding. (Hackerrank is a good platform as it contains questions based on the implementation of the above-mentioned things. Explore the various fields of CS curriculum(AI, Cyber Security, Low level system design, web development, android development etc.) and find your passion among these (I may have missed some). Also start solving problems (easy level on codechef and codeforces once you are good with a specific language and read editorials if you couldn’t solve something. Try to take part in contests to get a glimpse of real world competition, don’t focus too much on rating but on learning initially. Most important of all have fun, take part in different things and explore, but not at the expense of the above-mentioned things. BTW don’t forget to maintain a decent CGPA, but not at the expense of learning. Keep a healthy balance. Stay fit(do some exercise). I guess that's more than enough. Feel free to reach out to seniors who have done something amazing, or even someone like me on linkedin. PS:Make tons of contact these will be really helpful later in your life.

question: Are girls safe in SRM?
answers: Hey, the answer to your question is really subjective. There are in total 4 campuses under SRM Institute of Science and Technology in the states of Tamil Nadu and Delhi NCR. I am a graduate from the Delhi NCR campus which is actually situated on the Delhi-Haridwar Highway. Evidently, I opted for the hostel accommodation because the locality doesn't allow for a safe PG or flat. In my three years of Hostel Life, I realised quite a few points which I shall be jotting down below. The hostel IN timings are strict. There is a timetable followed and every resident is advised to follow that.There is no trace of Ragging. Even though from second year onwards, the juniors and seniors share the same building, the environment is really friendly and homely.The wardens take attendance every night without fail. This point stands in favour of the college for the parents who are contemplating the choice of college for their child.The food in my campus was better than average. Mess had proper menus. There was meal served 4 times a day. Also, the hygiene is clearly standardised and sincerely followed. I have heard of complaints from the Tamil Nadu campuses regarding the quality of food but I didn't face any such issue.These are a few plus points that can help you decide. The only drawback lies within the place it is situated. There are not many superstores around so we used to buy our basic amenities online. I hope I have been of some help. All the best !

question: How is unemployment a myth as claimed by SRM University?
answers: I am doing my Bachelor’s in SRM and I’m in my final year now. I believe I can answer your question. Unemployment is not a myth here. It’s just a promotional pickup line used by the college. But it’s not their fault either. Let me give you a clear insight into what’s going on here. I’m doing my Bachelor’s in Mechanical engineering at Ramapuram campus. There are around 200 students who registered for placements (by paying a fee of 6k) in our department. Out of that, only 2 students got offers from core companies. One guy got placed in a company called Amphisoft Solutions and the other got an offer from Capgemini’s core profile. I would not blame it on the institution but on the economic state that our country’s in right now. The placed percentage in our department is less than 50%. A handful of us got offers from day-one companies (TCS, CTS, Infosys and Wipro). The rest who got placed are placed in sales profiles like byju’s etc. But that’s not the matter at all with CSE and IT departments. I think it’s safe to say that all students with skills (almost 90%) got placed with a decent if not great package. I heard that around 150+ companies visited to recruit from these departments. According to me, if I were to rate placements here it would be something like this: CSE/IT - 4.5/5 EEE/ECE - 3/5 Mech/Automobile/Civil - 1/5 But the placement authorities are trying their best to achieve 100% placements, so I would like to take a moment to credit them from their work. Hope this helps.

question: What are the placements of SRMAP like?
answers: As the first batch will enter the 4th year in June 2020, the placements haven’t happened yet. However, we do have an active placement department headed by the Director of Placements and Industrial Relations from SRMIST, Chennai, which is working to ensure that the placement season is a success.

question: Considering SRMAP is so far from the city, how are the needs of students taken care of?
answers: All the things which we require are available inside the campus. Be it stationary or toiletries or snacks. We have a utility room which provides all the things for daily needs. There is a clinic and a resident doctor for the students. Medicines can be purchased from the campus medical store or can be procured from the nearby town. For medical emergencies, we have a 24x7 ambulance available in the campus which can take the students to nearby hospital.

question: How is the food at SRMAP?
answers: Food at SRMAP is prepared by professional caterers and is a mix of North Indian and South Indian cuisine. The menu is prepared with the inputs of students and is clean and hygienic. We have one main mess for Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and Tea/Coffee/Snacks and 2 more canteens where snacks are served. We have something to eat at most of the times. Even at night, the canteen is operational until 12 am.

question: What is life in SRMAP like for students?
answers: We have classes from Monday till Friday in most weeks. Classes are from 9 am till 4.30 pm with gaps in between. Students are encouraged to get their doubts cleared in their free time as faculty is available on campus. After classes, we are free to make use of the gym or the various indoor/ outdoor games facilities of the University. We also have more than 10 student clubs where students can pursue their hobbies likes photography, videography, coding, drama, debate, etc. On weekends, we get college transport to and from Vijayawada where we can watch movies, visit places or hang around at our favorite restaurants. Apart from this, various students also work with faculties in their research which provides us with hands-on learning.

question: What is the best in these BITSAT, VITEEE, SRM, Satya Bhama, Amrita, GITAMS, Vignanan, KLU, LPU, and BML?
answers: Follow this order in terms of placement and curriculum: BITS>>>VIT>SRM>GITAM>Satyabhama followed by other colleges for CSE and IT. For ECE and EE: BITSAT only. The private universities holds good placement records in IT sectors only. So, core companies are less. Same is the case for Mechanical and Civil. All these branches can sit for IT sectors placement but What is the use of 4 years of knowledge if one cannot donate in industries in his core domain and switching to software domain? Coming to demand in market- Next 10 years, Software and Data Scientist domains are demanding and huge number of ski Continue ReadingFollow this order in terms of placement and curriculum: BITS>>>VIT>SRM>GITAM>Satyabhama followed by other colleges for CSE and IT. For ECE and EE: BITSAT only. The private universities holds good placement records in IT sectors only. So, core companies are less. Same is the case for Mechanical and Civil. All these branches can sit for IT sectors placement but What is the use of 4 years of knowledge if one cannot donate in industries in his core domain and switching to software domain? Coming to demand in market- Next 10 years, Software and Data Scientist domains are demanding and huge number of skilled engineers are needed as technology is growing rapidly day by day (viz a viz Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. So, CS and IT will always remain an evergreen branch for coming years with thousands of job opportunities. Mechanical and Civil will have demand in government sector units like ISRO, BHEL, BARC and some private companies which rarely comes in this college. If they come to recruit, the selection ratio is 2/10 which is very less. Electrical has high demand and it will play important role parallely with CS. Electrical engineers will always be in demand. Electronics and Communication or Electronics and Instrumentation have less chances to get into core companies in these colleges. They have to switch to IT sectors only if they learn good coding skills in the span of 4 years. So to summarize for CS and IT: BITS, SRM, VIT. EE: BITS, VIT. ECE: IIT, IIIT, NIT, BITS only. MECHANICAL AND CIVIL: IIT, NIT, BITS only Hope this helps!

question: Which is better, Ubuntu Snap or APT?
answers: A2A: Which is better, Ubuntu Snap or APT? Each method has advantages and disadvantages. APT is version-specific and uses system libraries and there can be issues with compatibility. As it is system-centric it is also difficult to run different versions of a package if that is required. However, packages are easy to inspect if necessary. Snaps are effectively sparse containers that run the required libraries in a mounted volume. This looks rather untidy with several snaps running and as Mike Milpot says, there are potential issues in that you are allowing snap builders to run software on your mac Continue ReadingA2A: Which is better, Ubuntu Snap or APT? Each method has advantages and disadvantages. APT is version-specific and uses system libraries and there can be issues with compatibility. As it is system-centric it is also difficult to run different versions of a package if that is required. However, packages are easy to inspect if necessary. Snaps are effectively sparse containers that run the required libraries in a mounted volume. This looks rather untidy with several snaps running and as Mike Milpot says, there are potential issues in that you are allowing snap builders to run software on your machine in an unchecked way, including updating it. The snap philosophy seems to be to make a Linux-based desktop Just Work in a transparent way, but compare it to AUR or Flatpak, or indeed MacOS packages, and it seems like a different way of doing it for the sake of being different. EDIT: for various reasons I have ended up switching to Manjaro with GNOME 3, and Manjaro has Snap as well as AUR. As a broad solution it is becoming more widespread. Snap is a modern solution to a common problem but perhaps not the right one.

question: Which is better, Ubuntu Snap or APT?
answers: Snap is a Trojan Horse waiting to happen, plus it’s hugely wasteful! Every package occupies a loop back device. All kinds of duplication happens. Large snap files. Every package is a mount. There has been root attacks through snap.Where a snap comes from is anywhere. It’s literally a Trojan Horse! A remote server could be hacked, and automatic updates that you can not turn off, ends up reeling it in.Ubuntu is seriously falling apart. Every package is a mount. There has been root attacks through snap.Where a snap comes from is anywhere. It’s literally a Trojan Horse! A remote server could be hacked, and automatic updates that you can not turn off, ends up reeling it in.Ubuntu is seriously falling apart. It’s their arrogance behind decisions like this that does it. Looking at the competition, Manjaro for example, they have a similar system called AUR. But it’s optional, and one of its descriptions is this: (quote)If you are looking for some specific Apps that aren’t available in the default Manjaro REPO, you may want to enable AUR which will give you access to thousands of community built and maintained Apps. However, take this with a pinch of a salt. Considering these apps are community driven, not all the apps are regularly updated. In fact, there are several apps that are not updated from past more than 5 years or so. You may want to stay away from such apps as they can cause system stability issue and in the worst case could posses security risk too.(quote) That’s upfront, honest, forthcoming, and makes you think twice using it. With Ubuntu, however, they’re arrogant enough to make you believe that it’s all official and safe.It’s a store, it’s money, that’s what’s in it for them. My distrust in Ubuntu is now at an all time high. I don’t think I’ll be refreshing my Linux boxes to 19.10 or 20.04 next round. I think it’s going to be something Arch based I think. Or Mint. Something, anything. But not horrible stuff like this, where “snap” is being pushed. Chromium, Google open source version of the Chrome browser, allegedly is being pushed to snap. Not on my system it aint! End of day, so long as what you need is available through Synaptic or apt (same thing), you can get by. My fear is that Ubuntu will push more and more into snap. I really do not like those loop back mounts and /snap/core stuff appearing on my system. Plus automatic updates you can not turn off, because its creates thinks he knows better than us. Rrigghhtt…

question: What is the full form of SRMIST?
answers: SRM Institute of Science and Technology SRM Institute of Science and Technology, is a deemed university located in Kattankulathur, Kanchipuram, Tamil Nadu, India, near Chennai. It was founded in 1985 as SRM Engineering College in Kattankulathur, under University of Madras. SRM Institute of Science and Technology includes six campuses, three in Tamil Nadu — Kattankulathur, Ramapuram and Vadapalani, one in NCR Delhi, one in Sikkim and one in Amaravati.

Core placements: Maintaina cgpa above 9.0(relative) or 8.2~8.0 if you want to be placed in a good core company (Cisco, etc). For these pay particular attention to digital systems, digital signal processing also wireless and computer communication. For higher education: Gate: be clear of all subjects from year one onwards the gate syllabus is effectively your 4 year engineering combined syllabus. Gre: start preparing ar Continue ReadingWithout coding you are effectively blocking around 90% of the placements opportunitys in SRM(my rough estimate, might be slightly exaggerated) so these are the options left for you. Core placements: Maintaina cgpa above 9.0(relative) or 8.2~8.0 if you want to be placed in a good core company (Cisco, etc). For these pay particular attention to digital systems, digital signal processing also wireless and computer communication. For higher education: Gate: be clear of all subjects from year one onwards the gate syllabus is effectively your 4 year engineering combined syllabus. Gre: start preparing around 8~12 months before your date of exam for comfort. I haven't prepared or considered giving it so i cant give any concrete advice. Cat: This will also require some dedication and time. If you want IIM's then it will take a lot of dedication and time. My advice start in the third year.

question: I am in 1st year ECE at SRM main campus Chennai and not interested in coding. What's my future? I'm otherwise pretty good in all of my subjects.
answers: If in the area of digital electronics, you can go for hardware design and interfacing. You may not take up a coding job, that’s okay. But make sure you have enough knowledge to read up a user manual of a device and at least write some demo programs. Almost all digital electronics is S/W controlled today. Next, you can turn to analog and mixed signal. That domain is still largely manageable without coding. Communications, DSP, also requires coding. Particularly communications is mathematical, so numeric software is a must.

Lakhs of students take the test.SRM has good reputation in the Northern Part of India.Chennai is one of the prominent city for IT sector.SRM has opened 2 campuses in North and that has popularized its name there and students come here to join main campus as they assume it would be better.And most importantly, there aren't many good private engineering colleges (non-JEE) in india if you leave VIT, SRM, Manipal, KIIT and few others.Due to its multicultural student group, North Indian students find it fascinating because most people from northContinue ReadingSRMJEE is one of the prime engineering entrance exam. Lakhs of students take the test.SRM has good reputation in the Northern Part of India.Chennai is one of the prominent city for IT sector.SRM has opened 2 campuses in North and that has popularized its name there and students come here to join main campus as they assume it would be better.And most importantly, there aren't many good private engineering colleges (non-JEE) in india if you leave VIT, SRM, Manipal, KIIT and few others.Due to its multicultural student group, North Indian students find it fascinating because most people from north haven't interacted with non-hindi peers. So, its one of the best place for cultural as well as academic exposure and development.At last and the biggest reason, placements! The only thing which differentiates SRM from local college is its placements and research output. Rest everything about SRM is below average!

question: Why did more of the non-Tamil people prefer to study at SRM University?
answers: Unlike many city colleges, SRMIST has students studying from different regions, which makes it inviting for non-Tamil students to take up their education in this institution. This multi-culture group allows students to mix and interact with someone from a similar background. This is one of the main reasons for many north Indian students coming to SRM. Apart from this, the institution also offers good academic exposure and professors.

question: Why did more of the non-Tamil people prefer to study at SRM University?
answers: SRM is one of the best private private engineering college. It has more than six campus with three campus in Chennai. This college is top in terms of placement. Education level, PhD holder professors, events, SAP program(abroad learning program) everything is well organized. It is known as best University in all aspects.

question: Why did more of the non-Tamil people prefer to study at SRM University?
answers: I am from central India and at my place SRM has a pretty good reputation. “ Aapka baccha SRM me padhta hai ? Wow! “ Also, the fees for non-btech/medical is pretty decent. The best part is it is huge and multicultural and it is the best place to enjoy college life with freedom.

question: What will happen if no credit subject fails in SRM?
answers: It doesn't matter if a particular subject has credits or not, if you fail a subject you will have to retake it.

question: I am a student at SRM University. If I get an arrear will it be visible on my certificate? Is it mentioned anywhere that I had an arrear?
answers: It will be only mentioned on the mark sheet of the respective semester when you got the arrear(s). When you clear the subject, it will re-appear as passed in the respective semester mark sheet when you cleared the arrear. The consolidated mark sheet in the end does not contain information about history of arrears nor do any companies visiting for placements care about it. Dont worry about it.

question: How is SRM for a BA in English?
answers: It's not bad. The classes are good and the curriculum is versatile which acts as a positive aspect if in future you want to go for specialization. The certificate is valid all over the world which attracts international students from non-english speaking countries to pursue English at SRM.

question: I have 40 marks as internals and 22/25 in practicals in the SRMIST 2019 batch. How many marks should I score in externals to clear the paper?
answers: It requires overall 50 marks out of 100 including both semester and internals. So don't worry you are already clear

question: Why should I choose VIT over SRM?
answers: There are many reasons for choosing VIT Vellore (not Chennai campus) over SRM : Core companies come for placements and select students from respective branches unlike SRM where TCS, cognizant and other IT firms are recruiting Mech, EEE along with software engineering guys.The vibe is more towards academics than clutter of cultural activities hosted to show off their college and get a ranking, which is heavily followed in SRM.Great faculties and no politicians or their politics heads the management in VIT unlike SRMU will find more focus and detailed perspective to face your life even if u fail Continue ReadingThere are many reasons for choosing VIT Vellore (not Chennai campus) over SRM : Core companies come for placements and select students from respective branches unlike SRM where TCS, cognizant and other IT firms are recruiting Mech, EEE along with software engineering guys.The vibe is more towards academics than clutter of cultural activities hosted to show off their college and get a ranking, which is heavily followed in SRM.Great faculties and no politicians or their politics heads the management in VIT unlike SRMU will find more focus and detailed perspective to face your life even if u fail in engineering subjects as the seats are limited and the college hosts only meritorious students and not anyone who bribes donations to get a seat in the campus and then creates ruckus throughout his college life.Less is always the best....Better placements....More merits...Umpteen chances to shine out bright after graduating from the campus.All the very best for ur future endeavors.

question: What is your review of the SRM Chennai undergraduate level?
answers: In SRM Chennai you have many options to explore and find your area of interest which fascinates me, but also there is a huge crowd out there. They give the best placements but you have to strive hard and prove your true self every day by giving your best in everything you do.

question: What are the NRI fees in SRM for an ECE course?
answers: For a duration of four years, you will end up paying about USD 8000 as annual tuition fee and a processing fee of USD 300. For more details you can visit Engineering and Technology. SRMIST has several foreign students studying here. The best part in studying here is the flexibility in the curriculum here. The institution also provides space for research.

question: What are the NRI fees in SRM for an ECE course?
answers: Normal fees in vdp is 2 lakhs In ktr it is 3.5 lakhs So i assume they will 1/2 lakhs more for NRI people

question: Can you stay away from your college in the 3rd year and do any internship sitting at home and still not have any attendance issues in SRM University KTR?
answers: It is near impossible to do an internship and not attend college in your 3rd year. The company will have to be very reputed( Google, Microsoft or DRDO,ISRO level). You will have to get approval from Academic coordinator, HoD and Director. Which might or might not happen. Even if by some stroke of luck you do manage to get all the necessary approvals, you will not be exempt from your coursework and will have to come back for exams. In summation, it's not worth it. Wait for the 4th year because it is much easier then.

question: Can you stay away from your college in the 3rd year and do any internship sitting at home and still not have any attendance issues in SRM University KTR?
answers: No not possible

question: Can we do our final semester project work sitting at home if we do not have any subjects to study in that particular semester in SRM University KTR?
answers: Depends, In your final semester you have 4 reviews as part of your major project. So technically you are needed only 4 times on campus ( if you do not have any subjects to study) But, It all depends on how your project guide and project committee is. In my batch, some guides call students only once for final review. ( All other reviews done by Skype) And other's call every week. So you have to contact your project guide for this. Tip: It helps strengthen your case for staying at home if you have an internship during that time ( preferably from a reputed or alteast known company)

question: Can we do our final semester project work sitting at home if we do not have any subjects to study in that particular semester in SRM University KTR?
answers: No chance, because you will be assigned a guide for your final project and you need to visit yoir guide once a week or maybe more and get attendance. And if you lose two weeks attendance your goes below 75% and you will not be allowed to present your project and have to repeat it next year. Its better you start preparing for gate in this time because you will get a lot of free time because of no. Classes.

question: What do I do if I have missed my university practical exam at SRM University for English (it's a joint course for the 2018 regulation)?
answers: You’re an adult, and you knew that you had this practical exam. You need to go and speak with the professor for your course, with the reason you missed the exam. That person will let you know whether it’s possible to reschedule your exam. What other answer would you expect on Quora?

question: I'm currently studying B.Tech (mechanical) in SRM University (1st year). How can I prepare for the GATE from now? What are some tips?
answers: A2A, Your bachelor college plays no role in your GATE rank. So without any baggage of college (in case any) put your best effort to understand subject conceptually. In first year best you can do is to learn basics and develop problem solving skills. I guess there are not many courses in GATE syllabus from first year curriculum although i suggest to go through GATE syllabus and practice previous year problem hand to hand with regular classes. from second year onward you can have correspondence material or can join any coaching. In third year you will have a better vision and strategy with this y Continue ReadingA2A, Your bachelor college plays no role in your GATE rank. So without any baggage of college (in case any) put your best effort to understand subject conceptually. In first year best you can do is to learn basics and develop problem solving skills. I guess there are not many courses in GATE syllabus from first year curriculum although i suggest to go through GATE syllabus and practice previous year problem hand to hand with regular classes. from second year onward you can have correspondence material or can join any coaching. In third year you will have a better vision and strategy with this you can assess your preparation and add what else is required like Test series or correspondence. I guess this much preparation will be more than enough for anyone to secure a very good rank. P.S.: I suggest to join coaching in third year.

question: I'm currently studying B.Tech (mechanical) in SRM University (1st year). How can I prepare for the GATE from now? What are some tips?
answers: You can start preparing for GATE when ever you want. It is even better while you are studying because you will have access to the library. At SRMIST, Kattankulathur, the library is well-equipped. It has over three lakhs books and 10,000 e-books and e-journals.
