question: How long does SRM convocation last?
answers: The actual function- 2 hours. The registration starts 15 days prior to actual function. Post registration, even if you are unable to attend the convocation, the degree certificate will be posted to your residential address. On the day of the convocation, which usually takes place in the Dr TP Ganesan auditorium ( around 4.5k capacity), only students will be allowed inside, based on first come first serve which is why everyone comes early. Remaining students will be seated in the mini halls and separate rooms will be arranged for the parents. All places will have LED screens with live streaming o Continue ReadingThe actual function- 2 hours. The registration starts 15 days prior to actual function. Post registration, even if you are unable to attend the convocation, the degree certificate will be posted to your residential address. On the day of the convocation, which usually takes place in the Dr TP Ganesan auditorium ( around 4.5k capacity), only students will be allowed inside, based on first come first serve which is why everyone comes early. Remaining students will be seated in the mini halls and separate rooms will be arranged for the parents. All places will have LED screens with live streaming of the function. Breakfast and lunch will be provided to all. The robes will be provided on the day of the function. I think you have to pay the hire fees which you will get back after you return the robe. The function is short but all pictures and selfies make it long lol

question: How long does SRM convocation last?
answers: 1 day exactly only when you done your procedure completely.you are given a link to fill and submit. You can collect your degree in person or by courier. Link: SRM Institute of Science and Technology

question: Does SRM take admission through the JEE Mains in 2020?
answers: No

question: What is the best college, SRM, VIT or Sathyabama?
answers: Of course its VIT. Reasons are: Research And Innovation The VIT faculty and students conduct research in a wide range of topics. The university ranks second in the number of research papers produced every year in the state of Tamil Nadu, behind only IIT-Madras, as mentioned in a report of Scopus, an abstracting and indexing database. Most faculty members, professors and assistant professors both, have published multiple papers. Project-based learning courses are incorporated into the curriculum to encourage further research and project implementation of the subject matter. The PBL courses achieve Continue ReadingOf course its VIT. Reasons are: Research And Innovation The VIT faculty and students conduct research in a wide range of topics. The university ranks second in the number of research papers produced every year in the state of Tamil Nadu, behind only IIT-Madras, as mentioned in a report of Scopus, an abstracting and indexing database. Most faculty members, professors and assistant professors both, have published multiple papers. Project-based learning courses are incorporated into the curriculum to encourage further research and project implementation of the subject matter. The PBL courses achieve the goal of making students conduct research, but the time limitation of a single semester (five months or less) does not assure a very high quality of research or output. However, students are encouraged to do projects outside of class, and lab facilities are mostly accessible for this purpose. The Faculty The faculty at VIT is highly qualified and come from some of the best institutes across the country. The senior professors have PhD students who act as their teaching assistants.  Of Jobs And Internships VIT has a very high placement rate, almost 100%. It has been mentioned in the Limca Book of Records thrice for the highest number of campus placements done from a single institution by a single company. The PAT centre is in charge of the placements done on campus. The VIT outsources placement training to professional companies like SMART Training Resources India and FACE Placement Training, and many highly reputed companies like Microsoft and Amazon recruit from VIT University. Most internships are found outside the university. However, VIT does have a Student Abroad Program. The students can spend a semester abroad in one of VIT’s affiliated colleges all over the world. On the other hand, International Transfer Programs offer a system by which a student spends their first two years in VIT and the next two years in a foreign university. Here’s a quick glimpse of the top IT recruiters over the years2012-13: Accenture(1492), Cognizant(803) and Wipro(1308)2013-14: Accenture(1688), Cognizant(1084) and Wipro(1162)2014-15: Accenture(1324), Cognizant(1911), Infosys(1452) & Wipro(1141) VIT has entered into Limca Book of Records thrice for the highest number of campus placements done from a single Institution by a single company: 2009 (TCS-1075)2011 (Cognizant-1643)2012 (Cognizant-1820)VIT Vellore-Campus Fests Two main college fests are conducted in VIT: graVITas and Riviera. GRAVITAS is a techfest (technology-oriented festival) conducted in August/September. Riviera is a sports and cultural festival. According to organizers for Riviera 2011, it pulled more than 300 participants from over 20 colleges and universities. Rivera 2013 saw popular names like Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy, Sukhwinder Singh, Chiyaan Vikram, Siddarth, singer Kartik, and many more. ParaMek Technologies from New Delhi conducted a workshop on Automotive Engineering during the fest which was attended by more than 450 students.  Cultural Fest Riviera Riviera, the annual ISO certified sports and cultural fest of VIT University with all its splendor and eminence is the biggest in South India one that boasts of the biggest entertainers in the Indian entertainment scenario. The fest holds the record for most numbers of people arms wrestling, the biggest number of people to form a human hand. The four-day extravaganza is a celebration of dance, drama, debate, literature while celebrating the plurality abode. Sunidhi Chauhan at Riviera Gravitas GraVITas is VIT University’s Annual technological and design Carnival. This festival is an endeavor to provide a platform to all individuals to showcase their skills and improve their innovation skills in the fields of technology. The three-day festival sees the participation of students from all across the country and also promotes the exchange of ideas and sparks a collective growth in the development of this nation and its youth.

There is NO demand of such Mtech degree holders in the industry and most of such degree holders become clerks in the services based companies. 2–3 LPA

question: Which is the best SRM campus after KTK?
answers: Being a 4th year student graduating from the KTR Campus, I can tell you a bit about the whole campus scene at SRM. Although it’s true that the KTR campus is the outright primary campus of the institution, there exists a few other campuses in Chennai as well which although not very good but are at a decent level. The first one is the Vadapalani campus which is located inside the city and pretty near to the Vadapalani Metro station. It’s not very big and is not recommended unless you are a city-dweller. The second campus will be the Ramapuram campus which is perhaps the only decent campus that S Continue ReadingBeing a 4th year student graduating from the KTR Campus, I can tell you a bit about the whole campus scene at SRM. Although it’s true that the KTR campus is the outright primary campus of the institution, there exists a few other campuses in Chennai as well which although not very good but are at a decent level. The first one is the Vadapalani campus which is located inside the city and pretty near to the Vadapalani Metro station. It’s not very big and is not recommended unless you are a city-dweller. The second campus will be the Ramapuram campus which is perhaps the only decent campus that SRM has in Tamil Nadu apart from KTR. However if you are looking outside the campuses of Amravati and NCR-Delhi are also decent. Since the Amravati campus is the latest being built so it is better than the rest with more modern amenities on offer for students and staff in general. Hope this clears the doubt you had.

question: Which is the best SRM campus after KTK?

Companies prefer KTR students first. But if you want to have a secondary choice I say go for SRM Vadapalani or Ramapuram. Mostly I will say Vadapalani. SRM Amravati will also be a good choice.

question: What is the dark side of being a student of SRM?
answers: So these are some points that come to my mind in support of this answer: 1.) The teachers won't be able to teach you everything, mainly because of the lack of time and number of students. You'll have to learn on your own. 2.) Getting a high CGPA does not equate to getting a high paying job. There are many things that you should do outside of your course work if you want a high paying job. 3.) You may have several problems with your roommate at SRM. If you want to switch, then it will be quite difficult, they are very reluctant to switch rooms for students, specially if you don't have anyone to sw Continue ReadingSo these are some points that come to my mind in support of this answer: 1.) The teachers won't be able to teach you everything, mainly because of the lack of time and number of students. You'll have to learn on your own. 2.) Getting a high CGPA does not equate to getting a high paying job. There are many things that you should do outside of your course work if you want a high paying job. 3.) You may have several problems with your roommate at SRM. If you want to switch, then it will be quite difficult, they are very reluctant to switch rooms for students, specially if you don't have anyone to switch with. 4.) Your neighbouring rooms in hostel may play loud music and stuff and your warden may not support your desire for peace. 5.) There are too many examinations at SRM. After a while, you'll be exhausted and may even loose interest in learning and start mugging up things. 6.) There are not many holidays for North Indian festivals. For Durga Puja, we get only 1–2 days of holiday. 7.) If you hate hot weather, then Chennai will be hell for you. Specially, of you take non AC hostel. 8.) Chennai area is prone to experiencing extreme weather conditions. There have been cyclones and floods here. I was here during Vardah Cyclone and it was terrible, we were all scared. I had never seen anything like it. 9.) Most of the students will not be focused towards getting a good career. So your friend circle may affect you in a negative way. You just need to choose wisely for this point though. 10.) We get very short break after semester. My friends in other universities get much longer holidays. 11.) You may regret not knowing the local language at times. 12.) The hostels and mess food are over priced. 13.) The fees is too high. 14.) The food here is too oily. 15.) I don't know how, but you may get skin allergies for the first time here. Me and my friends got some weird skin allergies for the first time and we couldn't even get a proper explanation for those. 16.) If you need to travel to the city, then it'll take 1 hour. 17.) There are too many students here. It may become difficult for you to get recognized by some professor or stuff like that. 18.) There are very few lifts and the crowd is huge. The lift management is good though. You won't have to wait for more than 15 minutes for your turn. 19.) At SRM hospital, mostly students will do your check up and they might not be good at it. 20.) The environment becomes stressful at times. This year 3 people committed suicide here. Every year at least 1 student commits suicide. (There are more than 10000 people here.) This is all I can remember. I'll update this space as I recall. Overall SRM is a good college. You'll find that majority of my above mentioned points apply almost to all the colleges. You just need to dig deeper in order to get the information. At the end of the day, you are in control of your life, not anyone else. I have seen several marvelous students coming out of SRM with happy faces, while others cry at petty things. It will be better if you choose a college according to your own taste, comfort level and ambitions. All the best!

question: What is the dark side of being a student of SRM?
answers: You will get stuck in mediocrity if you don't avoid general peer group and peer pressure. You will have world of opportunities but you will still be stuck with average outcome cause you gave in to peer pressure and didn't work hard instead partied everyday! In the end your future will be dark and stuck with 4–5lpa instead of 10+ or even 30lpa

question: What is the SRM semester exam calculation?
answers: There will be 3 internal exams. Cycle test 1 -30 marks (marks will be converted in out of 10).Cycle test 2- 60 marks (marks will be converted in out of 15).Cycle test 3–60 marks (will be converted to 15 marks) 5 marks surprise test and 5 marks will be of assignment.the total will come out to 50.final semester exam will be of 100 marks ( marks will be out of 50).50 marks of semester and 50 of internals total be 100

question: My friend got an arrear in the fifth semester in CSE in SRM. What should she do now?
answers: There is nothing to worry. Tell her to prepare well and she can clear that subject in the next sem. Please keep in mind that recruiting companies generally the ones which allow arrears keep a tolerance of arrears in two papers. Tell her not to get arrears in other subjects in the forthcoming semesters if she wants to sit for placements.

question: My friend got an arrear in the fifth semester in CSE in SRM. What should she do now?
answers: No need to worry. In your next semester , those arrear subjects will be added to your list of exams . So prepared well and clear them in 6th semester itself. Because from 7th semester onwards placement will start and many companies preferred the candidate with no arrears left.

question: How many engineers do mass recruiters hire in SRM, company wise?
answers: They have different number of vacancies every year but they do hire 800+ students per company. Cognizant, Infosys, TCS, Wipro and Accenture combined, give more than 3000+ offers every year in mass recruitment drive where payscale is about 3.5–4.5 lpa. There's a reason they're called “mass recruiter.” PS: Do not go for these companies. Placement Cell will force you to sit in these as they have to provide 100% placement but there's no harm in attending the interview. Just get the offer and aim for core companies. They have better payscale (5–40 lakhs) and most importantly, better job roles. EDIT: Recently got the exact data, This year they made 4000+ offers-

question: Why would someone choose SRM University over VIT University?
answers: I’ll go anonymous for personal reasons. This is a completely honest from the heartkind of an opinion and I’ll keep it as short as possible. This is about SRMKattankulathur(and is probably the only SRM even worth writing a review about). As an engineering college, the number of opportunities you get to prove yourself is extremely high. Don’t expect much from the faculty members but you can get amazing funding for all your ideas and you can even start your own clubs and can make a name for yourself. The campus is amazing and there are floor canteens,ACs in each class room etc. The size of the cam Continue ReadingI’ll go anonymous for personal reasons. This is a completely honest from the heartkind of an opinion and I’ll keep it as short as possible. This is about SRMKattankulathur(and is probably the only SRM even worth writing a review about). As an engineering college, the number of opportunities you get to prove yourself is extremely high. Don’t expect much from the faculty members but you can get amazing funding for all your ideas and you can even start your own clubs and can make a name for yourself. The campus is amazing and there are floor canteens,ACs in each class room etc. The size of the campus is mammoth. You can even make it to MITs if you are dedicated enough and can devote yourself without diversions. But, what ruins it all is SRM itself. They are GREEDY AS FUCK! They cannot limit their intake. They have to have 30,000 good for nothings in the campus. They have to SELL THEIR SEATS. The seats sold is close to 70%. That ruins EVERYTHING. And the result? Mediocrity or even worse. What’s the point in teaching Machine Learning to folks whose only aim in life is to get laid or get a girlfriend? Yes, that’s 80%% of the crowd you meet here. And as you can guess, those folks have made it here by buying seats using their Baap ka paisa. Their new semester’s resolution is not to improve their GPA by studying hard but by improving their malpractice skills. The Telugu crowd is probably the worst(though there are genuine exceptions). The North Indians are the better lot(though again there are exceptions). You don’t need to have be a nerd, but at least maintain some standards close to the alumni produced by other universities. SRM University is the most depressing university one can be in if one’s got any sort of ambitions in engineering. If you haven’t made it to IITs/NITs/BITs stay clear out of such universities. It’s better to join some third grade university and stay in your home town. It’s unimaginably hard working on yourself if you cannot find a single soul who is half as like minded as you are. If you are like the other good for nothings as mentioned above, this place is your heaven. Go ahead! Buy your seat right now. You are a very crucial asset for the university to maintain its TIMES NO. 1 RANKING. Hurry up! The prices tend to increase after a while. Conclusion: SRM University can be a way better university and can even match the standards produced by IITs if it stops being such a prostitute. Adios.

question: What is the global ranking of SRM Institute of Science and Technology?
answers: Hey, it's very difficult to assort a Global rank to a private institution like SRM Institute of Science and Technology when dealing with domain of Universities all around the globe. There are, a few metrics that we can use to determine it's global rank. SRM Institute of Science and Technology ranks 61st-65th in India which depends upon Academic reputation, Placement scope and Citations and Research Capabilities. These rankings will change if you narrowed it down to a particular field but that doesn't govern the overall rank. In the BRICS ranking which involves countries like Brazil, Russia, Indi Continue ReadingHey, it's very difficult to assort a Global rank to a private institution like SRM Institute of Science and Technology when dealing with domain of Universities all around the globe. There are, a few metrics that we can use to determine it's global rank. SRM Institute of Science and Technology ranks 61st-65th in India which depends upon Academic reputation, Placement scope and Citations and Research Capabilities. These rankings will change if you narrowed it down to a particular field but that doesn't govern the overall rank. In the BRICS ranking which involves countries like Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa, it ranks somewhere around 261st-270th. It's Asia rank however, remains in the bracket of 301st-350th. Note that private corporate sites that present University Rankings can't be trusted as some of them ignore institutions and assort orders as per their partnership with the University. Cases like that has happened when private institutions are in question. Now for your answer. What is the global rank of SRM? Esteemed Indian Institutions like IITs and NITs and certain top institutions like Aligarh University, Jadavpur etc. rank in the 150th-600th rank. The top most being IIT Bombay at 152nd. This is based on QS 2020 rankinh which is a global leader in determining University rankings all accross the globe. Note that once you move past the 500 rank mile, determination on exact rank becomes difficult and hence they are alloted a probable rank, for eg- 501–550. Stats show that VIT, which is very similar in all aspects from SRM, has a 701–800 rank index. Safe to assume that SRM Institute of Science and Technology ranks under top 1000 Universities in the world, making it, one of the top 1 percentile college of the world. Hope this helped! Thanks for A2A.

question: Have you gone to bits through SRM?
answers: Yes I have gone both pros and cons of SRM. Firstly I would like to say about Pros, well as a University it has got its own class and reputation. They provide state of the art infrastructure, education and environment. Teachers are highly educated. The campus is serene and decent. In terms of hygiene it is upto the mark. University canteen is big enough to accommodate comfortably. Clean drinking water is provided in each and every department through blue star water vending machine. Both hot and cold drinking water is available round the clock. In terms of cons, the university fee structure is expensive. In terms of administrative matters we need to follow lot of formalities and need to pay each and everytime. So the university administration department will squeeze your pocket upto your last count penny. If you have backlogs or arrears, then you need to pay a hefty amount for each paper. For technical training from reputed companies you need to pay a lot. So University runs on its student wealth. So only thing I can say about SRM University is before you make up your mind to study here please think about your hard earned money first and also wether you can afford in first hand. Then you come to your final decision. So friends that's all I have to say about SRM.

question: How did Dibyanshu Mishra of SRM KTR get into Optum?
answers: The other answer by Karan Shukla answers the process perfectly. If you are asking about the preparation that went into it, I may be able to answer it more effectively(since I am the guy being referred to in the question). The journey started after I didn’t get into IIT/NIT CSE. I had two options drop a year(to try to get into CSE at top NIT/IIT) or go to SRM(CSE). I wasn’t sure of getting CSE at IIT though NIT would have been plausible. I took the latter option. Before joining the college I researched the following: Good companies for CS graduates(product vs service based)Requirements for producContinue ReadingThe other answer by Karan Shukla answers the process perfectly. If you are asking about the preparation that went into it, I may be able to answer it more effectively(since I am the guy being referred to in the question). The journey started after I didn’t get into IIT/NIT CSE. I had two options drop a year(to try to get into CSE at top NIT/IIT) or go to SRM(CSE). I wasn’t sure of getting CSE at IIT though NIT would have been plausible. I took the latter option. Before joining the college I researched the following: Good companies for CS graduates(product vs service based)Requirements for product-based companiesCoding culture of colleges with strong placements(e.g IIIT hyd)How can I emulate a similar culture at whatever college I get intoSuccess stories of Anudeep Nekkanti, Ashish Kedia, Aman Goel, Sameer Gulati, Sumeet Varma (CF rank 1 holder), Gaurav Sen, Rachit Jain etc.After reading their stories I came to know that the computer science branch is the least restrictive branch in terms of opportunities available to unknown colleges. I read the blogs/ medium posts of the above people to know what they did during their college life. Few key takeaways I had from reading their posts: for a true CS-Engineer language is just a tool, his main skill should be problem-solving no matter the question (or its branch)To showcase once adeptness in catching and learning new things one needs to build good projects.Try to have at least one new-age skill such as machine learning.To showcase one’s engineering (ability to solve problems) prowress one needs to solve competitive style questions(not exactly similar but close enough) in interviews.And finally one needs contacts(either in the form of alumni base or other forms such as LinkedIn).Once the above points were clear in my mind, let's just say the rest of my college life was pre-programmed(pun intended). I did the following things: Became decently good at one programming language(C++)Learned all the basic and necessary data structures and algorithms and implemented them until I became proficient in themDid a lot of problem-solving (codechef, hackerrank, geeks for geeks, leetcode, interviewbit, etc.)(currently all time 3rd highest rank in college)Did projects in multiple languages including C++, Python, Java, C# along with multiple frameworks such as dot.net, google cloud services, selenium, flask, etc. and also in multiple domains such as Android development, Backend API development, Web automation, scripting, Windows UI making, etc.Had a great peer group(very very important)such that almost all of them are as successful or more successful than me(or more intelligent than me(so that I always felt inferior)[very important]Watched Boku No Hero Academia(My Hero Academia) to keep myself motivated.Now coming to the placements scenario: (3rd year)Reliance came for internship: couldn’t clear the CGPA cutoff.(3rd year)Microsoft internship: Couldn’t do well due to inexperience with debugging in the mettle platform(used by MSFT to conduct their online assessment)(3rd year)Paypal internship: Couldn’t clear the CGPA cutoff.(After 3rd-year exams): Qualified for finals of Barclays India hackathon(top 20 out of 1000 teams) 50 out of 80 present on the venue were offered job letters, I wasn’t. Reviewed my interview and tried to find things I could improve(4th year) Amazon internship: Again couldn’t do well due to the same mettle platform(couldn’t print debug statements) [highly disheartened after this](4th year) Udaan(udaan.com) [My dream job that I could die for]: In the first round around 80 were selected (out of 3000+) I was one of them. The second round consisted of an implementation problem on hacker earth (I needed 5–10more min than the stipulated time hence rejected).[Quite literally cried that night](4th year) Infosys Power Programmer: Got selected for the final round of PPI of Infosys power programmer by getting top rank in their all India contest, Interviews are yet to be held(probably gonna skip).(4th year) Value Labs: Didn’t wanna get placed in the company to performed poorly in the group discussion round willingly.(4th year) Optum(Tech division of United Health Group): I was probably the only one who solved both the 2 questions in their online round(one consisting of basic DP and the second of a graph problem). During the interview round they gave me some standard leetcode questions, asked me to explain to the solution of the problems I solved in the online round. They also had questions/discussion regarding the projects I did. In the 3rd and final HR round, I was asked the tower of Hanoi problem. The interviewer was more interested in my patience than my problem-solving capability. I remained calm and explained the solution multiple times. Result: SELECTED (top 2 people out 1000+). I(8.4CGPA) was selected over people with 9.5+CGPA reason being learning was my priority over marks. Don’t just learn for exams, learn to be able to solve real-world problems with a specific goal in mind. Everything will fall in place.Many in my college/family congratulated me and said I have settled life now. I was happy but not relaxed, much less settled; because I believe the main journey of life starts after I get out of college. This is just the beginning and I am still a child in terms of my knowledge.

question: Where should I go in SRM KTR to learn and get involved in a startup?
answers: Nowhere in SRM in particular, and to the startup itself. Acquire the skills you need to work at the startup, show interest in their product by either: a. talking to their employees/CEO/CTO and showing some interest. b. Coming up with ideas on how you can improve the product and pitch it to the team. c. Mail their HR person / Developer and ask for an interview. That should get their attention and you can get your foot in the door. How you take it from there is your skills/talent.

question: How should I proceed for my GATE preparation? I am in the second year at SRM University, main campus.
answers: Hemanth (హేమంత్) has given you the right answer. I just want to add my 2 cents. Depending on whether you are better when you work alone or when working with others - you can do one of two things. Join the GATE prep centre/coaching-centre that your classmates/friends join. question: Is LPU safe for girls?
answers: Hello The University has no-compromise policy for the Security of Women and Girls in the University. All the Rules and Regulations are framed keeping in mind the safety of the girls in the campus. A more positive culture is evident at the college and the network is contributing well to promoting and supporting student wellbeing. Students view that college has a very positive environment and total focus is on learning. The management and tutors are becoming more proactive in communicating and consulting with the parent community. The college has the appropriate health and safety policies. These po Continue ReadingHello The University has no-compromise policy for the Security of Women and Girls in the University. All the Rules and Regulations are framed keeping in mind the safety of the girls in the campus. A more positive culture is evident at the college and the network is contributing well to promoting and supporting student wellbeing. Students view that college has a very positive environment and total focus is on learning. The management and tutors are becoming more proactive in communicating and consulting with the parent community. The college has the appropriate health and safety policies. These policies include attendance, stand-downs, suspensions expulsion and exclusion, teacher registration, performance management, and staff appointments. Procedures have also been developed to ensure that policies are appropriately implemented. Some of the Examples of Safety: Hostelers (Girls) are not allowed to go outside the university at any given point of time, to go outside the university, permissions from parents are taken to provide them with the gate pass. The university is secured completely with high walls, barbed wires, security guards and CCTV’s so no loopholes where they can sneak from.24/7 Guarded university with 4500+ CCTV cameras all around the university.Girls have to enter their specific hostels in a specified time duration of 7 pm, and they cannot come out of the hostels as boys are allowed to roam the university till night.NO OUTSIDERS are allowed in the university without a gate pass. Meaning even if parents of students come for a visit, they have access to the university through gate pass only.Girls are handled by the women's security guards only. Illegal substances are strictly forbidden and regular checks are done to make sure such activities do not happen in the university.Hope this helps Thank You

question: Is LPU safe for girls?
answers: I was waiting for a while but this question catches my eye and being a alumni of this University,I can challenge you that Lovely Professional University is safe in all aspects. The major concern of the parents is the security and safety of their children and LPU is well known for its security. Turnstiles gates are there at the entry of hostels so that no other person should enter the hostel. Their are students of all races, communities, cultures, tradition, countries etc studying here in the university from all over India and the world. With quality education, LPU provides good holistic developm Continue ReadingI was waiting for a while but this question catches my eye and being a alumni of this University,I can challenge you that Lovely Professional University is safe in all aspects. The major concern of the parents is the security and safety of their children and LPU is well known for its security. Turnstiles gates are there at the entry of hostels so that no other person should enter the hostel. Their are students of all races, communities, cultures, tradition, countries etc studying here in the university from all over India and the world. With quality education, LPU provides good holistic development of the students to tackle the corporate world and achieve one’s dream. The rules and regulations are very tough in the campus. If someone found doing any kind misbehave inside the campus,strict action is taken by the management against the person. This University have stringent security measures and is Guarded by highly dedicated Security male and Female Guards deputed all around the premises.This University have Centralized Security Control Room with 4500+ CCTV cameras all around the university. Hostelers (Girls) are not allowed to go outside the university at any given point of time, to go outside the university, permissions from parents is taken to provide them with the gate pass. The university is secured completely with high walls, barbed wires, security guards and CCTV’s so no loop holes where they can sneak from. Girls have to enter their specific hostels in specified time duration 7 pm, and they cannot come out the hostels as boys are allowed to roam the university till night. NO OUTSIDERS is allowed in the university without a gate pass. Meaning even if parents of students come for visit, they have the access to university through gate pass only.Any publicly offensive acts are clearly not allowed in the university and strict actions are taken against such act. No boys are allowed to enter the girls hostel at any point of time. If girls enter after the time they are asked to list their name in the late entry register, which is further asked by the wardens during attendance, which is taken regularly. In case of health issues also, they can call ambulance at anytime, and are taken to the hospital with the assistance of the warden. This university has taken every step to prevent it from happening, which has made sure that no such activity takes place inside the university. From security checks at the main gates, hostels and strict rules and regulations and proper surveillance. Like this university and all other universities, institutions have taken a step against it to eradicate this problem and aware people of the same, the government should also impose such restrictions, rules, and regulation to control the problem in the public places as well. Other than this if any girl or boys faces any issues regarding anything that she faces, she can file a complain of the RMS, against that particular issues or person, strict actions are taken immediately by the authorities. Other than this, in case of emotional breakdowns, there are happiness cells available in the university where anyone can go and discuss their problems The Higher Authorities of the University,Mr.Ashok Mittal,Chancellor and Pro-Chancellor, Mrs. Rashmi Mittal personally interact with the students and address the issues on priority and make sure that safety of Student remains a priority as students not only from India,but also from over 70+ countries are studying in the university. Overall, my experience at the LPU has been delightful thus far. I look forward to explore more and ensure that I avail all the benefits provided to us. Hope this will help you!

question: What is the minimum percentage required in 10th and 12th to be eligible for the super dream companies at SRM KTR?

question: Is it true that last year's placement of SRMU was an average of 15L and the highest is 25L from CSE?
answers: I suppose you are talking about Shri Ramswaroop University, Lucknow. That's false advertisement. Shri Ramswaroop group has SRMU (a private university) & Shri Ramswaroop Memorial College of Engineering and Management affiliated to AKTU. All the data is of SRMCEM and they promote themselves with the placement records of SRMCEM. Let me give an example. Robert Bosch came to our college and 20 students were selected from SRMCEM but only 1 student got selected from SRMU. The highest package they are claiming of 26LPA is of a girl from SRMCEM & not from SRMU. One of the boys from IT, SRMCEM (Abhishek Deb) has secured a package of 13 LPA CTC from Samsung R&D and has given interview for Amazon for a package of 24lpa (results awaiting). So the data speaks for itself. SRMU is advertising about what is the achievement of students of SRMCEM. Since both the institutes belong to same authorities, they can advertise anything they want.

A difference of 60,000 per year.Better and bigger brand : NIRF rank 13. Biggest name in private colleges after BITS Pilani.Much better research output : Recently became the highest in the country. Even BTech students are encouraged to publish papers.More companies with better offers . Higher number of Dream and super dream offers.Better campus : The VIT campus is definitely one of the most beautiful in the country. It's lush green in the true sense. The institute promotes this by asking any Guest of honor to plant a tree as a token of their visit to VIT.Lesser hooliganism. You won't find cases of desk and chairs being hurled down from the 10th Storey of the Boys’ hostel in VIT.Better food : No matter how much flak our messes receive from the students , they remain probably the best in any Indian college.Better learning environment : With endless workshops and guest lectures , VIT leaps far ahead in academic areas. This in turns leads to students doing better at international conferences and student clubs and chapters winning national accolades. (IEEE-CS VIT won just last month )10–15 years back , when both of these had just become deemed Universities , the comparison was justified. Now it is simply not. This question should be framed the other way round

question: How are the campus placements in SRM Institute of Science and Technology, Chennai? What was the recent highest package and Average and lowest package offered branch wise?
answers: Placements in SRM are great. You would have to maintain a decent percentage of minimum 60%. A whole of lot companies come and each company has different requirements. Facilties, infrastructure, etc. doesn't differ much among these two. However, number of companies visiting for placement is significantly higher in SRM than JSS. question: Has anyone gotten an academic excellence scholarship in SRM, and how much did we get it?
answers: Yeah i got the academic performance based scholarahip, i was a student of SRM, 2019 pass out, and the scholarship structure of academic performance is like you have to be in the top 10 student list of your department on the respective year, and the list is decided according to your average gpa of both semester in respective year, let me make you more clear, i got scholarship on my third year as in my 5th sem i got 9.4 gpa and in my 6th sem i got 8.6 gpa ,so the gpa of both semester in my third year makes a cgpa(cummulative) of 8.9 ,which includes me on 7th position in my department list, and now the second part of your question HOW MUCH? It will be decided by your rank as i mentioned above i got 7th rank so i got 20k for 7th position and the first ranker got 50k scholarship, so here how’s the flow goes in SRM, Best of luck.

question: How is the PF hostel in SRM?

(only for ground floor to 4th floor)students who will have class in main campus from 2nd year, try not to take this hostel becoz it is 1.8 km from pf hostel.

question: What is the cost for a PG near SRM?

If you are looking for something lavish or for instant a good place with a carefree neighborhood, I suggest you can look for places in Manapakkam. Bharathi Salai and it's adjoining areas are decent to stay but suffer from water and electricity problems. A PG near the college would rougly cost you somewhere between 4,500–6, 500, provided you are good at bargaining. There is a PG available at a distance of about 600 metres from college. It's located at Easwaran Nagar, beside Laundro Cafe. One of my friend stays there and quite likes it. The monthly rental is 10,000 INR. The amenities include Private room, AC, TV, attached washroom, bed, chair and study table and a cupboard. The best advice would be to search for multiple PGs before finalising one, as Ramapuram is not that good a place to stay in.

question: What is the credit system in SRM University Kattankulathur campus?
answers: I think the credit system in SRM is same as everywhere. Till the time you pass you need to have 180 credits to gain the degree. Semester wise the number of credits varies from 23–26 based on your choice of subjects. But you can't have more than 26 credits if subjects in a semester. So if u pass that subject the credit will be awarded to you. In SRM credits for all the Maths subjects is 4(per subject). For the core subjects it might be a 3 or 4 credit course. Some of the subjects are joint courses where the credits are awarded based on your performance in both theory and practical exams. This is  Continue ReadingI think the credit system in SRM is same as everywhere. Till the time you pass you need to have 180 credits to gain the degree. Semester wise the number of credits varies from 23–26 based on your choice of subjects. But you can't have more than 26 credits if subjects in a semester. So if u pass that subject the credit will be awarded to you. In SRM credits for all the Maths subjects is 4(per subject). For the core subjects it might be a 3 or 4 credit course. Some of the subjects are joint courses where the credits are awarded based on your performance in both theory and practical exams. This is the broad distribution of the credit system in SRM. All the best.

question: What is the credit system in SRM University Kattankulathur campus?
answers: If you pass the subject, then you'll get the number of credits that the subject has. For example, the major project has 12 credits, mathematics almost always has 5 credits (As much as I know, that is the highest number of credits a subject can have). You have to secure a total of 180 credits ( according to 2015 curriculum, it has been decreased for the 2018 incoming students) to get your B. Tech degree.

question: How is life at SRM University main campus (Kattankulathur)?
answers: To save you some time, here’s the shortest answer. SRM University. It Sucks. Don’t think of joining here. Join any local/nearby state college, you’ll feel much more contended. Now a long, justified answer, for those having a doubt over my opinion. I am a student of final year, currently pursuing B.Tech from this University. I will trace back my journey from final year, and then leave it up to decide. Back during the joining and counselling time, when I came to Chennai for the first time, I was awestruck by the huge buildings of the campus. I am from a small town, and all these attracted me very qu Continue ReadingTo save you some time, here’s the shortest answer. SRM University. It Sucks. Don’t think of joining here. Join any local/nearby state college, you’ll feel much more contended. Now a long, justified answer, for those having a doubt over my opinion. I am a student of final year, currently pursuing B.Tech from this University. I will trace back my journey from final year, and then leave it up to decide. Back during the joining and counselling time, when I came to Chennai for the first time, I was awestruck by the huge buildings of the campus. I am from a small town, and all these attracted me very quickly. During the counselling, we were made to run from one building of the campus to another building. I was wondering why didn’t they put up the whole admission shit at one place. Poor management has been the college’s forte from a long time I guess. Anyway, this was my first day’s experience of the college. The hostel life was no good. There were some lame rules regarding the wifi, like, it would start functioning only after 6p.m., and only upto 7a.m. I was like “WHAT???!!!”…who does that, they were charging us nearly one lacs for our hostel, and couldn’t even provide wifi for 24 hours. Like this was not enough, all the social networking apps were banned (WhatsApp, Facebook, Instagram, Hike, Viber (Calling App). Still, we managed to use VPNs to access the apps, but the speed was so shitty, that even 1G (had it ever existed) would have worked better than the wifi. Mess food should not even be discussed I guess; we all know what shit they provide at the mess, at every hostel in the country. Coming to academics. The college had one of the shittiest rules anyone might have had ever heard-collared t-shirts/shirts, jeans and shoes are mandatory. One question to the low standard management of the college, WHY? What makes you think that this will bring discipline to the college? One advice, increase the education quality, don’t make some futile rules, nobody respects you all anyway. The faculties are a lot more degraded. They study from this college, and then teach in this college. This tells you how uneducated they are. We were provided books by college for the first 2 years. Most of the boosk were written and published by the faculties of the college itself. Now imagine-studying from SRM, teaching in SRM, then providing the books to the students written by the teachers of SRM. A nursery grade kid could write a better English than these people, kudos to the education of these faculties (or as they would like to call themselves, “PROFESSORS”). The evaluation system was horrible during our time. This is the break-up of the internal marks Cycle Tests (CT) 1 - 10 marks CT 2 - 10 marks Model Exam - 20 marks Surprise Test (Which we knew about a week before, always) - 5 marks Attendance (Yes, trust me!!!) - 5 marks Aaaaand then we had our end sem exam, which had a weight age of 50 marks. So basically, all we had done during our 4 years, is given exams, every damn month. Labs have never been more useless than here. First, we have to make an ‘observation notebook’. Then, we have to copy the exact same thing in a ‘record file’. In Chandler’s way - “Could anything be more useless?” And it doesn’t end here. After writing the record, you have to get the signature of the Lab In charge (who will make you run behind him like you’re his pet), then the HOD (who doesn’t even care to look what’s inside the file), then a stamp from the department office. And what will they do after all this in the University Practical Exam? Punch a hole in the file and give it back to you. You will suddenly have this irresistible urge of ripping the faculty’s body apart and shredding him/her into pieces and feeding it to the stray dogs. Don’t even think of arguing with the faculties. They will make sure that you don’t pass the semester, and will always find an excuse to kick you out of the class, like you’ve been trying sell his both the kidneys (although eventually you’ll wish to do this :D :P ). Once they will find you in some wrong-doing, they will not leave any stone un turned to serve vengeance. The teaching methodology is like something from the medieval period. They will teach you in the dumbest way possible, making the topic all the more obscure, in such a way that the concept will float in front of your eyes in the most haphazard manner. Many seminars, talks, sessions took place in our college. We were forced to attend those, as the faculties had the bait of attendance. They always said that we have to compulsorily attend the seminar, as attendance will be taken there. We knew that nothing as such would happen, still we always fell into this trap, I don’t know why. You all must have heard of the saying - All that glitters is not gold. This fits perfectly for our ‘Fests’. The more they boasted of it to be a grand event, the more hollow it turned out every time. It’s a humble request - don’t ever think of attending the fests. Instead, utilize the 4–5 days’ holiday and just go to any hill-station nearby (there’re many-Coorg, Munnar, Kodaikanal, Ooty are a few to be named). They could’t even welcome John Abraham properly; he was addressed as a “model, and a bollywood actor”. Shame on you, SRM!!! Skipping the sophomore and the 3rd year, jumping straight to the final year, because the nonsense followed suit. This is when you’ll realize how low this college could sink to create a fake impression in front of companies. Infosys was called for a seminar, which the college tagged as ‘pre-placement talk’. And the company came after almost about a month, for the actual placement process. This was done just to make the company feel that the students are interested in their placements. I am from a non CS/IT/Software branch. So obviously I didn’t know anything about coding. We were made to sit forcefully for TCS recruitment process, and were threatened of being removed from the placements if we didn’t attend their training session. Here’s a screenshot of the mail sent by a faculty of mechanical engineeringbranch to its faculties. You can see what kind of sorcery they were doing for us, in the name of ‘helping the students in the placement process’  Now the mail which was sent to us  This was almost a kind of blackmailing. We had no choice but to sit for the placement. And above that, we were made to learn C programming language in 2 days, with a lecture of 2 hours a day. What on earth made them think it was ever possible? So basically, the faculties were deciding in which company we were supposed to sit. Never even my parents had done this, who are they (faculties) to take decision on this subject? Now this is all one person’s view, which is subjective, let’s go in an objective way. Here are some stats Tuition Fees - 1.85 lacs Books Fees - 15 thousand, which just included 6–7 third class quality books, and a drafter and a cheap geometry box, which broke in the first 2 months of usage. We didn’t get the drafter and the geometry box in the 2nd year. CDC Fees - Another 15 thousand, which included only 2 books of Quantitative Aptitude and 1 book on Verbal Aptitude Hostel And Mess Fees - Approximately 98 thousand. A room which was meant for 2 people previously had started accommodating 3 people Laundry Fees - 5/6 thousand (can’t remember it exactly). It was also compulsory, and we were not allowed to give more that 14 clothes in a week, which included only 1 bed sheet. If clothes were extremely, dirty, they would return them without even washing. Many a times clothes were misplaced. Examination Fees - Approximately 2.3 thousand. This is to be paid before every semester exam. Now the hefty fines. ID Card Lost - 1500. By making a DD, they won’t even accept cash. Renewal of ID Card - 1000. Same process Exam Admit Card Lost - 760 If caught cheating/malpractice in the end semester - 10 thousand. All the papers will be cancelled. So to all those people out there, thinking of joining the “Number 1 Private University In India”, please save your parents’ hard earned money, and join any other, I repeat, ANY OTHER COLLEGE IN INDIA, BUT NOT SRM UNIVERSITY. From, A frustrated Engineer

answers: I do not know how some of the students are describing it as great. Bathrooms are even more more worse cant even want to post pic of them .BUT WHEN IT COMES TO HOSTEL LIFE ITS ALL ABOUT FRIENDS.;)  Soo…now you only can decide answer to your question !! BTW MY ANSWER IS - IT SUCKS WHEN IT COMES TO MAINTAINANCE ONLY ONE LIFT WILL B THERE WHICH DOES NOT WORK AT ALL AND EVEN USAGE OF WIFI HAS TIMINGS THATS FROM 4PM-8PM & 9PM -12PM WHICH EVEN SUCK MORE!! MY ADVICE IS DONT JOIN IN SRM AND EVEN IF U JOIN BECAUSE OF FATE DONT JOIN HOSTEL @@ONLY ONCE YOU STEP IN THEN ONLY YOU WILL COME TO KNOW THAT YOU ARE TRAPPED#  Water for bathing at SRM University. You will also get shit pieces. This is the same water they will use to cook. This is hostel. Academics Fortunately for me I'm an alumni. So, I am at much liberty to explain in detail the atrocities students face in this college. It is the most hardworking students made the campus placement success and not the university. Okay, what do you look for in a good college? Good infrastructure, education, technology, placements etc. First of all Chuck all that! Don't even expect the college to provide you clean drinking water or clean restrooms. I'm a 2016 pass out and the CSE department used to be much less crowded like we had hardly 250 people in our batch. Most of the times, the water purifier will not be working and there will be no water to drink. You must carry water from home (luckily my home was quite close) to stay hydrated throughout the day. There was this one time we found a worm in the drinking water and when we complained to the floor in-charge, she promptly whisked away the bottle. She said the problem is being looked into and returned an empty bottle (not that we are going to upload it online or something but the things these people do to cover up stuff). No one to bother. You will see large number of relatives of the Chancellor sitting as employees and telling us that they are his relatives and need not work. What is this? 70% of the time, the restrooms will be stinking and the yucky smell will be gracing the classrooms too. And the best part they will lock the restrooms promptly by 4. I mean, is somebody gonna steal something from there? Food (poor hostellers!)- this one is from them. Though they paid 80,000 mess fees (in 2016, I'm not sure about the fees now), most of them ate food from outside. There was an infamous video on worm infested tea can being used to serve tea in the boys hostel. And 90% of hostellers start living outside from 2nd year to save money paid (rather wasted) as hostel and mess fees. Now that we have covered about your basic needs, let's move to why you are actually there. Education: Books: They will steal money in the name of book fees right under your nose. Rs. 15,000 for some 20 books, 5 records and an E.G set. The best part?I heard the present juniors are not even given these books. None of the books were from the given syllabus. We protested and started buying books on our own from 3rd sem.Faculty : 90% politics, 10% knowledgeable. Very very few professors are actually knowledgeable. Rest are just there to torture you to show other faculty that they are being strict, prim and proper. If you talk back, you might as well sign your death warrant. If you ask questions, they will get irritated and will see to that you get into problem.You'll have to beg them, pacify them blah blah for them to sign your records. Oh how many times they will make you walk back and forth for that dumb record! Rumors fly people! The faculty are more kiddish than the students.And don't wait up for somebody to teach you. No one will. Take a print out of the syllabus paper. Rush to the library. Pick up the needed books. Start learning. Don't expect any faculty to teach you new programming languages or something. You ARE on your own. In KTR campus one of the staff in management department was working in a beauty parlor as a massage madam and she got her PhD in how to run beauty parlors! Shame such teachers are there to teach in a professional university. She will entice students to come her massage cum beauty parlor.Labs: Oh! Our good ole' computer labs. Hardly 10–15 systems worked properly among the 60 or so systems in a lab. Be ready to share.Infrastructure : Dude! Have you seen the cracks on the buildings? And the ongoing construction work? Be ready to navigate among the steel rods, cracked roads, swamp created during and after rain. Don't be fooled by the look of admin office. It's the only decent looking building in the campus. No playground and be ready to navigate from one block to another for VAC class. You will be wasting time to go for VAC. Placements: The ultimate reason why people fall into this crappy institution. that 100% placements record? If you are not placed by the end, you'll be forced to take up BPO job offers so that they can maintain their record. Dress Code: Subject to changes by the floor in-charge. If they are in a good mood, kurti and leggings are allowed. If they are having a bad day, they will literally call you and scream at you for wearing tight clothes. If you are a hosteller, they will ask you to go change and then come attend the classes. What have I learned in the 4 years? Well, I have learned to educate myself, to handle tough people and tough situations. My patience level has gone up after these 4 years. And I did meet and network with a lot of people. Your interpersonal skills will see a boost. You are looted and you are on your own.

question: Can I join SRM (KTR) after the commencement of classes?
answers: Yes, you can. But try not to be too late. A lot of my friends joined after the commencement of classes as they were waiting or were hopeful for the results of some other universities. They did miss some classes and good hostel rooms. Other than that there was no major inconvenience I guess.

question: Can I join SRM (KTR) after the commencement of classes?

If you join late you have to do all the things on your own like doing the Registration and receiving of ID card(if a new admit). But these things are not hectic to do. So no problem.

question: Can I study in the USA for a master’s after doing a B.Tech in CS from SRM Sonepat?

question: Can I study in the USA for a master’s after doing a B.Tech in CS from SRM Sonepat?

question: Does the hostel charge every year in SRM Institute of Science and Technology?

question: Does the hostel charge every year in SRM Institute of Science and Technology?

question: How good is a BBA at SRM University?
answers: Hi there I don't want to give you my name because I still study in SRM and it's my final year , and because of the beuracratic behavior of the staff , we will be detained and forced to pay a fine for pointing out the demerits of this batch. I am from the 2017 batch and I can tell you with all my experience that BBA in SRM is very bad and unprofessional. TBH , This is an engineering university and not a Business school therefore the management doesn't give much importance to the commerce batch. The teaching here is very poor and there is no guarantee in your future as SRM literally works on money Continue ReadingHi there I don't want to give you my name because I still study in SRM and it's my final year , and because of the beuracratic behavior of the staff , we will be detained and forced to pay a fine for pointing out the demerits of this batch. I am from the 2017 batch and I can tell you with all my experience that BBA in SRM is very bad and unprofessional. TBH , This is an engineering university and not a Business school therefore the management doesn't give much importance to the commerce batch. The teaching here is very poor and there is no guarantee in your future as SRM literally works on money. I have known my seniors who worked up tirelessly day and night to get a good standard grade but in the end ,they now work in odd jobs. SRM is just a name in the area and it's fancy building and popular lifestyle attracted many young people like me and but the picture was clearer only during our college time , they give us many promises on internship and job gurantee but nothing like that is there. Only if your celebrity's child or some famous person in the campus , then will you get the satisfaction you require. BBA is nothing in SRM , we taught very badily and given minimum attention and when we complain , the management just ignores us , again like I said , this is a Engineering university , not a Business school. I would strongly recommend that you search somewhere else and not join SRM unless your core is engineering. Engineering is really the best here but as business school student , your output is nothing compared to students from other B-schools. The burden on me has only begun and now as my year ends I have to find a place to work and payback the money to the bank . They once gave me a promise on Jobs and Internship , nothing came and now I have to beg for a job. Please go somewhere else , SRM is buying your future and not protecting it. This is not just my word but the words of the entire batch . Don't let the fanciness get hold of you , you just saw the outer cover. P.S Make your own future

question: How good is a BBA at SRM University?
answers: SRM is good for engineering but like I have always said if you study well every college/University is good.

question: Is CMRIT better than SRM and VIT?
answers: NO ! VIT & SRM are far better than CMRIT. Specifically VIT is a brand now. Getting into VIT could easily help one to get his dream Job as many top notch company visit there for recruitment. CMRIT is no where near to that. It is just a good college i can say where if you study well,keep good academic aggregate and are clear with concepts then here cmrit will help you to get 8+LPA job offer through campus placement. But In case of VIT, If you are eligible to sit for placement by maintaining required cgpa then you’ll be easily placed with 10+LPA package in good company. Getting into VIT could easily help one to get his dream Job as many top notch company visit there for recruitment. CMRIT is no where near to that. It is just a good college i can say where if you study well,keep good academic aggregate and are clear with concepts then here cmrit will help you to get 8+LPA job offer through campus placement. question: What is the daily schedule of activities in the SRM main campus hostel?

question: Will SRM University give me books?

question: Will SRM University give me books?

question: How many students got a 6 LPA package in SRM KTR CSE? Is it really very tough for a CSE student?
answers: I have been in CSE dept and its the best stream for Placements. The IT sector has developed too much because of which every college gives priority to the CSE department. SRM University also gives more importance to CSE students. I graduated this year and i know the Placements have been really good this year specially for the CSE students. Almost everyone got placed in a firm. The companies are divided in Mass-Recruiters, Dream Company, Superdream company, International company. Students get placed in Mass-Recruiter (Around 3.5lpa) very easily. Once students gets placed in these companies, now the Continue ReadingI have been in CSE dept and its the best stream for Placements. The IT sector has developed too much because of which every college gives priority to the CSE department. SRM University also gives more importance to CSE students. I graduated this year and i know the Placements have been really good this year specially for the CSE students. Almost everyone got placed in a firm. The companies are divided in Mass-Recruiters, Dream Company, Superdream company, International company. Students get placed in Mass-Recruiter (Around 3.5lpa) very easily. Once students gets placed in these companies, now they strive for the Dream Companies (5lpa or above). Is it really tough for a CSE student to get into a Dream Company? Answer is NO becuase if you are good in coding, programming, algorithms etc, you can get this job easily. It will be tough for a CSE student to get a job here if he/she dont know much programing but now they can try for a Non-Technical Company like Delloite, KPMG, Mu sigma, ZS Associates and many more. So this year, many students got a Dream Company. I dont remember the exact figures but some are:- TCS Digital (7lpa) - Around 65 studentsMuSigma (21 lakh for 3 yrs) - Around 80 studentsInfosys SES Profile (5 lpa) - Around 45 studentsI don't remember much but You can a Dream Company if have good coding skills. Start doing Competive Coding like on Hackerrank or Codechef. It will help know in growing your knowledge and will make you confident. Make programming as your strong area. Thank you.

question: How many students got a 6 LPA package in SRM KTR CSE? Is it really very tough for a CSE student?

question: Can I get CS with a 154 rank in SRM Sonepat?

question: Can I get CS with a 154 rank in SRM Sonepat?

question: Is it compulsory to wear only collared t-shirts at SRM KTR?

question: Is it compulsory to wear only collared t-shirts at SRM KTR?

question: What happens during the orientation in the SRM KTR branch?
answers: Orientation at SRM generally conduct on first day of 1st year students. There will be very big warm welcome speech by the Dean of the university about SRM and the its culture. followed by Dean, there will be some more speech of HODs, some faculties about the studies and extra curricular activities in the campus followed by the cheif guest of the occasion. followed by them at last comes “SRM Alumini’s” speech. Good Part?: After all the above, you will get a drink and a samosa for sitting quietly more than 2 hours inside the auditorium as a token of appreciation :P

question: What happens during the orientation in the SRM KTR branch?

question: On which paper does the SRM college declaration need to be printed?

question: How is the discipline in SRM KTR?
answers: Discipline is something which comes from inside for every individual. The college is diciplined as compared to North Indian colleges , for instance u have strict timings in hostels after that gates are closed plus if u come 1 min late to class u will be marked absent from most of the faculties. Girls hostel timing is 6 when i used to study there. So they try to maintain there decorum and discipline to the fullest. But if u compare with other colleges of Chennai u will get to know it's least disciplined. At the end I would conclude that it's your perception what discipline is to you.

question: How is the discipline in SRM KTR?

question: What advice would you give to a 2nd year SRM RMP student to get a decent job?

question: As an SRM KTR student, how much money will I need every month for my expenses, food, and travel related stuff?

question: How are the placements at SRM for chemical engineering?
answers: If you want to pursue a job in core Chemical Sector then you have companies like Reliance Industries, Saint Gobain, Tata Chemicals, Hindustan Unilever, Vedanta, Berger Paints etc visiting the campus and offer average package of 5.5lac for GET. To get placed in any of the above you have to have clear concepts of the core engineering subjects with good aptitude. Reliance and Vedanta recruit fairly good number of students or so they did in my batch of 2018. Mass recruiters like TCS, Infosys, CTS and Capgemini along a bunch of others companies come to the campus too average package being somewhat in 3–4lac range. At the end of the day, if its just placement that you are looking for you rest assured you will get placed from SRM KTR campus if you seriously apply for the companies and go for the Interview.

question: Is there an anime club in SRM KTR?

question: How is SRM Haryana in 2019?
answers: SRM University Haryana Campus in 2019 is one of the worst colleges and before you make any sense out of it let me explain in points:- I was about to change college this year as this college was not worth as the new teachers who came this year just don’t know how to teach and moreover half of his class is failed and he still thinks student didn’t study not accepting his fault as result was quite clear that whose mistake it was and I just couldn’t change it because I was debarred (not allowed to sit in final examination) by their rules which are even not in UGC so where they are making it nobody knows and blocking students and forcing them to study with those types of teachers.This year a rule was announced in campus that any student who will score less than 50% marks in internal assignment will be debarred from that particular subject which actually have 30% waitage out of 100% and means that 30% will decide whether we will give that 70% of exam. Playing with the life of children and also charging for those examination fees they never took(that point aside)Above rule was questioned to examination head so he bluffed all children saying it was made by vice chancellor’s decision and the real question here was that SUPPOSE if any trouble was with elections then election commission was responsible not prime minister same no body here knows there work and they intend to play with degrees of children and sure making money out it as charging examination fees again and again.This very same year a teacher teaching in CSE second year two subjects to same class debarred more than 50 students and here the question was if more than half class was failed then whose mistake was this as a teacher is one who concentrate on some below average students, so point here is teachers first didn’t teach properly and if they do so they only concentrate on cream students of class who actually learn from outside institutes and campus ignores it and try to cover it(Proof will be in below point of same). question: Is the SRM Vadapalani campus good, or should I opt for other colleges?
answers: When you graduate, your certificate will have no indication of which campus you graduated from - it will only say SRM University. If you want to know if SRM is worth it, you can read my answer about CSE (It holds true for ECE too). Anirudh Ramesh's answer to Is it worth doing CSE at SRM and in the KTR campus? However, for Mechanical engineering, I will not pick the VDP campus (or any other campus other than the main campus). ECE department in VDP is one of the best I have seen. Computer Science is as good as the main campus. However, save for ECE, for everything else, I will pick the main campus over all others. Especially for Computer Science because - few of the opportunities (Such as internships) are informed first to the main campus students (and on occasion ONLY to the main campus students). There isn’t a huge uproar over this because most students do not know such a thing has happened until much after. Also, you will have a large student group studying with you who will keep you apprised of events that might be of interest to you (Internships, job fairs). This community is naturally smaller in other smaller campuses.

question: How many students are selected for a student abroad program every year from SRM KTR?
answers: I cant answer the total students that go for SIP but I can tell you about my batch. I am 2018 pass out in Chemical Engineering and out of a batch size of 125 roughly, 1 student went for SIP (GPA must be higher than 8.0 I think). Now the thing about SIP is that you do have to pay a handsome amount in fees depending upon the country/college you are going to (roughly 10Lac for US) and upon return you have to give semester exams of the subjects that were in your curriculum in the semester you went for SIP. So basically you will have 2x number of papers to write when you get back. The upside of SIP  Continue ReadingI cant answer the total students that go for SIP but I can tell you about my batch. I am 2018 pass out in Chemical Engineering and out of a batch size of 125 roughly, 1 student went for SIP (GPA must be higher than 8.0 I think). Now the thing about SIP is that you do have to pay a handsome amount in fees depending upon the country/college you are going to (roughly 10Lac for US) and upon return you have to give semester exams of the subjects that were in your curriculum in the semester you went for SIP. So basically you will have 2x number of papers to write when you get back. The upside of SIP which I think is that you do get to experience teaching of a different nation and in that process get your basics of engineering on track.

question: Is it worth it to join a private college for a BTech like LPU, PSIT, and more?
answers: Dear student, from any institution the main thing which you need to gain is the knowledge about the subject or course you are studying. I agree that brand name do matters and people flaunt about being an Indian Institutes of Technology or National Institutes of Technology (NITs) student. But still, one needs to work hard and perform well in placement rounds to secure a good job. You can't compare the IITs and NITs from any other Indian Government Colleges or Private Universities as there is no comparison in such brand names. What is PSIT, i don't know, so now talking about the Lovely Professiona Continue ReadingDear student, from any institution the main thing which you need to gain is the knowledge about the subject or course you are studying. I agree that brand name do matters and people flaunt about being an Indian Institutes of Technology or National Institutes of Technology (NITs) student. But still, one needs to work hard and perform well in placement rounds to secure a good job. You can't compare the IITs and NITs from any other Indian Government Colleges or Private Universities as there is no comparison in such brand names. What is PSIT, i don't know, so now talking about the Lovely Professional University- LPU, as i am an alumni of Lovely Professional University- LPU, i can tell you about the real side of this University from my own experience. LPU is a very young university, only about 15 years old as a stand alone University. Previously it came under I. K. Gujral Punjab Technical University from 1991 to 2006.  But in this 15 years of journey, the university really struggled a lot and because of its #ThinkBig concept and various innovations in curriculum, the university is standing tall and proud with various other very old and reknowned institutions in terms of rankings and accreditations. Now lets talk about the facilities, if you are looking for industry oriented academics, practical based curriculum, professional corporate culture during the college life itself, and a better placement in any fortune company, then Lovely Professional University- LPU is totally worth it. Let me clear you why. Generally the basic factors you see in any university or institute, while choosing it for your future are your desired branch with a good infrastructure, placements, academics, faculties and support.           Again comparison helps when you are confused between the two options. If you have any other options apart from LPU, which forced you to ask this worthy question, then better visit all the options and compare the basic common needs. Honestly, I was confused too before coming here in LPU. For solving this confusion, I looked for the best key points that define the institute as the best education body. I have brief knowledge about LPU, so I can help you with that. 1. Infrastructure: The University is spread over 600 acres which provides each and every facility to their students inside the campus. Well, considering education, well-equipped labs are designed with the experienced faculty and the lab assistants that make you excel in the study.        The faculty members are the student-friendly that you won't regret study in the university. But let me buzz you that we have more than 13,000 CCTV installed in the campus so be careful on your moves.  2. Faculty: Every semester, the syllabus is updated. The faculty members are available all the time of the week so that the student can approach any time of the week. We have lots of experienced faculty members specialised in the certain fields that can help you boost the knowledge, help build up your projects, guide you in your pace of life, any personal or educational issues, etc.  4. Diversity: The University with the most diverse student population. Students from all across the world live in the hostel, which comes closest to being 'a home away from home'. The mixture of races and religions helps to build a decent environment. It’s very exciting because you’ll get a chance to interact with people from different nationalities, cultures and different backgrounds. Being a part of this university is always what I had hoped for from the time my neighbour shared with me his college life experience at LPU.    5. Campus Life: At the end of a tiring day or week, everyone expects entertainment and refreshing ways to uplift their daily boring schedule. But here in LPU, they conduct so many big events where they call popular celebrities and help their students to feel more alive and energetic, which make the life in LPU more of fun.         6. Placements: LPU has excelled in the placement records as students are trained with the professional enhancement program classes, where they teach and educate you about the interview skills and etiquettes. Moreover, the university has been ranked high by outer agencies also with regard to placements of our students. Well let me tell you about recent trends of placements in LPU. As if at the end of your degree, you got a dream package in any fortune company, then according to me everything is worth it. LPU being the Largest Private University in India having 30000+ students studying in more than 200+ courses, which includes 6000+ international students from 70+ countries, LPU has lived up to its expectations, with the quality of education satisfying these international students, the placement opportunities are amazing as well. AA+ Infrastructure including shopping malls, refreshment centers, Largest Private University Accommodation in the world, 13000 + CC cameras, indoor transportation system, University Management System, etc With Quality Education, Placements in LPU is also amazing, with the top brand in the world coming for recruitment provides great opportunities to its students. Some of the Placement opportunities in LPU : More than 550 students hired on a single day by Cognizant, not once but TWICE that is more than 1000 students, which has set a record in the whole of North India.2019, 3 Engineering students offered 28 LPA from AMAZON for their AI SKILLS.LPU’s Business School’s Bachelors students recruited for ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND.MBA students are getting placed at an average package of >4–6 LPA in more than 100 companies. More than 150+ companies have already visited 2017–2017 MBA batch of MBA and nearly all of them are already placed and many of them already on OJT(on the job training) These are some of the companies which come for placements at a very good package for all courses. Hyatt Regency Miami USA and Great Wolf Lodge Wisconsin selected 6 students at the package of 15 Lakh Per Annum.  Hotel Management students are getting placed in the above companies, which LPU has collaboration and tie-ups with.  Agricultural Students are recruited in some of the most well-known companies as above. The talented individual always has the opportunity of getting a gold medal, it is very much possible and what about getting your degree on your convocation from personalities like The President of India, The Vice President of India, His Holiness The Dalai Lama, The President of Mauritius, etc, the list will go on.Overall LPU provides placement opportunities to all the deserving candidates, from all courses. It is up to the student's capability to be able to grab the opportunity or not. Till now thousand of students are placed at a very good package all around the world. Some of the alumni are working in the top 10 brands in the world. I said alumni, that includes me, and working in top brands with a heavy package, even after doing masters or giving any other exam, makes the graduation from Lpu, totally worth it. Now I hope this much content is enough for you to make a decision, and yeah stop depending on others statements, and go and see the reality on the ground. Visit the campus, check the labs, infrastructure, faculty and everything which you wants and then decide. It will help you better. Happy learning. Pictures credit: Official Facebook page of Lovely Professional University.
