question: Should I take Manipal Jaipur CSE or SRM Ramapuram CSE?
answers: Well, when I was in this dilemma, I chose to go to Manipal Jaipur, and all I can say is, so far, it's been the best decision I have ever made. The campus itself is very amazing as well as the hostel life. Academically, we're always learning something new, doing something new, and progressing ahead everyday. Our college focuses on developing it's courses, by asking the students for reviews as well as the companies where their students have been hired, and so this way, we're close to perfecting our curriculum. We're a relatively new college, but still our growth has been exponential and it will ke Continue ReadingWell, when I was in this dilemma, I chose to go to Manipal Jaipur, and all I can say is, so far, it's been the best decision I have ever made. The campus itself is very amazing as well as the hostel life. Academically, we're always learning something new, doing something new, and progressing ahead everyday. Our college focuses on developing it's courses, by asking the students for reviews as well as the companies where their students have been hired, and so this way, we're close to perfecting our curriculum. We're a relatively new college, but still our growth has been exponential and it will keep growing in the coming years. Our faculty is a mixture of young as well as old and they're very modern in their approach. So, we get the opportunity to work on research papers and projects with the faculty and also have various workshops, seminars and conferences which are conducted within our college to promote start ups, and educate students about patents, IoT, Blockchain, Cyber-security etc. When I was researching about colleges, the one thing I thought about the most, was the student to teacher ratio. And when a college like SRM takes in 20000–30000 students every year, and students with 40000–50000 rank get branches like CSE, IT etc. it's just unfair to the rest of the students. The sheer number of students is so much that thinking about the involvement of the faculty with the students and the placement opportunities, Manipal Jaipur would be a better option any day. Since, entry into the Manipal Colleges are solely based on your performance in the entrance tests and there aren't any reservations, therefore due to less number of students, the opportunities you get are far more than what you would get in any other college. You have alot more freedom in MUJ than SRM any day and the 4 years of college are supposed to be enjoyed(with limitations of course). And this is something which you will never have in SRM. We have double occupancy and single occupancy rooms, attached bathrooms, and a lesser number of students who you need to compete with. The possibility of working in projects and research papers, the ability to secure internships abroad through IAESTE, and clubs like ACM IEEE and ECell which organize various talk shows, conferences, seminars, for the all around development of all the students. MUJ ACM Student Chapter being the 2nd best Student Chapter, in ACM India, organizes C, C++, Python, ML/AI, Cybersecurity classes for the students, to help develop their skills, something which isn't seen everywhere. The seniors are very approachable, and forever ready to help you, be it academically to clear your doubts, or non academics related as well.

question: Should I take Manipal Jaipur CSE or SRM Ramapuram CSE?

question: What will be the difference if I study in the Manipal main campus and the Manipal Jaipur campus?
answers: Last year, I was asking similar questions here on Quora. So, I understand the situation you’re in. It’s been 1 year at MUJ for me now. And I certainly don’t regret my decision. In fact, I’m glad. MIT was established in 1957, while MUJ was established in 2011. So yes, there’ll be a difference. But it’s fair to say that MUJ is closing down the gap fast. Most of the things are better at MIT, but there are many things that are better at MUJ too. As a young university, it’s showing great promise and can already boast of remarkable placement stats, an overall good faculty, a plethora of active clubs  Continue ReadingLast year, I was asking similar questions here on Quora. So, I understand the situation you’re in. It’s been 1 year at MUJ for me now. And I certainly don’t regret my decision. In fact, I’m glad. MIT was established in 1957, while MUJ was established in 2011. So yes, there’ll be a difference. But it’s fair to say that MUJ is closing down the gap fast. Most of the things are better at MIT, but there are many things that are better at MUJ too. As a young university, it’s showing great promise and can already boast of remarkable placement stats, an overall good faculty, a plethora of active clubs and chapters, and an awesome coding culture. And remember, there’s an exponential growth in all the above mentioned fields every year. So by the time you graduate, all these things will become even better. MUJ has the backing of the Manipal group, and is also possibly being benefited by the “Institute of Eminence” status of MIT. Apart from this, the Rajasthan Govt. is extending its full support too. This is evident by the setting up of AIC(Atal Incubation Centre) in MUJ. So, there’s nothing to stop it from reaching new heights. Having said all this, MIT is admittedly currently better than MUJ. If you’re getting your desired branch at MIT, go ahead and take it. But if you’re not, MUJ is definitely a good option. A lot of opportunities will be presented to you at MUJ, but it’s up to you to take them, and achieve your goals. Having spent 1 year here now, I’ve seen the rate at which things are scaling up, and the opportunities that are available, and I was amazed and excited at the same time. Because if you want to learn and grow, you’ll find yourself at home at MUJ. The senior-junior equation at MUJ is unlike no other. Everyone is ready to help you. You just have to ask for it. Moreover, the MUJ campus is a “ragging-free zone”. I have never even heard of any ragging taking place here. Adding to it, with all the facilities and resources available in the hostel area, you’ll feel at home in no time. Cheers! (:

question: What will be the difference if I study in the Manipal main campus and the Manipal Jaipur campus?
answers: MIT has been around for over 60 years, while MUJ is just 8 years old. And yet, the number of companies visiting, the overall growth of this college, everything is nothing short of remarkable. This college is growing exponentially, and by the time you graduate, the placements, and everything here will be even better than what it is today. Here's from an excerpt I found: According to my Dad’s professor from NERIST, Anil Sahasrabudhe (currently AICTE Chairman) it will take a minimum of 5–10 years for MUJ to be as good as MIT. He says that looking at the growth it has achieved in a 6–7 years is quit Continue ReadingMIT has been around for over 60 years, while MUJ is just 8 years old. And yet, the number of companies visiting, the overall growth of this college, everything is nothing short of remarkable. This college is growing exponentially, and by the time you graduate, the placements, and everything here will be even better than what it is today. Here's from an excerpt I found: According to my Dad’s professor from NERIST, Anil Sahasrabudhe (currently AICTE Chairman) it will take a minimum of 5–10 years for MUJ to be as good as MIT. He says that looking at the growth it has achieved in a 6–7 years is quite remarkable be it in terms of quality & placements. (Source of the excerpt) You see, MUJ will take a total of 15 years maximum, to reach where MIT took 60+ years. MAHE is putting in amazing amount of efforts into MUJ, by sending professors from MIT, by supplying funds, etc. MUJ also has the backing of Rajasthan government in some form. Also, not to mention, the seniors in MIT don't really care much about the juniors. Whereas, MUJ has probably the most helpful seniors amongst any college in India. If you're willing, you'll get all the help you need, and nothing, believe me, nothing, will stop your growth here. The fact that in just 8 years, this college has an average package of 5.25-5.5LPA, in itself is massive, and speaks volumes. In the past 2 years, the quality of students has bettered substantially. If you want to check the growth of the college, look at the cutoff ranks. For instance, CCE closed at 28k a couple of years back, but closed at 21k last year. Same goes for all branches. Getting admitted into MUJ is getting harder year by year. MUJ is definitely not at the level of MIT yet, obviously. But if you didn't get your desired branch in MIT, and you're getting it in MUJ, I'd say it isn't the end of the world at all. Go for it, work hard, and you'll succeed here. Not to mention, you'll never, ever have problems with settling in or availability of resources in this college, given the amazing infrastructure, and it's North Indian location. Looking forward to seeing you here, soon! ;)

question: I'm joining SRM ktr chemical (2019). How is it ? What do I need to know before I begin with the classes?
answers: Hello, glad to know that you have joined chemical engineering. It's one of the best departments in srm ktr. It has a very highly qualified set of faculties. And compared to many other departments Chemical engineering department is strict in terms of attendance, exams, giving free slots/ free hours. Attendance: almost 90% of faculties would mark you absent if you enter the class after the bell rings, i.e., if you have a class at 8 and if you come by 8:05 or 8:10 they'll mark you absent. And none of the faculties entertain proxy, trust me it's not as easy as you think to put proxy in our department. This is mainly because the department's student strength will be less and within say a week, or two weeks the faculties handling subjects for you would remember you by name and Registration number. Trust me, in other departments take cse, (for example), unless you achieve something very great, faculties won't remember you among the 1000s of students. Exams: So basically, I'd say, cheating in exams is nearly Impossible and I would suggest you to not try that, probably there are people who may try that, but again due to less strength it will be very easy to catch you and they'll totally not tolerate it. Firstly, you wouldn't even need to go to the extent of cheating in exams because the faculties here teach so good. Giving free slots: by the time you come to second year, or let's say in particular from 4th semester you would see many students from other departments chilling out, because they would have been given free slots by faculty, but here, faculties would take up 99% of free slots if possible to take classes. You can take your time to go through the faculties profiles in the website, most of them are from IITs, and have done masters in US, you can also feel free to compare their qualifications with other departments faculties, and you'd find some departments having their heads without a PhD. It has three senior most staffs as well with many years of industry experience. I would say it's one of the most underrated departments in SRM. Nevertheless, in first year none of our department staffs would be handling subjects for you, so whoever handles it and how they handle it, whether or not you get a good experience from faculties in your first year is totally based on your luck. Most important part is about maths, your M3,M4, maths papers that is the maths papers for your second year, will mostly be handled by Prabhakaran sir, he has chosen to stick with our department right after he handled my batch. You will be the luckiest if you get him to handle maths for you. And yeah, chemical students have only 4 maths papers which means you won't have maths after 2nd year unlike other departments. Overall make the best use of the department, it's resources and it's facilities. All the best.

question: Does an air cooler work in SRM KTR?
answers: If you are talking about the auditorium/labs - Yes, they do work (Note: Not all of the classrooms have AC facility). If you are talking about the hostels, few of them have AC facility (This is not a default option and you need to pay extra for this facility). You can find more about them here: Hostel Fee Structure for Academic Year 2019-20 For Senior Students - All Department (Boys & Girls) You cannot bring a water cooler or any kind of heavy electronic appliance (like Ironing machine) into the hostel yourself - there are rules forbidding you to do so - so if you require anything of the sort I would speak with the hostel warden. Surprise checks are conducted which may land you in trouble otherwise. More about hostel rules here: http://www.srmuniv.ac.in/sites/default/files/2018/srm-hostel-rules-2018.pdf SRM Hostels A-Z: http://www.srmuniv.ac.in/sites/default/files/2018/srm-hostel-rules-2018.pdf

question: What does VIT have but SRM doesn't?
answers: -Better placements.VIT has around 300–400 companies visiting but SRM does not have these many companies visiting the main campus to getting the other campuses. -Way better accommodation in VIT hostels at affordable prices. In SRM the AC hostel is expensive and if you plan to shift out then the living conditions aren't that great(Almost every North Indian in SRM shifts out by his 2 years)and you will have to do the following: Arrange for your travel to the college, unlike VIT where you have to travel anywhere from 5–10mins to reach where your class is.You have to manage your food, wifi, electriciContinue Reading-Better placements.VIT has around 300–400 companies visiting but SRM does not have these many companies visiting the main campus to getting the other campuses. -Way better accommodation in VIT hostels at affordable prices. In SRM the AC hostel is expensive and if you plan to shift out then the living conditions aren't that great(Almost every North Indian in SRM shifts out by his 2 years)and you will have to do the following: Arrange for your travel to the college, unlike VIT where you have to travel anywhere from 5–10mins to reach where your class is.You have to manage your food, wifi, electricity yourself-SRM is in Chennai but on the outskirts so you have to travel around 2–3 hours to reach the airport or the main city so this puts Vellore and SRM on the front as even Vellore is about 3–4 hours away from Chennai. -You will find more North Indians in VIT and I did not go to SRM for the above reasons and one being the crowd. I loved the VIT crowd and if you're from Delhi you will like VIT way more than SRM. -FFCS-You can choose what you wish to study and when you wish to study. You can start your classes as early as 8 in the morning and as late as 2 in the evening. -I would not say SRM isn't safe but the moment you shift out which eventually almost every North Indian does in SRM, then your safety is more in your hands. VIT Campus and Hostels are damn safe and guards also cover up a lot of areas near the campus to ensure your security. -We have an amazing cultural fest which comes in the Top 10 fest in India. Think for yourself why is the VIT management seat so much more expensive than the SRM one?

question: What does VIT have but SRM doesn't?
answers: Coming from students of VIT. I have been to both the Universities, and have come to realize that both are at par when it comes to infrastructure, even though SRM is too expensive. You have chances of global exposure in both colleges, courses in SRM are ABET accredited. There are plenty of clubs to cater to your interests. To put it in one line, both colleges will help you to explore your true potential and a wide avenue will be opened to you, and it's entirely up to you where you choose to go. Coming to the controversy of the prevailing Management quota in SRM.*sigh*, yeah this is true, SRM has Continue ReadingComing from students of VIT. I have been to both the Universities, and have come to realize that both are at par when it comes to infrastructure, even though SRM is too expensive. You have chances of global exposure in both colleges, courses in SRM are ABET accredited. There are plenty of clubs to cater to your interests. To put it in one line, both colleges will help you to explore your true potential and a wide avenue will be opened to you, and it's entirely up to you where you choose to go. Coming to the controversy of the prevailing Management quota in SRM.*sigh*, yeah this is true, SRM has a lot of seats assigned for management quota students, and so does VIT, infact so does most private institutes. Students at SRM are mostly hooligans. *sigh again*, well I will be honest, yeah the restrictions posed on us here is a joke. We get all the freedom in the world, late night parties, pool parties, booze, weed, obscene stuff(this is confined within the four walls of ones private place)- you name it and we got it for you on a platter, ready to be served hawt. On the other hand VIT, I believe keeps a much strict watch on their students. But at the end of the day, it solely depends on the student, what he chooses to do with this privilege.

question: Shall I prefer KLU or SRM AP?
answers: Thanks for asking to answer! My choice would be SRM AP. Because you don’t feel like you are in a “college” when u join K L University(sorry KLEF), Because the reason is simple it's just another corporate school. But let me tell you the best part of our College. No records for cse people, Instead you will be writing assignments and ltc which is another nonsense stuff.One admirable thing is LABS. You will be having a lab for every subject in our college. Labs can be really helpful in imparting practical knowledge.Infrastructure is really very good.There are some really great faculty in our college Continue ReadingThanks for asking to answer! My choice would be SRM AP. Because you don’t feel like you are in a “college” when u join K L University(sorry KLEF), Because the reason is simple it's just another corporate school. But let me tell you the best part of our College. No records for cse people, Instead you will be writing assignments and ltc which is another nonsense stuff.One admirable thing is LABS. You will be having a lab for every subject in our college. Labs can be really helpful in imparting practical knowledge.Infrastructure is really very good.There are some really great faculty in our college if you’re interested to learn they will help you in all the ways possible.Project-based Learning for core subjects. (Laptop is mandatory)Improving the curriculum and addition of latest technologies and subjects into class work.A lot of extra-curricular and co-curricular activities, But you have to be careful with the attendance part.And the last and the most important thing is “PLACEMENTS”.This year several product-based companies have come to our college (Amazon, Zoho,ggk, service now, Salesforce,uhg….) and students are placed in those companies with good package.Wipro, Infosys, and Cts will be the major players and they recruit in huge number. This year we had over 950+ placements exclusively for cse students. Placements are really very good.You will get placed for sure if you do a little hard work.Average pay package would be 3.5 lakhs per annum.Another best part is making students INDUSTRY READY.We have PEGA, SERVICE NOW, SAP and SALESFORCE training in the college itself. You can choose any of the above if you’re into that sort. By getting certified in these courses you will have a huge probability of getting placed early.Exclusive clubs for several activities.We have coding clubs if you're into that sort.And the last everything depends upon your hard work alone.Worst part Some of the rules are really worst.You cant enter college without in shirt, shoe and id card.You will be fined 100 immediately if you are not in proper dress code.You will be fined 1000 if you're found using a mobile phone.You have to pay up to 15000 if you're detained in a subject.You have to do 5 certification courses which are nonsense and junk, to be honest. (5k for each course)You will sometimes feel like you’re still in school. :PAnd the list goes on….. :DEvery college has its pros and cons .. I would request you to be extra careful while choosing a college. Because you should not regret joining the same. I have heard that they have raised the college fee to 1.3 lakhs per semester. That’s a huge amount to be really honest. Compare the fee structure with SRM too. Please don’t fall trap for management seat, they will suck the blood out you. And the last I would tell you to visit SRM AP and KLU as well and talk to the students over there so that you can get a clear picture of what’s happening there. DM me if you have any doubts. PEACE!!

question: Shall I prefer KLU or SRM AP?

But SRM AP is far better than that in Chennai from the information gathered. Good hostel facility, sports scholarships, etc. With a bit expensive fee. So I would pick SRM AP from your options.

question: Which branches in SRM University have 100% placement records ?
answers: If the top engineering institutes like IIT’s and NIT’s cannot give 100% placement assurance then how can you think SRM will give this assurance? As we can see today mainly IT companies like TCS,Infosys and many more are coming to hire which recruit in bulk. Apart from these if I speak about core companies they are very less especially in case of mechanical and civil and not to mention new other specializations of engineering like genetics etc. Only CSE,IT,ECE and EEE to some extent get placed upto 70% and the rest… Don’t be fooled. No university in India can give you an assurance of 100% placeme Continue ReadingIf the top engineering institutes like IIT’s and NIT’s cannot give 100% placement assurance then how can you think SRM will give this assurance? As we can see today mainly IT companies like TCS,Infosys and many more are coming to hire which recruit in bulk. Apart from these if I speak about core companies they are very less especially in case of mechanical and civil and not to mention new other specializations of engineering like genetics etc. Only CSE,IT,ECE and EEE to some extent get placed upto 70% and the rest… Don’t be fooled. No university in India can give you an assurance of 100% placement. Yes, SRM is a good university, it has its own brand value and you can certainly learn many things and become a better professional. But if you only joining there for placements, I think you need to re-evaluate your choices. Cheers:)

question: Which branches in SRM University have 100% placement records ?
answers: Srmites get enough opportunity for placements. CSE & IT will get core companies like Amazon, Amadeus etc, but they too need bulk recruiters like TCS,CTS,WIPRO,INFOSYS for 100% Placement. ECE dept students also get opportunity to sit in all companies that come to SRM, including CS & IT cores. Additionally they get few ECE core like KPIT, Siemens etc. ECE manages to get 98% Placement.Mech, civil and other departments get least companies and are mostly placed in BULKS.

question: How many sections are there in the EEE branch of the SRM KTR campus?
answers: Well I will present you with some points which will portray a true picture of what are getting yourself into in case you decide to join SRM University Ramapuram Campus.After that you decide if it suits you or not.Ultimately you should be the one to decide what is best for you. The KTR is little better. InfrastructureThe most important aspect that the SRMites boasts of is their Huge and Well maintained Campus spreading over 250 acres with World Class infrastructure.While this may be somewhat true for the Kattankulathur/the main Campus,the Ramapuram Campus can be brought nowhere into Camparison. TContinue ReadingWell I will present you with some points which will portray a true picture of what are getting yourself into in case you decide to join SRM University Ramapuram Campus.After that you decide if it suits you or not.Ultimately you should be the one to decide what is best for you. The KTR is little better. InfrastructureThe most important aspect that the SRMites boasts of is their Huge and Well maintained Campus spreading over 250 acres with World Class infrastructure.While this may be somewhat true for the Kattankulathur/the main Campus,the Ramapuram Campus can be brought nowhere into Camparison. The thing that you will mostly do in your 1st year CS in SRM Ramapuram(in case you decide to join SRM) is climb from one floor to another as the lifts don’t work in any building.Mostly during Lab periods, expect to go from the 2nd/3rd floor of Admin Block to 5/6th floor of BMS block which in itself will take around 15 minutes from the class.Now you might even be asked to go to 8th floor of BMS block during VAC(Value Added Course) if you belong to an unlucky section.Coming to the Sports facilities you will find nothing but a Basket Ball Court(which the SRMites call the BBC ground) which is no larger than a local school’s playground.Coming to the Lab infrastructure, they do have system with decent specs and a more than decent wifi but the access to the wifi will be blocked :p The only thing you will be allowed to access is Scilab in your 1st semester and Turbo C++ in second.Hell, I even got scolded for using Dev C++ instead of Turbo C while writing a c code.There is no open wifi networks for the students to use anywhere in the Campus, not even in the Library.Even in the Hostels the wifi is restricted from 4pm to 10pm after coming back from college).Coming to the Library, it is similar to my school’s library which is nothing compared to the huge library building you see at Ktr and it is not even air conditioned.But perhaps it doesn’t concern you,is it?Who cares for a huge library with books numbering in thousands…ultimately it is the quality of books and your level of dedication that matters,right?But perhaps you will be shocked to know that except in your 1st class you will never be taken to the library in the 1st year….nor will you be allowed to issue any books.Yes you heard it right, when I went to issue a book on Data Structures(Yes I knew C language and Java fairly well from before) in my 1st semester, the stuff there straightaway told me that we are not allowed to rent/issue books in our 1st year.The only time I was allowed to rent a book for one night was when I lost my “Chemistry for Engineers” book before my Model exam and that too after pleading a lot to the stuff present there.Now does that concern you?2. Quality of Students Depending on your section(which ranges from A-O for the 2016–20 batch) expect somewhere around 45–65% of your classmates to be from Management Quota.Now don’t get me wrong, that doesn’t imply that you won’t find decent students here or students who are admitted under Management quota are inherently bad.The number of MQ students increases as you go down the range from Sec-A to Sec-O as the MQ guys mostly register themselves during the later dates.That being said, you will find many talented guys, some of them may be good Debaters while some may be proficient in Web Development,etc although finding those hidden talents won’t be easy.There are nearly 1k students in CSE department alone(25 sections*avg of 65 students in one section=975 students).Inspite of this they are increasing the number of students admitted every year. 3. Faculty Despite of their advertisement of having World-Class faculties, I would have been very much happy if they were atleast of National level.Instead most of their so-called world-class faculties graduated from Local Universities like Anna University(that includes even our HOD) , Satyabhama University and Srm University itself. If you doubt my words, check the profile of the faculties from this link: Our faculty The faculties have quite bad temper if you get in their wrong side and their way of teaching is way worse than what you would expect from a college that boasts of such statistics.Most of the teachers lack true knowledge and just skim over the subjects they are teaching you. So many times our teacher stopped in middle of the session because she got confused or didn't know the explanation. Many of the core subject teacher simply dictates from their phones in the class and expects you to copy the same in your Laboratory NoteBook and get it corrected the next day(this includes our 1st year co-ordinator(I won’t mention the name here) who taught or rather dictated us Scilab in our 1st semester).And when you successfully blindly copy the same in your notebook you get this-  (kindly ignore my stupid handwriting and the scribbling at the bottom) You know why I got 7 in the 1st experiment.It’s because I didn’t submit it on time…infact the only criteria that determines your marks is submitting the assignment on time.If you do it you will get full marks, irrespective of whether you copied it from your friends or wrote it correctly. And this is not the end; Now kindly look at these pictures    You know why our co-ordinator who dictated us this course crossed the page and made me rewrite the same…because I was supposed to write the date and experiment number on the top left corner followed by the experiment’s title at the center.And this mistake was committed by more than half of the class.Knowledge in SRM is based on such superficial levels where following orders is more necessary than actually learning subject. God knows what they are trying to make us-engineers or slaves who follows orders blindly. At the end we had to resort to YouTube videos and Scilab help command to do well in our Model exams. Most of your time will be spent on copying from Laboratory textbooks onto Lab Record Note. In Chemistry we had to copy the entire book including the diagrams to be eligible to sit for Model Practical. In Physics and Material Science, around 80% of the class will have the same reading and the teachers will be happy to correct it and award you full marks as long as you get it corrected within their specified time frame. The teacher who was assigned to teach us “Computer Hardware and Troubleshooting” couldn’t tell the meaning of ssd when asked by a student in our second class of 1st semester.And she was supposed to teach us about computer hardware….what an irony! In our 2nd semester, the same teacher was assigned to teach us “Programming Development and Laboratory.”Now this is the subject whose concepts form an integral part of CS engineering.And what approach did she follow-she copied a few programs program from the book related to a specific topic to the board and we were expected to write the same program twice-once in the Lab Record and the second time on the SRM sheets.But the plus point is atleast she tried to make us understand the concept to the best of her ability unlike the guy who taught us Scilab.But what the students mostly do is copy the same program into the machine and most still failed to get the output.Most are not even familiar with the syntax of the language and many can’t even write the simplest of programs like prime,palindrome,etc.And they claim to have completed two programming languages by the end of 1st year-C in 1st sem and C++ in 2nd. At the end of 1st year the students who satistfied the attendance criteria are supposed to get the Certificates of Completion of these languages from our VAC instructor inspite of not knowing even the ABC of the language. But the most horrifying aspect is they prefer quantity instead of quality.In the Second semester our PDD teacher literally told us that unless we write 3 pages or more for 12 marks questions, she won’t give us decent marks.I mean seriously…in coding question she believes the more one writes the better it is…while we were always taught in school that the shorter the code the more optimized it is in terms of space and time(atleast true in most cases). 3. Fests and Cultural Events All the fests and Cultural events are conducted in their Kattankulathur Campus and in order to attend so you have t travel there.Now here comes the catch…during those days(take for example the Milan) the ktr people will have holidays but you won’t so you will have to maintain a really good attendance percentage to be given permission to attend those events as you won’t get any ods from the faculty. After this I come to the less important factors which shouldn’t be the deciding factor while choosing a college: 4. Dress Code Yeah what you heard is true-Boys aren’t allowed to wear Jeans or t-shirts or anything that has a round neck.Collared t-shirts and trousers are a must.Girls must wear Salwars and Kurtis and all such stuffs-no jeans or tops.And you must always wear id-cards inside the campus and if you don’t you will face a variety of problems.The first problem will be from the Security Guards deployed at the gate who understands nothing but Tamil, so good luck explaining them why you forgot it.The next problem will be while entering the building as stuffs are present at every gate to check if you possess the id-card or not.If not, you have to write an apology letter and go through unnecessary troubles.Then in various classes you will get reprimanded from various professors for the same reason :p Arrive late at college and the same thing might happen if you aren’t lucky enough to avoid their eyes.But luckily shoes are not a must :) Coming to the possession of cell-phones,rules are that you have to keep it in switched-off mode inside your bag or do not bring it at all.But you can as well keep it in pocket if you are willing to take a little risk as till date no checking have been conducted.But if you are caught using your phone inside the class, you will face a hell lot of a problem unless you are very lucky to be caught by a kind faculty whose chances are extremely rare.Your phone will be seized and submitted to the co-ordinator’s room.Then you have to write an apology letter(irrespective of whether if you are really apologetic or not) and get it signed from class in-charge,co-ordinator,etc to get it back. So, literally forget about College freedom and enjoyment, if you have any such notions. Now compared to the fees charged the ROI is very less as mostly the students gets placed in mass-recruiter company with an average package of 21–25k per month.But i can’t shade much light here as I am not in that phase yet and told what I heard from Seniors.But if you have the capabilities, you can as well acquire the required skills online from various mooc’s and apply off-campus. Now one can only be interested in joining SRM under these circumstances: Your Father owns a business and you just need a degree to run it.You are absolutely certain you won’t get in iits/nits/iiits/bits/lnmiit/jadavpur etc etc even if you drop a year and prepare seriously.You are happy being recruited by an it company with an average package of 3lpa and you don’t have a problem in shelling out some money.Otherwise,you are confident enough that you can acquire the necessary skills online by dedication and practice without the help of your teachers and you can self-finance your B.Tech without applying for any loan.Conclusion: If you still like the things mentioned above, this place is your heaven. Go ahead! Buy your seat right now. You are a very crucial asset for the university to maintain its TIMES NO. 1 RANKING. Hurry up! The prices tend to increase after a while.

question: How many sections are there in the EEE branch of the SRM KTR campus?

Of sections vary with no. Of students.

The reason English prep school is on distinct big area is due to major high schools in Turkey are Turkish medium therefore a big number of Turkish students have go through rigorous  Continue ReadingThe reason there is such distinction is geographical. There is valley betweeb the two campuses which makes them about a couple of kilometers apart. In the late 90s they filled this valley to some extent and made direct road connection. Previously you had to drive 5-6 kilometers.The east campus has more vocational schools and English prep school. Main campus has all the major faculties and university administration. The reason English prep school is on distinct big area is due to major high schools in Turkey are Turkish medium therefore a big number of Turkish students have go through rigorous English learning before they can start taking regular field related courses.

question: How are the professors at SRM and overall? How is the college?
answers: SRM college is one of the best college in the country. As an alumnus, I can proudly say this. Truly speaking, I didn’t realize its potential when I was studying in the college but after graduation the reputation of college has helped my startup to grow phenomenally. In-fact SRM funded most of my projects in my college time and professors are extremely helpful if you are seeking knowledge. The director of Engg and Tech is superb, he sanctioned a mini auditorium for my team to work and research on a project in less than 30 minutes of meeting him. He used to sit himself in the garden to share his  Continue ReadingSRM college is one of the best college in the country. As an alumnus, I can proudly say this. Truly speaking, I didn’t realize its potential when I was studying in the college but after graduation the reputation of college has helped my startup to grow phenomenally. In-fact SRM funded most of my projects in my college time and professors are extremely helpful if you are seeking knowledge. The director of Engg and Tech is superb, he sanctioned a mini auditorium for my team to work and research on a project in less than 30 minutes of meeting him. He used to sit himself in the garden to share his knowledge on most of our projects. I have personally seen the zeal in each one of the professor to teach the best and drive innovation in the campus. There are exceptions as well, as all the fingers are not of same size on your hand. They demand respect and politeness. That’s the key. SRM was ranked at No 2 in India for research last year (combined category of both private and govt colleges), to my surprise I saw this list on a banner placed in IIT Delhi and DTU campus in Delhi. If you wanna compare the infrastructure then SRM is better than any of the govt college. Crowd is chill and it’s more fun in campus. Professors really don’t care if you chill around with your GF/BF. But they demand discipline in campus. If you have extra funds then I suggest you to take semester abroad program.

question: How are the professors at SRM and overall? How is the college?

The mechanical, chemistry, EEE and bio tech department teachers and strict compared to cse teachers. Few teacher are very cooperative and helping while few are not (even schools have same problem so nothing new). You need to find the cooperative ones for help. Overall the faculties are good.

question: Which is better, CS at MUJ or CS at SRM KTR?
answers: I too had the same choice one year ago. I chose CSE at MUJ and after spending one year, I can readily say that I am proud of my choice. The best thing about Manipal colleges is that they do not have management quota.This has a huge impact on the type of crowd present in the college. Literally anyone can get CSE at SRM by paying some extra lacs. On the other hand, only deserving ones are given a chance of studying CSE in MUJ. This will help you a lot in terms of competition faced which will compel you to work hard and improve your skills. Moreover, there is a fear of getting kinda lost in the HU Continue ReadingI too had the same choice one year ago. I chose CSE at MUJ and after spending one year, I can readily say that I am proud of my choice. The best thing about Manipal colleges is that they do not have management quota.This has a huge impact on the type of crowd present in the college. Literally anyone can get CSE at SRM by paying some extra lacs. On the other hand, only deserving ones are given a chance of studying CSE in MUJ. This will help you a lot in terms of competition faced which will compel you to work hard and improve your skills. Moreover, there is a fear of getting kinda lost in the HUGE crowd at SRM KTR. Secondly, the coding culture of MUJ has grown considerably in past few years. The seniors over here are very helpful, you can always reach out to them for any kind of help. The technical clubs have also improved a lot. For example, MUJ ACM Student Chapter was awarded as second best ACM Chapter in India. These clubs like ACM, IEEE etc will help you a lot in improving your skills by conducting workshops, hackathons, codeathons etc. The research facilities are also very good. Almost every faculty has his/her research work which you can join and publish your own research paper. The faculty is quite good. More than half of them are phd holders. Talking about placements, they are good in both colleges. Companies like Microsoft, Dell, Directi, SAP Labs come in MUJ for campus placements. Again, the smaller crowd present here can help you get placed in your dream company. Thus, I would highly recommend you to chose MUJ. You will have the best time of your life here and will pass out with lots of skills.

question: What are the prons and cons in taking the admission in SRM college?
answers: So these are the cons: 1.) The teachers won't be able to teach you everything, mainly because of the lack of time and number of students. You'll have to learn on your own. 2.) Getting a high CGPA does not equate to getting a high paying job. There are many things that you should do outside of your course work if you want a high paying job. 3.) You may have several problems with your roommate at SRM. If you want to switch, then it will be quite difficult, they are very reluctant to switch rooms for students, specially if you don't have anyone to switch with. 4.) Your neighbouring rooms in hostel ma Continue ReadingSo these are the cons: 1.) The teachers won't be able to teach you everything, mainly because of the lack of time and number of students. You'll have to learn on your own. 2.) Getting a high CGPA does not equate to getting a high paying job. There are many things that you should do outside of your course work if you want a high paying job. 3.) You may have several problems with your roommate at SRM. If you want to switch, then it will be quite difficult, they are very reluctant to switch rooms for students, specially if you don't have anyone to switch with. 4.) Your neighbouring rooms in hostel may play loud music and stuff and your warden may not support your desire for peace. 5.) There are too many examinations at SRM. After a while, you'll be exhausted and may even loose interest in learning and start mugging up things. 6.) There are not many holidays for North Indian festivals. For Durga Puja, we get only 1–2 days of holiday. 7.) If you hate hot weather, then Chennai will be hell for you. Specially, of you take non AC hostel. 8.) Chennai area is prone to experiencing extreme weather conditions. There have been cyclones and floods here. I was here during Vardah Cyclone and it was terrible, we were all scared. I had never seen anything like it. 9.) Most of the students will not be focused towards getting a good career. So your friend circle may affect you in a negative way. You just need to choose wisely for this point though. 10.) We get very short break after semester. My friends in other universities get much longer holidays. 11.) You may regret not knowing the local language at times. 12.) The hostels and mess food are over priced. 13.) The fees is too high. 14.) The food here is too oily. 15.) I don't know how, but you may get skin allergies for the first time here. Me and my friends got some weird skin allergies for the first time and we couldn't even get a proper explanation for those. 16.) If you need to travel to the city, then it'll take 1 hour. 17.) There are too many students here. It may become difficult for you to get recognized by some professor or stuff like that. 18.) There are very few lifts and the crowd is huge. The lift management is good though. You won't have to wait for more than 15 minutes for your turn. 19.) At SRM hospital, mostly students will do your check up and they might not be good at it. 20.) The environment becomes stressful at times. This year 3 people committed suicide here. Every year at least 1 student commits suicide. (There are more than 10000 people here.) And these are the pros: 1.) It is an Institution with a huge, very huge population. The number of people in all the branches is constantly increasing every year. 2.) In CSE department itself number of students in my year are around 1300 and my junior batch has around 1500 students. 3.) Quality of education depends a lot upon the teachers you choose or get for the subjects you have chosen. 4.) One thing that I like about SRM Institute of Science and Technology is that it gives us an opportunity to experience diversity. People here are from all over the India and you can see almost every type personalities here. 5.) Hostel facility is decent and infrastructure is fabulous. 6.) The placements are actually quite good here. 7.) You will get a lot of good exposure to a variety of things which I think is important. Overall SRM is a good college. question: Can I get admission in SRM with a rank of 5333 if I missed the counseling session?
answers: Based on my experience, SRMJEEE and VITEE: VITEEE:-Physics: As per my observation, the weightage of class 12 was around 60%. Focus was on Mechanics, Electrodynamics and Modern Physics. Chemistry: There were a good amount of questions from Physical Chemistry. Inorganic had a less share. Organic was based on that of class 12. Both, class 11 and 12 had roughly equal weightage. Mathematics: The focus was on Coordinate Geometry and Calculus. I think class 12 had a greater representation. English: All the questions were from NCERT textbook of class 12SRMJEEE:-Physics: Most of the questions were direct and theoretical. Here too, weightage of class 12 was around 60%. Here also, the focus points were same as that of VITEEE. Chemistry: There was almost equal number of questions from all the three branches. Class 12 had higher weightage. Mathematics: Here too, it Coordinate Geometry and Calculus stole the show. Both the classes had roughly equal weightage. Keep one thing in mind, these exams are held online and have various slots. So you can’t form any general trend for these exams. That is why, I would advise you to not think a lot about trends in these exams. Contact me for Direct Admission

question: Why there are so many bad reviews on SRM?
answers: See one makes a YouTube video about SRM & tells about SRM facts without himself not being from SRM & all facts told r not actually correct SRM bcoz it's quora , YouTube ….etc r free social apps that can be used by anyone & in anymanner so yeah “ don't blindly believe in these facts “ these r actually not correct & just one writes & other copy it's cut copy paste system ruining the minds of youngsters . Yeah SRM can't be compared with the quality of education that is served in IIT’s but yeah among non - IIT institutes it holds a deserving position , SRM focuses more on placements …avg package is not too much (4 lpa ) but SRM focusses on providing placement to all , that's sets it in better position among others …..it's not all people don't get opportunities ….all sort of top companies like vedanta , Microsoft , musigma , Amazon , …… 300+ companies visit each year with minimum of 3.5 lpa to even 38 lpa packages so it's up ur skills that how much u grab here ….. If ur sincere & deserving SRM will surely provide u a good placement opportunity & now grabbing it is on u ……. Facilities r decent ….some r really excellent & others r normal type Labs differ from campus to campus but ktr has one of the best engineering facilities that can be without any doubt compared to top IIT’s in all aspects ….in terms of equipments & development going on …so u utilise that ……other campuses like NCR has decent labs alot better than state top pvt college …..amrawati campus of SRM will soon be in top list of engg college bcoz development pace is really good in that campus Sports at ktr is excellent & others have decent sports facilities But placement for four SRM campus is common so u can study in any (ktr ncr rmp vdl ) u will get equal job opportunity Best of luck

question: Which one is better, the SRM or VIT Bhopal?
answers: Hey :) First of all, Congratulations on your rank achieved in one of India's most prestige exam VITEEE. Let's talk about VIT UNIVERSITY It was opened in 1984, After couple of years of hardwork of Management team, Faculties, Students and all other. It has become No. 1 Private in India (NIRF RANKING). In 2019, VIT has got ARIIA Award from our President of Govt. of India. Talking about Stats VIT is one of the best institutions in India in terms of Placements. In 2018-19 alone, PAT ( Placement & Training Centre ) has made us available to more than 600 companies on campus. Last Year, the highest offer made was 39 lakhs per annum by Microsoft, Dell, Amazon, and many other companies. Let's talk about best emerging campus of VIT i.e. BHOPAL CAMPUS VIT BHOPAL is a new venture of VIT in the heart of India. VIT BHOPAL has many silent features : 1. It has been placed in strategica local in heart of India to attract companies from all over India. 2. It has been placed b/w two INDIA's CLEANEST CITY i.e. INDORE and BHOPAL. 3. It has 150 acres of Green Campus. 4. CALTech - Collaborative and Active Learning through Technology. 5. There is no traditional classes, Only STUDIO TYPE CLASSES. 6. No Back Benchers ;) 7. First VIT Campus to provide unlimited internet access with state of art WAVE 2 Technology 8. FFCS - Trademark of VIT University. and many more. We have one Academic Block to hold students of up to three years, Physics Studio, VIT BHOPAL's highlight EEE Studio, Computer Studio, ENGLISH STUDIO, Gaming Studio, Fully Fleshed Chemistry Lab, Mechanical Lab, BioEngineering Lab, Separate hostels for Boys and Girls with Good Food Quality distributed by CRCL Elior, One food court by UNDERBELLY, one Multipurpose Hall, CTS(Technical and Server Room), Separate hospitals in Hostels, one fully developed Basketball, Badminton court, Volleyball Ground, Kabaddi Ground, Table Tennis in hostels. Some interesting Branches such as 1. CSE with Gaming Technology 2. CSE with Cyber Security 3. CSE with AI and Machine Learning 4. Aerospace Engineering 5. BioEngineering NOTE: Go to any other University, ask them for a Campus tour. If they say Words like 100 % Doctoral Faculty, FFCS, Studio Type Classes, CALTech and PAT, Go to that college. JOIN VIT BHOPAL, You will never regret it. Looking forward to seeing you in July here. Thanks

question: Is there any strict dress code for girls in SRM KTR?
answers: Yes, there are some dress code prescribed by the institution. Girls can't wear round neck T-shirt and sleeveless also they should always wear full jeans and no skirt and all. question: How are the girls' hostels in SRM KTR?
answers: The hostel for girls at SRM University are good enough to stay. Rules are quite rigid within the hostel premises to ensure safety. The atmosphere is lively are there is no ragging of students. Though the food quality isn’t good as they don’t serve any green vegatables and the diet comprises of mostly carbohydrates which isn’t very healthy. Laundry services are provided once in a week. Free medicines and check-ups but you will have some problem to sneek out in first year … First years are required to be back by 6:30 pm. Rest are by 7:30 pm. You get a weekend ' pass' through written permission by your parents which allows you to be out on said days with your 'guradians'. Guardian being boyfriend in most cases. :-p

question: Which is better, SRM Ramapuram or Chandigarh University for CSE?
answers: Chandigarh University is definitely a very good option for Engineering. The placements at Chandigarh University have set high benchmarks in comparison to the other counterparts. B.Tech CSE at Chandigarh University makes you ready for the top notch companies pan India and globally as well. The placement record here is outstanding and the atmosphere to churn your talents into accolades for the institute is just unquestionable. Engineering at Chandigarh University is setting a benchmark every year that is on a subtle higher inclination. Practical teaching and learning methodology, Research oriented studies, placements from Top Notch Multinational companies and excellence centers of globally reputed firms makes Chandigarh University a stand out choice among the ones who want to give their career a free flowing and a satisfying start. It is the only university to have lodged more than 200 partnerships with foreign universities which are well reputed and are within top QS rankings. The highest package offered to the students last year at Chandigarh University was 31.7 lac. More than 500 companies including global IT giant such as Google, Microsoft, Deloitte etc. , and other renowned firms such as Amazon, Wipro, Haier, HP etc. are frequent recruiters here. Chandigarh University believes in developing students completely and not just academically and this is why the Alumni here speak tons in praises of this institute. University Institute of Engineering at Chandigarh University is the best engineering college in Punjab and draws its strength and motivation from the extraordinary support provided by top-notch multinational companies. Since inception, CU has set benchmarks for engineering education & is ranked among the top engineering colleges of North India. The dynamic hands-on experiential learning based engineering education and flexible academic model here which nurtures imagination & innovation, has enabled CU to create engineers who are able to meet the real-world demands. Talking specifically about CSE placements, the highest package offered here was 31.77 lacs in the recent placement session which was offered by Amazon and the average package offered to the students was 4.5 lacs. Chandigarh University has cultivated an environment for the development of data security and management models under the University Institute of Engineering. Collaborating with IBM, the program offers students an opportunity to understand the security issues that now plague the modern day computing architectures all over the world. Moving with the growing times, Chandigarh University has joined hands with IBM and introduced this program with an objective to insert the spirit of innovation and research in this field amongst students. Various resources directly sourced from IBM are made available to students to help them in research and development. The emergence of Data Security has resulted in the opening of various professional avenues for young professionals, creating a market ready for young IT graduates who can understand the risks involved in data security. With lucrative packages, data security has become the new professional direction for many students. Understanding the growing urgency around this field, Chandigarh University has become the first university in Punjab to collaborate with IBM to develop a course in Data Security. Please Note: Preference would be given to student on merit basis in JEE

question: Which is better for CS and IT, SRM or Manipal (mention which campus you're talking about)?
answers: Considering the reviews from my friends who studied at SRM Chennai and Delhi, and MIT Manipal and other campus, I strongly recommend MIT Manipal. I will mention only academics per se in this answer. Pros: Competition for CS/IT in Manipal is generally less ( Placement in SRM is common for all the campus. Around 1000 people from CS/IT come to the main campus in Chennai for placements. You have to be the best among 5 campus students to grab an offer unlike MIT Manipal)Average package for CS/IT in Manipal is around 7–8LPA and goes up to 25–27LPA(Many companies offer upto 15 LPA package). Average pacContinue ReadingConsidering the reviews from my friends who studied at SRM Chennai and Delhi, and MIT Manipal and other campus, I strongly recommend MIT Manipal. I will mention only academics per se in this answer. Pros: Competition for CS/IT in Manipal is generally less ( Placement in SRM is common for all the campus. Around 1000 people from CS/IT come to the main campus in Chennai for placements. You have to be the best among 5 campus students to grab an offer unlike MIT Manipal)Average package for CS/IT in Manipal is around 7–8LPA and goes up to 25–27LPA(Many companies offer upto 15 LPA package). Average package that I am aware of is about 3–4LPA in SRM)Placement rate is almost 100 percent for CS/IT in Manipal and date of joining is generally by August.In terms of education, more focus on student projects and technical clubs.More than two months of vacation during even sem and more than one month vacation during odd sem.Only 20 hours of lecture per week + Two lab session of 3 hrs each per week. You get a lot of time to spend on projects and other stuffs.There is a preference for taking few subjects online in Coursera which carry equal credits as regular lectures.Not so stringent on attending/bunking classes. If you have more than 75%, you are safe.If you are good in Coding and have good technical skills grabbing a 10LPA package is quite easy for CSE/IT/CCE.Cons: More expensive than SRM.Difficult to get admission in MIT Manipal when compared to SRM.I wrote only as per MIT Manipal Karnataka. However, other MIT campus have average reviews.

question: Will I get admission into SRM university if I have AIR 40988 in CSE (what if I failed in the 12th exam because the result hasn't come yet)? What is the process of counseling?
answers: I can answer this question. I got admission into SRM University last year( tho backed out of it). I had an AIR 459 in the SRMJEEE exam and I was getting SRM KTR campus CSE with 100% scholarship . In SRM KTR campus only , there are 1700 seats for CSE and then there's Ramapuram , Vadapalani,Modinagar etc. So the counselling process is such that they make you sit in this gigantic auditorium (Ganesha Audi ig) according to your ranks, and the counselling process goes on according to your rank category. For eg (AIR 1–10000 on 1st day morning shift, 10001–20000 on 1st day evening shift and so on…) If y Continue ReadingI can answer this question. I got admission into SRM University last year( tho backed out of it). I had an AIR 459 in the SRMJEEE exam and I was getting SRM KTR campus CSE with 100% scholarship . In SRM KTR campus only , there are 1700 seats for CSE and then there's Ramapuram , Vadapalani,Modinagar etc. So the counselling process is such that they make you sit in this gigantic auditorium (Ganesha Audi ig) according to your ranks, and the counselling process goes on according to your rank category. For eg (AIR 1–10000 on 1st day morning shift, 10001–20000 on 1st day evening shift and so on…) If you ask me, getting CSE in KTR (or even Ramapuram campus) on your academic basis (rank) is very tough. A huge audience comes along for the counselling from the whole country, massive crowd just to take admission. KTR campus goes off the shelf on the first day itself! What I'd like to suggest you is for management quota admission in KTR campus as the seats are left vacant and then distributed on the basis of management quota( for eg I took admission in that college but backed out because I was getting something good and closer to my house in Delhi, so my dropped seat will then be sold on management quota which goes till about 48 LPA according to a relative of mine). question: What is your SRMJEEE rank 2019?
answers: I got a rank of 3499 in SRMJEEE 2019. Firstly it was a bit disappointing but later, when i checked the criteria for ranking i found out that this rank was not that bad. SRMJEEE was surely way easier than any other exam like JEE or VITEEE. since I have appeared for all of these this year, I can surely give you a fair review of what it was like to appear for these exams. Since the exam was easier so, for sure a higher ratio of people have scored good marks, which leads us to the scenario of ranking in SRMJEEE. This means that the density of the applicants on the top positions is high and a lot of Continue ReadingI got a rank of 3499 in SRMJEEE 2019. Firstly it was a bit disappointing but later, when i checked the criteria for ranking i found out that this rank was not that bad. SRMJEEE was surely way easier than any other exam like JEE or VITEEE. since I have appeared for all of these this year, I can surely give you a fair review of what it was like to appear for these exams. Since the exam was easier so, for sure a higher ratio of people have scored good marks, which leads us to the scenario of ranking in SRMJEEE. This means that the density of the applicants on the top positions is high and a lot of students score the same marks. those who score higher in mathematics are given the top rank, then those with higher marks in physics and if the two are scoring same marks in all fields then the older student is given the preference. So don’t be stressed out in case u have a lower rank. past year analysis of the cut off shows that one with a rank of 10000 can easily get CSE at the main campus of SRM university as a lot of students prefer not to join SRM. Hope this helps. Good luck!

Quora , YouTube …etc are platforms that are open to all & you can write or present anything you want , i’ve checked many quora comments which are actually fake regarding SRM but many others are just copying it & answering quora answers (with majority being those who are not from SRM). Talking of placements , all top notch companies visit SRM each year with a decent package not equivalent to that offered in IIT’s but yeah a decent one ranging from 3.5 to 38 lpa depending on branch your in & batch to batch . Students getting packages of 20+ lpa are less but from each SRM campus few are their each year , majority being placed in range between 4 to 8 lpa ,but yes if ur sincere , getting placed in SRM is not a big deal u’ll surely get a one or more depending on ur skills. Companies visiting SRM campus include Microsoft,musigma , hyundai , saint gobain, vedanta , Amazon ……so on about 350+ companies do visit each year which is really not a bad number . SRMIST chennai has central placement system i.e if ur studying in either ktr , NCR ghaziabad , rmp or vdl campus of SRM u will get chance to sit in all companies visiting to campus without any discrimination . Pls don't blindly follow quora things bcoz most of them r copied once & not correct as well . Hope this helps u & further information u can read my other quora answers .

question: What is your review of SRM University?
answers: To save you some time, here’s the shortest answer. SRM University. It Sucks. Don’t think of joining here. Join any local/nearby state college, you’ll feel much more contended. Now a long, justified answer, for those having a doubt over my opinion. I am a student of final year, currently pursuing B.Tech from this University. I will trace back my journey from final year, and then leave it up to decide. Back during the joining and counselling time, when I came to Chennai for the first time, I was awestruck by the huge buildings of the campus. I am from a small town, and all these attracted me very qu Continue ReadingTo save you some time, here’s the shortest answer. SRM University. It Sucks. Don’t think of joining here. Join any local/nearby state college, you’ll feel much more contended. Now a long, justified answer, for those having a doubt over my opinion. I am a student of final year, currently pursuing B.Tech from this University. I will trace back my journey from final year, and then leave it up to decide. Back during the joining and counselling time, when I came to Chennai for the first time, I was awestruck by the huge buildings of the campus. I am from a small town, and all these attracted me very quickly. During the counselling, we were made to run from one building of the campus to another building. I was wondering why didn’t they put up the whole admission shit at one place. Poor management has been the college’s forte from a long time I guess. Anyway, this was my first day’s experience of the college. The hostel life was no good. There were some lame rules regarding the wifi, like, it would start functioning only after 6p.m., and only upto 7a.m. I was like “WHAT???!!!”…who does that, they were charging us nearly one lacs for our hostel, and couldn’t even provide wifi for 24 hours. Like this was not enough, all the social networking apps were banned (WhatsApp, Facebook, Instagram, Hike, Viber (Calling App). Still, we managed to use VPNs to access the apps, but the speed was so shitty, that even 1G (had it ever existed) would have worked better than the wifi. Mess food should not even be discussed I guess; we all know what shit they provide at the mess, at every hostel in the country. Coming to academics. The college had one of the shittiest rules anyone might have had ever heard-collared t-shirts/shirts, jeans and shoes are mandatory. One question to the low standard management of the college, WHY? What makes you think that this will bring discipline to the college? One advice, increase the education quality, don’t make some futile rules, nobody respects you all anyway. The faculties are a lot more degraded. They study from this college, and then teach in this college. This tells you how uneducated they are. We were provided books by college for the first 2 years. Most of the boosk were written and published by the faculties of the college itself. Now imagine-studying from SRM, teaching in SRM, then providing the books to the students written by the teachers of SRM. A nursery grade kid could write a better English than these people, kudos to the education of these faculties (or as they would like to call themselves, “PROFESSORS”). The evaluation system was horrible during our time. This is the break-up of the internal marks Cycle Tests (CT) 1 - 10 marks CT 2 - 10 marks Model Exam - 20 marks Surprise Test (Which we knew about a week before, always) - 5 marks Attendance (Yes, trust me!!!) - 5 marks Aaaaand then we had our end sem exam, which had a weight age of 50 marks. So basically, all we had done during our 4 years, is given exams, every damn month. Labs have never been more useless than here. First, we have to make an ‘observation notebook’. Then, we have to copy the exact same thing in a ‘record file’. In Chandler’s way - “Could anything be more useless?” And it doesn’t end here. After writing the record, you have to get the signature of the Lab In charge (who will make you run behind him like you’re his pet), then the HOD (who doesn’t even care to look what’s inside the file), then a stamp from the department office. And what will they do after all this in the University Practical Exam? Punch a hole in the file and give it back to you. You will suddenly have this irresistible urge of ripping the faculty’s body apart and shredding him/her into pieces and feeding it to the stray dogs. Don’t even think of arguing with the faculties. They will make sure that you don’t pass the semester, and will always find an excuse to kick you out of the class, like you’ve been trying sell his both the kidneys (although eventually you’ll wish to do this :D :P ). Once they will find you in some wrong-doing, they will not leave any stone un turned to serve vengeance. The teaching methodology is like something from the medieval period. They will teach you in the dumbest way possible, making the topic all the more obscure, in such a way that the concept will float in front of your eyes in the most haphazard manner. Many seminars, talks, sessions took place in our college. We were forced to attend those, as the faculties had the bait of attendance. They always said that we have to compulsorily attend the seminar, as attendance will be taken there. We knew that nothing as such would happen, still we always fell into this trap, I don’t know why. You all must have heard of the saying - All that glitters is not gold. This fits perfectly for our ‘Fests’. The more they boasted of it to be a grand event, the more hollow it turned out every time. It’s a humble request - don’t ever think of attending the fests. Instead, utilize the 4–5 days’ holiday and just go to any hill-station nearby (there’re many-Coorg, Munnar, Kodaikanal, Ooty are a few to be named). They could’t even welcome John Abraham properly; he was addressed as a “model, and a bollywood actor”. Shame on you, SRM!!! Skipping the sophomore and the 3rd year, jumping straight to the final year, because the nonsense followed suit. This is when you’ll realize how low this college could sink to create a fake impression in front of companies. Infosys was called for a seminar, which the college tagged as ‘pre-placement talk’. And the company came after almost about a month, for the actual placement process. This was done just to make the company feel that the students are interested in their placements. I am from a non CS/IT/Software branch. So obviously I didn’t know anything about coding. We were made to sit forcefully for TCS recruitment process, and were threatened of being removed from the placements if we didn’t attend their training session. Here’s a screenshot of the mail sent by a faculty of mechanical engineeringbranch to its faculties. You can see what kind of sorcery they were doing for us, in the name of ‘helping the students in the placement process’  Now the mail which was sent to us  This was almost a kind of blackmailing. We had no choice but to sit for the placement. And above that, we were made to learn C programming language in 2 days, with a lecture of 2 hours a day. What on earth made them think it was ever possible? So basically, the faculties were deciding in which company we were supposed to sit. Never even my parents had done this, who are they (faculties) to take decision on this subject? Now this is all one person’s view, which is subjective, let’s go in an objective way. Here are some stats Tuition Fees - 1.85 lacs Books Fees - 15 thousand, which just included 6–7 third class quality books, and a drafter and a cheap geometry box, which broke in the first 2 months of usage. We didn’t get the drafter and the geometry box in the 2nd year. CDC Fees - Another 15 thousand, which included only 2 books of Quantitative Aptitude and 1 book on Verbal Aptitude Hostel And Mess Fees - Approximately 98 thousand. A room which was meant for 2 people previously had started accommodating 3 people Laundry Fees - 5/6 thousand (can’t remember it exactly). It was also compulsory, and we were not allowed to give more that 14 clothes in a week, which included only 1 bed sheet. If clothes were extremely, dirty, they would return them without even washing. Many a times clothes were misplaced. Examination Fees - Approximately 2.3 thousand. This is to be paid before every semester exam. Now the hefty fines. ID Card Lost - 1500. By making a DD, they won’t even accept cash. Renewal of ID Card - 1000. Same process Exam Admit Card Lost - 760 If caught cheating/malpractice in the end semester - 10 thousand. All the papers will be cancelled. So to all those people out there, thinking of joining the “Number 1 Private University In India”, please save your parents’ hard earned money, and join any other, I repeat, ANY OTHER COLLEGE IN INDIA, BUT NOT SRM UNIVERSITY. From, A frustrated Engineer

question: What is your review of SRM University?
answers: ★★ Hi, I'm a final year student of SRM University and I study in the Ramapuram Campus. Rather than suggesting improvements, this is my honest opinion about whatever I've seen here till now. I was an innocent little kid who came to study engineering here so he could become like my hero, Steve Jobs. But today in my final year, I smoke on an average 6-8 joints a day. Now, I'm not blaming anybody. I know that I'm not a bloody genius but how the hell have I never scored a GPA below 7.6? I wonder what sort of education they provide.Placements: I'm studying Electronics and Communication Engineering andContinue Reading★★ Hi, I'm a final year student of SRM University and I study in the Ramapuram Campus. Rather than suggesting improvements, this is my honest opinion about whatever I've seen here till now. I was an innocent little kid who came to study engineering here so he could become like my hero, Steve Jobs. But today in my final year, I smoke on an average 6-8 joints a day. Now, I'm not blaming anybody. I know that I'm not a bloody genius but how the hell have I never scored a GPA below 7.6? I wonder what sort of education they provide.Placements: I'm studying Electronics and Communication Engineering and I was able to get into a "core" company. A lot many companies come to SRM and also offer high packages but don't forget about the previous point. (Most) People here are just not competitive enough to get those good packages. Also, If you opt to sit for placements and you get a job, the college will refuse to give you a Letter of Recommendation if you later decide to study abroad (i.e while you are in college). Well, inspite of being "India's Number 1 Private University" most students don't get a package of more than 4 lakhs pa.World Class Infrastructure:   I'll talk about Ramapuram Campus first. There are no drinking facilities anywhere. You'll die of thirst but you won't find water in the water coolers and then the lifts don't work. There aren't even dustbins in the classrooms or in the corridors. When it rains the roof leaks. Lab equipments don't work. AC doesn't work anywhere, not even in the library. I don't know when was the last time money was actually spent on repairs/maintenance. Though SRM people are very proficient in opening new food courts to raise more money. In Kattankulathur campus, they have good marvellous buildings but if you look at them, you'd see that they are only marvellous from on side, and the rest three sides are still under construction. The Tech Park got flooded in the Chennai floods and then it got fire about a week ago. So much for world class infrastructure.I pay 1.5 lakhs pa as my tuition fee and on top of it, I'm being forced to shell out an additional 20-25k pa on placement training and value added courses. First of all, they are not a part of the curriculum. Second, these courses are conducted by institutes owned and operated by SRM (like  Sai Career). Placement Training is compulsory even for students who don't wish to sit for placements and even for people who don't need them. Who is SRM to decide if I need to attend placement training classes or not? And I have to compulsorily buy books from the college book store. There is no grievance redressal anywhere. If you go against the management or the faculty, they'll harass you till the point you lose all your self confidence.Teachers are not world class as advertised.  The Curriculum sucks, it can make you well educated not not talented. The curriculum in no way can help a person who just wants a job. Academics and Vocational Training are two different things. If somebody wants to do well in life, that somebody can't rely on any "SRM". I hate the fact that I had to sit and waste my time attending classes given by stupid teachers. My HOD doesn't even have a PHD.When I sat for counselling, there were about 100 seats per stream but when I joined the college, I had 300 students in my batch in my department alone. And then they write on their website that they don't have a management quota. Now, I sit with stupid incompetent people who are only here because they had some extra money on them.SRM in my opinion is a huge money making scam. Mind you, education should be not for profit. SRM here makes people attend stupid placement training classes for the whole four years and now I ask you, can four years of placement training not make you good enough to get a job? But sorry to say, four years of placement training will get you a job, but not skilled enough to stay on the job. Most of the people here still don't know in which field they want to work in. Every year, thousands get placed from SRM mostly for jobs that pay not more than 3.5 lakhs pa and then SRM runs advertisements on all national papers but they don't say how much on an average a SRM graduate earns. Then thousand sit for SRMEEE and then many join SRM. SRM in the end earns a lot of money and nobody has a clue about what it does.This is just my opinion and if you feel that I'm wrong, please, let me know. And if you think I'm right, please let's do something about it. Consumer Court? We've been promised a future and in the name of it, we've only been taken advantage of by these greedy immoral giants.

question: How many marks should one get for CS in SRM to be on the safe side?
answers: There are 4 campus of Srmist For kTR ( Main Campus ) - your rank should be below 1000 for getting admission through category For rank above 1000 you have to pay 3.5lakh tution fees per year. For rank below 1000 you can expect 295+ out of 315. For Ramapuram campus - you have to pay 2lakh tutionns fees per year and that depends on no of seats available. But for safer side you can expect 180+ out of 315 . For other campuses you can compare above twwo statistics.

question: How many marks should one get for CS in SRM to be on the safe side?
answers: Different marks for different campus choice for SRMJEE. For SRM main campus, rank must be below 5k for CS. For different campuses in Chennai itself, rank < 10k-15k. For SRM Modinagar or Sonipat Campus , rank < 40k. P.S. ~ 1K = 1000For rank within 40k , min. marks scored must be around 160.

question: Is taking computer science at SRM University Kattankulathur worth it, and how are the placements for computer science students?

question: How is GITAM Vizag, different from VIT and SRM -AP?
answers: GITAM Vizag has NAAC accreditation of A+ till 2022 with institutional CGPA 3.53 VIT Vellore has NAAC accreditation of A till 2020 with institutional CGPA 3.42 SRM Kanchipuram has NAAC accreditation of A++ till 2023 with institutional CGPA 3.55 While the above 3 are well established in their localities, VIT AP & SRM AP are recently launched and it will take time for them to reach the standard of the ones in Vellore or SRM nagar. If u r planning for academic year 2019 - 2020 I would say Gitam is a good choice over them at this juncture. VIT and SRM AP may or may not take off in the future because they r placed in capital region and the capital region is currently under construction. Though land parcels have been allocated and the construction is going on in the campuses. The infrastructure in the region is grim, this includes the roads leading to the campuses.
