question: Which college is better for CSE/IT REC, SRM Easwari or RMK?
answers: I'm a current first year student of Mechanical department at RMK Engineering College. I don't know about other colleges but both CSE and IT departments are very good at RMK and they get top placements. All this comes at a heavy cost of sacrificing your freedom and burdened by the most silliest rules you could ever imagine. I once forgot my hall ticket for the practical examinations (I know , it's a horrible mistake) . To get a Xerox copy , I had to write an apology letter to the HOD which took 10 minutes and got an earful so that accounts for 20 minutes. Then had to show the letter to my branc Continue ReadingI'm a current first year student of Mechanical department at RMK Engineering College. I don't know about other colleges but both CSE and IT departments are very good at RMK and they get top placements. All this comes at a heavy cost of sacrificing your freedom and burdened by the most silliest rules you could ever imagine. I once forgot my hall ticket for the practical examinations (I know , it's a horrible mistake) . To get a Xerox copy , I had to write an apology letter to the HOD which took 10 minutes and got an earful so that accounts for 20 minutes. Then had to show the letter to my branch coordinator and get it signed and then rush to the exam cell and get a Xerox. I had to pay Rs.100 as fine just to open a website and take a printout. All this accounts for 30 minutes (My physics practicals was for 2hrs) On the way back I was stopped by the OA( First year OA is the most irritating creature in RMK) for having a barely visible beard. He took my ID and forced me to go to the saloon(in hostel ) and get it shaved. Luckily my professor explained the situation that there was only 30 mins left and I was allowed to write the exam ( HAD TO SHAVE AS SOON AS THE EXAM ENDED). There are many incidents like this which happen on a daily basis. Only good thing is the FOOD IS GREAT (barring Monday's worst menu) . To sum up , CSE and IT guys will get placed most often than not in any Engineering college. Easwari and REC are good colleges and have the same placement records as RMK (REC has a better record than Easwari) . The rules are not as bad as the ones in RMK . To sum up , if you wanna enjoy college life and wish to have some freedom of your own , DONT CHOOSE RMK. If you are fine with that , RMK will be the best as academic activities are highly encouraged here and all the faculty at CSE/IT are well experienced . Make a good choice and please don't regret after joining. Best of luck

question: Which college is better for CSE/IT REC, SRM Easwari or RMK?

question: How many seats are there for CSE in SRM?
answers: For CSE there are around 1600 seats in Kattankulathur Campus, 850 in Ramapuram Campus, 600 in Vadapalani Campus and around 240 in Amravati, AP Campus. I have no idea about NCR Campus. Based on my experience, SRMJEEE and VITEE: VITEEE:-Physics: As per my observation, the weightage of class 12 was around 60%. Focus was on Mechanics, Electrodynamics and Modern Physics. Chemistry: There were a good amount of questions from Physical Chemistry. Inorganic had a less share. Organic was based on that of class 12. Both, class 11 and 12 had roughly equal weightage. Mathematics: The focus was on Coordinate Continue ReadingFor CSE there are around 1600 seats in Kattankulathur Campus, 850 in Ramapuram Campus, 600 in Vadapalani Campus and around 240 in Amravati, AP Campus. I have no idea about NCR Campus. Based on my experience, SRMJEEE and VITEE: VITEEE:-Physics: As per my observation, the weightage of class 12 was around 60%. Focus was on Mechanics, Electrodynamics and Modern Physics. Chemistry: There were a good amount of questions from Physical Chemistry. Inorganic had a less share. Organic was based on that of class 12. Both, class 11 and 12 had roughly equal weightage. Mathematics: The focus was on Coordinate Geometry and Calculus. I think class 12 had a greater representation. English: All the questions were from NCERT textbook of class 12SRMJEEE:-Physics: Most of the questions were direct and theoretical. Here too, weightage of class 12 was around 60%. Here also, the focus points were same as that of VITEEE. Chemistry: There was almost equal number of questions from all the three branches. Class 12 had higher weightage. Mathematics: Here too, it Coordinate Geometry and Calculus stole the show. Both the classes had roughly equal weightage. Keep one thing in mind, these exams are held online and have various slots. So you can’t form any general trend for these exams. That is why, I would advise you to not think a lot about trends in these exams. It may back.

question: How many seats are there for CSE in SRM?
answers: For CSE there are around 1600 seats in Kattankulathur Campus, 850 in Ramapuram Campus, 600 in Vadapalani Campus and around 240 in Amravati, AP Campus. I have no idea about NCR Campus. Get the admission through merit and don't believe the spam answers people put on quora claiming that they'll give you admission through “management quota”. They're scammers.

question: How is the genetics programme at SRM University?
answers: It's Above Average. If you are looking for research then you'll get great laboratory and equipment facilities. Teachers might not be the best but they'll definitely be helpful. SRM will fund your research paper if you are good at it as tehy are desperate for patents. If you are looking to do higher education, then it is right choice as SRM has collaboration with 100+ great foreign universities like MIT, Carnegie Mellon, UC Berkeley etc. You may study there for one semester, on student exchange program but it will be expensive. If you are looking for placement , then it is not a good choice as there is very very few companies which visits SRM for recruitment in Genetics Branch. Genetic Engineering from any college in india except 3–4 old IITs is not considerable when your preference is placement.

question: How was your experience while studying at SRM University? Is SRM worthy?
answers: I discontinued after studying one year at SRM University or SRMIST. I consider it as the worst experience in my life and wish to forget the same. But the thoughts recur to me again and again. I joined first year MBA. I never imagined that it will be the nightmare for me. The first day we had no idea where to sit and nobody is there to guide us. The introduction session in finance was by singing song in malayalam on jimikki kammal. Some danced and one fellow tingled on my ear rings. I was totally surprised at the way in which the girls are taken for granted. I started sitting with other girls.  Continue ReadingI discontinued after studying one year at SRM University or SRMIST. I consider it as the worst experience in my life and wish to forget the same. But the thoughts recur to me again and again. I joined first year MBA. I never imagined that it will be the nightmare for me. The first day we had no idea where to sit and nobody is there to guide us. The introduction session in finance was by singing song in malayalam on jimikki kammal. Some danced and one fellow tingled on my ear rings. I was totally surprised at the way in which the girls are taken for granted. I started sitting with other girls. Suddenly we are told we have to sit in the attendance order and I went to back row and most of them are boys. When I sat there. One boy came and put his hand around me and asked for number. I just shrugged him. He told it is culture of srm. Some of them are not my classmates and they the seniors sitting in my class. Some started to play with my dupatta. I could not bear these insults. I took leave and came back after a week. The class was totally different. Some of them started sitting in pairs. The topics for discussion are arranged marriage or love marriage, Tim Cook sex orientation ( this is the topic given by one Shit known as Nisha for economics). The class is one of the worst. The next day when I went to the class someone purchased a cake on my birthday which i told no one. Here the students bribe class teachers to know the birthday of girls and bring cakes. In my bench suddenly they sang happy birthday for me and gave a cake to the staff also. After taking the cake he left the class. 10 boys surrounded me and stuffed make in to my mouth. Some one smeared it on my face. I fellow told to put it in my bag. It is sign to put it on my private parts. Within seconds they opened and put it on me. I went back to my room. I telephoned my mother and told all my experience and she told me to discontinue and come back home. This is the kind of education at SRM. I shared this experience so that students with character not to get mislead by advertisements and loose their life.

question: Where can I get SRM E-lab solution?
answers: Search for it. eLab-solutions-2016-2020 SRM ELab Solutions Solving questions from e-lab is real fun. Try thinking of the solution for 30 minutes, If you don’t get the idea, search it. But don’t copy-paste the code, type everything. In the previous semester, I had Java and Algorithm for e-lab. Questions from java were simple while algorithm questions were difficult. I couldn't able to complete the dynamic programming part so I copy-paste the code. Still, I find it difficult to solve dp problems. In the semester exam, you have to solve 2 questions out of 10 for the algorithm, which is easy. But quest Continue ReadingSearch for it. eLab-solutions-2016-2020 SRM ELab Solutions Solving questions from e-lab is real fun. Try thinking of the solution for 30 minutes, If you don’t get the idea, search it. But don’t copy-paste the code, type everything. In the previous semester, I had Java and Algorithm for e-lab. Questions from java were simple while algorithm questions were difficult. I couldn't able to complete the dynamic programming part so I copy-paste the code. Still, I find it difficult to solve dp problems. In the semester exam, you have to solve 2 questions out of 10 for the algorithm, which is easy. But questions can be from any topic. So one might expect all the questions from dp or graph coloring or backtracking. For java, you have to solve 4 questions out of 10, which can be as simple as calculate the area of triangle or circle. So, spend most of your time in the algorithm part.  Believe me, It is worth it.

question: Can I get seat at VIT, BITS, NIT, IIIT, and SRM after clearing the compartment exam in one subject with a good score in the JEE?
answers: Clearing the compartment exam will allow you to pass the basic requirement for admission in all these colleges Please note you can take admission in NIT,IIIT, DTU,NSUT and ither leading government colleges passing the cutoff rank in IITJEE MAINS in your respective course of choice. You can get admission into IIT of you clear the IIT Advance paper(both section-wise and overall cutoffs) for your course of choice . BITS, VIT, SRM all have individual entrance test that you have to clear in order to seek admission in the respective universities BITS has the BITSAT. You are tested on Physics, Chemistry, Maths, and English. English has about 10–15 question. The exam also has an additional section that opens up only when you have marked all the previous questions totaling about 360. The marking in general is +3 for the correct answer and -1 for any incorrect answer. VIT has VITEEE(witty) which is a computer-based test having 120 questions in physics, chemistry, and Maths. There is no negative marking and each question carry equal mark. Although the ranks are based both upon your marks as well as the time you took to complete the test. SRM has its own SRMJEE which has 105 questions in total with physics, chemistry, and maths having 35 questions each. It has the marking scheme of +3 for correct answer with no negative marking.

question: How does your private university campus look like?
answers: If we are talking about private universities i must say Lovely Professional University is the best private university. Not only me everyone says like The university has a great infrastructure in 600 acres of land. Every block of the University is specifically developed for a particular course and its requirements. Every block has its own Wi-Fi service and service is available everywhere. The labs are well-equipped with all the required materials where we enjoy doing experiments. The university has a great medical and emergency facilities and they have their own hospital and fire brigade team. The main attraction of university is "Open Auditorium" and university's own mall "Unimall" where everything is available for the students. A very cool campus with a variety of people. Good faculty and staff. It is the best private college so far in studies, cleanliness, and maintenance. If you are in the college, you feel that you are not in India. One can have a peace of mind in the college. Well-equipped labs and classes with Wi-Fi support. There are only two universities in India having shopping malls in the campus, and LPU is one of those. Awesome infrastructure in all schools. 24/7 Wi-Fi will be available. There are many library inside but central library is the largest among all and it is the best collection of acedamic text books, novels and various magazines. The infrastructure is amazing. There are 2 ACs and a projector in every classroom. You can find trees with full of flowers everywhere in the college. The trees are maintained so well. The blocks are very spacious and well-maintained. Each block is situated correctly with staff related to it. The infrastructure is the best in North India with all facilities including good Wi-Fi everywhere in the campus, hospital, fire station, mall, high level of security, labs, cleanliness, canteen, and hostel system. Hostels rooms are good with a tuck shop, and there is a canteen in each hostel. About the quality of education in LPU. I’m super impressed with the education quality. The professors are the biggest help you can get in the university. Help is available everywhere through the classmates/ seniors/faculty members. Proper material is provided by the university. Each stream has dedicated laboratory division with fully functional world-class equipment, and advanced research laboratories. The fee is very nominal for students as compared to the other private colleges. Various major companies take part in recruitment at LPU every year, some as Google, Infosys, Wipro, TCS, Accenture, IBM, Tech Mahindra, Oracle, Snap deal, Vodafone, Airtel, LG, HCL and many more. On an average, 200 MNCs visit our campus every year, placing around 2000 students every year. Packages vary from 5.30lpa to 30lpa based on the individual skill. Everything attracts a viewer to come in LPU.

For Navarthri celebrations, I was asked to pay 4,000 rs by another staff Balaji. He is class teacher and collects money for nine days dance programme at the department. Lakhs are collected and all the staff share it. It is shame. I never felt that this is an educational institute. Only some of the good teachers like Sri Vidaya Mam, Pradeep sir, Prasad sir, Joe sir and Jothi mam helped me to live in this hell. Project work is another worst thing. We are pressurized to buy from vendors. These people are Anbu and Daniel rajkumar. They get the project for us charge us thousands. No education but money. There is no classes in the after noon for nine days as everyone are compelled to participate in the lobby. The other students stand at the balcony and see the programme. Ponniah one of the dean, will take the event in his i pad and also dance with us. This is the time most of us are molested in the name of dance. No where in the world you will see this kind of institution. We reported to Director and he was very unhappy and he told us that it should be stopped. But the damage to the culture of the place is totally done.

question: How hard is it to get into SRM University?
answers: Having said that the SRMJEE is a lot tougher and more competitive mainly due to the sheer volume of applicants. You can stick to your board exam books but also focus on your core physics and math problems for speed and accuracy both from competitive exam books (which will be important). Use your time wisely. Now, some generic suggestions - Unless you secure a very good rank, CSE will be tough to get because let's face it, nearly everyone aims to get into CSE. IT is also a viable alternative for B.Tech and there isn't much difference in the syllabus or subjects, just the name of the degree tbh. question: What is the future of PhD scholars from the private universities like VIT, SASTRA, SRM, etc.?
answers: There are two interesting ways to think about this question: What happens to PhDs later in life?What is the future of PhD students?The first is easier (since it requires less viewing into my crystal ball). Unfortunately it is somewhat less exciting. The short story is very few PhDs get academic jobs. This article from the Atlantic looks at US NSF data, and the author finds less than 20% of PhDs get academic jobs (across fields). Now onto the crystal ball question... what does the future hold for PhD students? Here is a short list of what I think the future will look like: More holistic training: Given the increasing rate at which we produce PhDs, the labor market will demand broader skills from PhDs and expect more and more preparation for incoming newly minted researchers. So universities will have to train researchers more holistically, including simple things like grant writing classes, presentation classes, journal editorial processes, and similar. Meaning, we will move to actually training people for the job, not just the research.More career guidance: Right now PhDs are basically left to fend for themselves at the end of the degree. This is creating a lot of unhappiness and anxiety in newly minted PhDs. So eventually, this major hole will have to get filled by someone, whether the university or an external body. Helping to place PhDs in jobs where they can apply their skills. I am seeing this happen already in the private sector with cool startups like Oystir - The Best Jobs for PhDs.Even more collaboration during grad school: The levels of collaboration during PhDs is growing constantly. It is already known that collaborations improve the quality and impact of researchers work (see more here). So we will see the PhD students doing increasingly collaborative work!More software tools for PhDs: This is more and more obvious, that research is lagging as an industry in adopting and creating new software and web based tools to increase productivity. We still communicate by word of mouth and group meetings, and write notes in physical books. My own startup OpenLab is a part of this ecosystem trying to improve communication and collaboration within research (do check us out!). Others are doing cool things as well, like TetraScience, creating an IoT platform for labs. These tools will easily make PhDs 5-10x more productive than they are today. Just like what software tools do for business today compared to 10-15 years ago.Fewer PhDs overall: Sadly, the feedback of employment difficulty after a PhD will eventually mean that we will see a slow down in PhD enrollment and eventually a reduction. Essentially, a correction in the labor market for PhDs has to happen soon. This is especially true given the rise in postdocs everyone knows too well. Please follow and share for more answer.

answers: Good institute to study has lots of facilities and if you are a foodie , you will enjoy. if you are joining join the kattankulathur campus and not the other ones, since all creamy layer goes only to kattankulathur and only those , who couldnt get anywhere go to others and not much happens at the other campus One needs to write the entrance exam SRMEEE to get in to it. usually in the counselling, the first day all EEE, Auto, ECE, CSE, ISE, gets filled in all their campus. the next two days seats from ME,Aero, and Biotech begins the last to get filled is biotech, or food process Placement is gaurante Continue ReadingGood institute to study has lots of facilities and if you are a foodie , you will enjoy. if you are joining join the kattankulathur campus and not the other ones, since all creamy layer goes only to kattankulathur and only those , who couldnt get anywhere go to others and not much happens at the other campus One needs to write the entrance exam SRMEEE to get in to it. usually in the counselling, the first day all EEE, Auto, ECE, CSE, ISE, gets filled in all their campus. the next two days seats from ME,Aero, and Biotech begins the last to get filled is biotech, or food process Placement is gauranteed atleast for 90% of the candidates hook or crook, and hence the demand to join SRM is so high. When i was a faculty in 2009 - 2012, the placement was 99.8%. Wish to have my son also study there when he studies engineering, since all horses, donkeys, ants , i mean every engineer will be placed. But of course, good teachers are present, good labs, great opportunities if you really like to study, their library i can’t imagine any other institute has such a big one - one separate building with 3 to 4 floors and name the book u will get it, their softwares, from SAS to SAP they have, their hostels and their food - nobody will think of any food outside, superb food. everything is up to the mark, nobody can comment on anything. their auditorium, in real sense its a auditorium, even PVRs should be ashamed of their quality. Once they hosted the National science congress in 2011 and all over india people had participated without any flaw everthing took place. great organizers, kudos to SRMIITES! Don’t know how is it, heard many left after 2012, since they had some crazy decisions been taken. closed several departments, fired some good staff, didnt provide facilities to do research. So scared to join if i am given an offer. Better check with someone who know about it presently

question: What is it like to spend 4 years at SRM University?
answers: Answer to this question is beyond description and would have no end once it starts, so I’ll try and list down some points on how an SRMite feels whenever someone asks him/her, how were your 4 years at SRM: Coming to your hostel room post classes, lying in your bed as soon as you were into a nap an irksome voice yelling “Tambi room clean?” was enough to spoil your moodPlaying COD in hostel (boys) for continuous hours was such a relief!In the scorching heat of Chennai summers, water won’t satisfy your thirst as much as a glass of lime sponsored by your friend wouldFor god sake, who named the fresContinue ReadingAnswer to this question is beyond description and would have no end once it starts, so I’ll try and list down some points on how an SRMite feels whenever someone asks him/her, how were your 4 years at SRM: Coming to your hostel room post classes, lying in your bed as soon as you were into a nap an irksome voice yelling “Tambi room clean?” was enough to spoil your moodPlaying COD in hostel (boys) for continuous hours was such a relief!In the scorching heat of Chennai summers, water won’t satisfy your thirst as much as a glass of lime sponsored by your friend wouldFor god sake, who named the fresher’s program as “Shuru”?Mess food! do I even need to say anything about it? But more importantly, why didn’t we have spoons? And yet, Sunday morning Chole Bhature meant so much!There is no better feeling than to have Chai, sutta, samosa, etc., at Nagaraja’s (near Abode Valley) at 4 AM!75%-80% mandatory attendance is the worst thing that ever happened to us*Correction*: Hostel curfew time (especially for girls) was the worstUB staircases: those who knew, are legends! ;)Sneaking into Abode and Estancia always felt like a classified mission!Java wasn’t just a programming language!Potheri: The Wonderland! No wonder so many people aspired to open a food joint in Potheri post engineering. Lol!Alcohol from Tasmac + Party at someone’s flat = Buckets full of vomitTech Park staircase, are still evident of those countless gossips, laughter and convocation picturesProfessors who gave good internals to everyone were our saviors!Aaruush and Milan was time to either work like hell, or enjoy to the fullest or like some legends - go home for a small vacationSudden planned late night trips to Pondy and Mahabs to watch sunrise deserved applauseThe tension during placements could never be described and the parties after getting placed could never be re-livedYou never studied the subject whose end semester exam was scheduled the next day, you always studied the 12-markers that had a high probability of being in the question paperEarning money by making EG charts in 1st year was a real thing. PeriodNormal people: Breakfast-Lunch-Eve Tea-Dinner but an SRMite: Lunch-Eve Meal- Dinner- Late night dinnerYou go to gym? You are automatically into the Discipline committee :PThere are still so many things that I would’ve missed out, yet 4 years at SRM were so special and would always mean a lot. You don’t just spend 4 years, you create memories for a lifetime! Good day!

question: How does SRM University manage to stay as a top ranking university in India?
answers: You should first ask what a ‘Top ranking University’ is and how do you objectively define it - because these surveys by which you say SRM is a top university, have their own definitions which are extremely arbitrary (They do a very good job at hiding all of this in the fine line). For an objective answer, you need to take into account: The criteria that these surveys used to rank these universitiesThe Survey (Or the Surveyor) itself/himself/herself (and if they have any biases)This is one of the surveys from 2015 which is(was) quoted time and again in the SRM brochure/website (SRM - India’s #1 p Continue ReadingYou should first ask what a ‘Top ranking University’ is and how do you objectively define it - because these surveys by which you say SRM is a top university, have their own definitions which are extremely arbitrary (They do a very good job at hiding all of this in the fine line). For an objective answer, you need to take into account: The criteria that these surveys used to rank these universitiesThe Survey (Or the Surveyor) itself/himself/herself (and if they have any biases)This is one of the surveys from 2015 which is(was) quoted time and again in the SRM brochure/website (SRM - India’s #1 private University)→ http://www.srmuniv.ac.in/sites/default/files/downloads/2015_ranking_engineering.pdf The fine line reads - “National rankings are derived from a combination of perceptual and factual scores. Colleges that did not provide factual information were not ranked. ” Therefore, this survey is not entirely based on facts but perception also. Additionally, institutions which did not allow their students to vote only on the parameters which are set by Neilsen (most probably because the institutions thought the parameters were really vague / not circumspect enough to provide an accurate image of the institution) are NOT included in the survey.Since this is a perception survey, there are also problems of bias such as Desirability bias or Acquiescence bias, A student studying in an institution is more likely than not to rate the quality of infrastructure/education of that institution higher than it actually is (It further looks like Neilsen did not actually do anything further to get ‘factual’ metrics for the various parameters of the survey).Finally, the survey only considers Top Engineering institutes in India - and how they determine which institutions to survey? That is a secret only Neilsen knows. (I am willing to bet they consider IISc a science institution rather than an engineering one. If not, I am surprised it is not #1 in the list).All this said, SRM is still one of the better universities in India. Although it does not compare to the likes of IIT in terms of Student-Body/ Funding/ Faculty, it tries to make up for them in the form of career-opportunity, Diversity, infrastructure. It also performs better than the average in most surveys - http://www.srmuniv.ac.in/about/accreditation-and-ranking More here: achievements and awardsAwards / Recognition by Faculty and Students – National / InternationalAwards & Achievements by Faculty

question: How does SRM University manage to stay as a top ranking university in India?
answers: SRMIST or SRM University has a large industry tie-up which gives it an advantage over many other colleges. The student and staff strength are huge, so are the placements it records every year, at least for the engineering courses. The institute has one of the best placement records in the last few years. Apart from placements, the facilities and opportunities to excel not just in curricular but also extra-curricular are immense. From sports to arts, debating to MUNs and tech and cultural fests, the institute has a variety of things to do all through the year for the students which boost the ov Continue ReadingSRMIST or SRM University has a large industry tie-up which gives it an advantage over many other colleges. The student and staff strength are huge, so are the placements it records every year, at least for the engineering courses. The institute has one of the best placement records in the last few years. Apart from placements, the facilities and opportunities to excel not just in curricular but also extra-curricular are immense. From sports to arts, debating to MUNs and tech and cultural fests, the institute has a variety of things to do all through the year for the students which boost the overall development of the individual. The institute also has tie-ups or MOUs with many universities across the globe for semester abroad program(SAP) which is a unique opportunity. The student diversity also is very good with a lot of students from outside India studying here. There are various other things also which help to keep it in the top institutes/universities of India.

question: How can we get admission in SRM University? Is the entrance examination tough or lenient?
answers: Firstly I will say this: DO NOT take admission in SRM unless you are opting to go for CSE, IT, ECE or EEE. Other than that expect disappointment during placements although you can even face disappointments even if you can take the above streams, unless this is not your priority and thinking for further studies. This university is also very good in terms of exposure regarding events and clubs and you can fill up your CV if you are into these. Coming to your question, entrance exam is easy to moderate and thorough NCERT will be enough for securing a good rank. Even if you don't you always have an  Continue ReadingFirstly I will say this: DO NOT take admission in SRM unless you are opting to go for CSE, IT, ECE or EEE. Hope this helps.. cheers:)

question: What is your take on the recent incident of sexual harassment at SRM University?
answers: I think what happened was just a lick on the surface of the flaming hot mess that is the dysfunctional mess of management and authoritative egotism at SRM. In my time at SRM, I have experienced many instances of misuse of power from both faculties and management; not to mention numerous other accounts that I have heard from others. But, being the massive powerhouse they are, most of these accounts don't see the light of day. Any student, past or current, who saw the videos circulating of the management’s response to the incident will no doubt attest to the fact that that was a typical reaction from their side. The faculty and staff enjoy immunity from a management that puts far more significance on institutional face-value and reputation over student wellfare. I even saw a live video of an open-house meeting between representatives of management and students held at TP Ganesh Auditorium where the dean had the audacity to comment, “You will be the ones who suffer because you protest. If the reputation and decorum of the college is affected, companies will not come for placement “. That kind of sums it all up, don't you think?

question: Is SRM good in giving ranks?
answers: SRM adopted a very strange grading system that angered a lot of students in 2015. You could score 84 marks in most subjects and you might still end up with a CGPA of 6. In 2018, they changed the grading system to this:  Having a tough grading system is necessary because only then will Universities abroad take SRM seriously. This grading system actually eased the way for certain students’ entry to such universities. This was mainly done because SRM has a reputation of being too lenient with grading. If you have a bad CGPA, you can always go with your percentage. Sometimes 5.3 CGPA might be equal to 71.2%

answers: One question for all of you “Why do people still live in India or why do people come to live in India from other countries” After 1)A lot of rape cases. 2)After a lot of sexual harassment cases. (with boys and girls). So why do we even live in India. Its unsafe rigth. Your state or place is unsafe too. Its not only about SRM. Tell me one state in India which is safe for your son or daughter or friends. Indian people don't realise how big is this issue until or unless something happen to them or their relatives. They will assume them self as the luckiest person in the world. They believe nothing can happen wrong to them. But they are ignoring the fact that life can change in one moment. Today it happened in SRM, Tomorrow it will happen in Delhi, in Mumbai, next day in your state. Tell me why are we living in here?? Instead of finding the solution we only post questions. Instead of helping the victims we make them feel as they are wrong. Instead of punishing the wrong person we are letting them go. What are we doing. We are just hoping that :OK it happened in Delhi but nothing will happen to us, it happened in chennai (in this case SRM) but that's OK it will not happen to us. Nothing will change until we all do something from now on, nothing will change by publishing few news or articles. If we do nothing now sooner or later you will be the victim. Analysis of case in SRM A 28 years old lift mentanance man masterbate in front of a girl. This can happen in any girls hostel as most (lift mentaner) of them are male. ( The man is been arrested, SRM helped the victim. In short we need to take a step forward. Or we can wait for some knives to cut as apart. Anonymous because I know no one will take this issue seriously. I know after reading this again you will play “kissmat ka khel” (game of luck) But believe me all this issue, all this cases can be solve if from now on we take some action. We got 2 choice how we want India to be in 2025 Much bad even then the worstSafest country (in all aspects)I leave it to you. But I want 2nd option. How each and everyone can contribute 1)Tells girls that they are not weaker the boys. 2)Girls can fight with boys too and they can win. 3)Teach boys from birth how to respect women and same goes for girls. 4)Girls should know some self defense techniques. If you have any other technique write in comments. Best of luck to those woh are going to play “kissmat ka khel” (Game of luck).

question: How bad is the SRM IST Chennai?
answers: HIGHLIGHTS Cleaning staff masturbated in front of student in women's liftStudents allege administration delayed access to CCTV footage and registering of complaintNo police complaint has been filed yetStudents of SRM University at Kattankulathur area in the outskirts of Chennai staged a demonstration inside the campus Thursday night, alleging inaction by the administration on a sexual harassment complaint by a woman student of the varsity. According to a third-year software engineering student who took part in the protest, a second-year undergraduate student of the university was allegedly sexua Continue ReadingHIGHLIGHTS Cleaning staff masturbated in front of student in women's liftStudents allege administration delayed access to CCTV footage and registering of complaintNo police complaint has been filed yetStudents of SRM University at Kattankulathur area in the outskirts of Chennai staged a demonstration inside the campus Thursday night, alleging inaction by the administration on a sexual harassment complaint by a woman student of the varsity. According to a third-year software engineering student who took part in the protest, a second-year undergraduate student of the university was allegedly sexually harassed by a male sanitation worker inside a women's hostel lift on Thursday afternoon around 3 pm. "The man masturbated in front of the woman student in the hostel lift, following which she reported the issue to the authorities," the student told PTI. According to another protester, the hostel warden, with whom the student had raised the issue, allegedly delayed access to the CCTV footage of the elevator and the registering of a complaint by over two hours. Students have alleged that the director of the university has maintained that such "things happen to girls because they are north Indians who dress dirty, and smoke and drink". "The employee was identified by the student in the CCTV footage. However she was asked to stay mum about the incident by the authorities," the protester said, adding that the hostel authorities allegedly blamed the victim. The students of the university have taken to both the streets as well as social media to express their anger at the inaction on the part of the university administration. Videos of large groups of students breaking through barricades, demanding justice are flooding the Twitterverse SRM University Vice-Chancellor Sandeep Sancheti, however, denied the allegations of inaction and said the administration would look into the complaint. "Students are discussing with us. Whatever the matter is, it will be taken care of. If there is a matter, it will be inquired," Sancheti told news agency PTI.Local police officials who reached the protest spot told PTI that the protesters dispersed after assurances from the university administration to look into the matter. However, they added that no complaint had been registered yet. Check this SRM University erupts into protest after staff masturbates in front of student

question: How bad is the SRM IST Chennai?
answers: The College is as bad or good as you are. It is one of the reputed engineering college in South India. Students studying from the same college bags an offer of 39lpa CTC from Microsoft/Adobe and on the other hand most of them bags an offer of 3.5lpa from Mass Recruiters. It completely depends on one's skillset and talent. Some have a gpa of 9.5 while there are students who even have 5–6 arrears. That's the way it is in private colleges as many(10–20%) of them take admission through management Continue ReadingThe College is as bad or good as you are. It is one of the reputed engineering college in South India. Recently it has got A++ accreditation(highest) from NAAC & diamond university ranking from QS I-GUAGE. Students studying from the same college bags an offer of 39lpa CTC from Microsoft/Adobe and on the other hand most of them bags an offer of 3.5lpa from Mass Recruiters. question: What happens when a university exam is postponed at SRM University, Ramapuram?
answers: Yesterday we got an email from the university that today's exam is suspended due to heavy rain. If they said exam is postponed then it will be at a later date, most likely after the other exams. If it is suspended, then that particular exam will take place in the next semester. You won't get the results till that exam is evaluated. You will be given a date in the next semester to write this subject. This is done because a lot of students from far away have already booked their tickets to go home after the exam, so postponing is not a good solution. This is what my seniors said, because they fa Continue ReadingYesterday we got an email from the university that today's exam is suspended due to heavy rain. If they said exam is postponed then it will be at a later date, most likely after the other exams. If it is suspended, then that particular exam will take place in the next semester. You won't get the results till that exam is evaluated. You will be given a date in the next semester to write this subject. This is done because a lot of students from far away have already booked their tickets to go home after the exam, so postponing is not a good solution. This is what my seniors said, because they faced a similar problem once. P.S. I'm from SRM Kattankulathur.

question: What is the full form of SRMJEEE? What is it all about including fees structures?
answers: SRM Joint Engineering Entrance Examination or SRMJEEE will be conducted by SRM Institute of Science and Technology from April 15 to 25, 2019 for admission to B.Tech programmes offered by the institute. Candidates interested must first check the complete eligibility criteria of SRMJEEE 2019 and then only proceed to fill the application form by March 31, 2019. The successfully registered candidates will be issued admit card/ hall ticket of SRMJEEE 2019 which they will have to download and carry to the exam hall. The exam will be conducted according to the prescibed exam pattern of SRMJEEE 2019 i Continue ReadingSRM Joint Engineering Entrance Examination or SRMJEEE will be conducted by SRM Institute of Science and Technology from April 15 to 25, 2019 for admission to B.Tech programmes offered by the institute. Candidates interested must first check the complete eligibility criteria of SRMJEEE 2019 and then only proceed to fill the application form by March 31, 2019. The successfully registered candidates will be issued admit card/ hall ticket of SRMJEEE 2019 which they will have to download and carry to the exam hall. The exam will be conducted according to the prescibed exam pattern of SRMJEEE 2019 in which candidates will be required to answer questions based on the syllabus of SRMJEEE 2019 as released by the institute officially. The result of SRMJEEE 2019 will be announced by the authorities in the form of merit list. The authorities concerned will use the scores of SRMJEEE 2019 to prepare the merit list. The qualified candidates of the entrance exam will have to participate in the counselling of SRMJEEE 2019 to take the admission process further. SRMJEEE 2019 counselling will be conducted in two rounds in offline mode and seats will be allotted to candidates' on the basis of their merit, availability of seats and choice filling. Fee Structure SRMJEEE 2018 Fee Structure The candidates can check the tuition fee structure of SRMJEEE 2018 from the table given below. The fee structure for all the campuses have been provided. Candidates who will be allotted to the B.Tech seats offered by SRM Institute of Science and Technology will have to pay the required fees to confirm their admission after SRMJEEE 2018 counselling. question: Is clearing a maths arrears paper in SRM University very difficult?
answers: That depends on your interest in the Subject. I was always more inclined to Maths though I didn't score well cause I never practiced well. I miserably flunked in Transmission Lines and Networks and another subject which I don't even remember. I still managed to clear them in the next and next semesters though. So if you are afraid you'll flunk, all I'd suggest is for you to practice well and you'll have nothing to worry about.

question: Should we pass both the externals of practicals and theory in SRM?
answers: If its a theory course you need a total of 50 out of 100 to pass with both internals and external exam combined. If its a practical course you need a total of 50 out of 100 to pass with both internals and external exam combined. But in case of a joint course- Jthe marking scheme is different which is known only by some students and rest of them are always confused and think that its necessary to pass both practicals and theory seperately as the faculty always tell this amd they do not reveal the original marking scheme. Here is the marking scheme for JOINT COURSE. Practical internals 60 + Theory i Continue ReadingIf its a theory course you need a total of 50 out of 100 to pass with both internals and external exam combined. If its a practical course you need a total of 50 out of 100 to pass with both internals and external exam combined. But in case of a joint course- Jthe marking scheme is different which is known only by some students and rest of them are always confused and think that its necessary to pass both practicals and theory seperately as the faculty always tell this amd they do not reveal the original marking scheme. Here is the marking scheme for JOINT COURSE. Practical internals 60 + Theory internal 50 : 110/2 : 55. Univ practical : 40/2 : 20 + univ theory : 100/4 : 25. 55+20+25: 100. Note: In a joint course the internal weightage is 55%, Univ practical weightage is 20% and Univ Theory exam weightage is 25%. THIS IS APPLICABLE ONLY FOR B.TECH REGULATIONS 2015. Hope this Helps :)

question: Should we pass both the externals of practicals and theory in SRM?
answers: According to the book, yes you have to pass both theory and practicals with a min of 50 marks in each This is applicable for any joint subject You can identify it is a joint subject by looking at its subject code if its end with a J But its not always like that in practice like many of my friends and I myself got through few subjects where I thought I won't get through in theory but still got a better grade than i would ever dream of Try giving your best SRM sometimes adds some magic to marks out of no where in the end results

question: Can you add an all in one water cooler to a Rosewill - SRM-01 Micro ATX case?
answers: It does support a single 120mm fan in the front, so you may be able to get a single 120mm radiator up there, but this isn't really a case I would recommend if you are are using components that you feel a need to liquid cool. I would recommend looking for a case that at least has a top exhaust and room for 2 120mm fans in the front if possible. Most of the cheap options will be atx mid towers most likely, but they will probably be your best bet. I believe there are a few good options in the 50–60 dollar range. If you really need the micro atx size, you may be able to find something to fit your needs, but I don't know how much there is at a low price point. I know cheap stuff sounds great, but moving up from the $30 range to the 50–60 dollar range can really have a big impact on your system, and in the grand scheme of things shouldn't be too much more expensive. It's up to you though, so if that's what you want to do, I think it would be possible. I just haven't seen anything to confirm this.

question: I have 6.7 GPA(ECE) in SRM university. Is there any chance to get placed in any ITcompany. if I am good at Java?
answers: If you are good at Java, then the low GPA and that your major is ECE, don't matter much. Yes, some companies do look at GPA but not all of them. question: How is the culture in SRM Kattankulathur campus? How does the culture affect a student?
answers: Being a final year student of CSE at SRM Kattankulathur campus I guess I’m eligible to answer your question. Coming to the culture of SRM, there are three types of people you will often see : First category being those students who are studious and get involved in a lot of research and all these academic stuff. These are the ambitious students who want to learn more and more and eventually they end up getting placed at top companies or they end up going for higher studies in some good foreign university. Second category being those students who enjoy their times with their friends and are quite w Continue ReadingBeing a final year student of CSE at SRM Kattankulathur campus I guess I’m eligible to answer your question. Coming to the culture of SRM, there are three types of people you will often see : First category being those students who are studious and get involved in a lot of research and all these academic stuff. These are the ambitious students who want to learn more and more and eventually they end up getting placed at top companies or they end up going for higher studies in some good foreign university. Second category being those students who enjoy their times with their friends and are quite well known as being a single group and have lots of fun during the normal class times but still they study hard during exams and get the good marks. These students mostly end up getting placed in pretty decent companies or the mass recruiters or they pursue higher studies in some decent foreign university or an MBA course after finishing their under grad. Third category contains some students who are into some bad habits like smoking, drinking and so on. These are the type of students with who you wouldn't generally like to be considered as. They usually have a lot of arrears or at best they barely pass their exams and have an average CGPAs. However, the university management has been taking a lot of steps to ensure that no student falls into this category by holding counselling sessions and collecting more information while also keeping the parents updated to ensure no student falls for these traps that may potentially ruin their futures.

question: What is the skill set required as a CSE student to be placed in campus placements in SRM?
answers: Be positive! Placements depends equally on luck, hard work and determination. Luck is not in our hand so focus on hard work and determination. Usually two types of companies come for placements in SRM: Service based and Product Based. Service Based: TCS, Wipro, Hitachi Consulting and other consulting firms come under this. They test ur logical, analytical, verbal and aptitude skills. So prepare accordingly for them. Refer to the aptitude book provided by SRM or RS Aggarwal to enhance ur aptitude skills. Several online courses and tests are also available. Product Based: Amazon, Cisco, Aruba are a few companies to name. They offer comparatively higher CTC than service based. Mostly prefer people having good technical knowledge as well as logical skills. So, focus on Data Structure, Networks and Operating Systems. Also improvise your coding skills ( preferably Java as it implements OOPS concepts in lesser intricate pattern. You can also resort to C++). Refer geeksforgeeks [1] and hackerrank [2]for it. Also take help of the ppts shared by our professors in all these years to brush up the concepts. All the best! :) Footnotes[1] https://www.google.co.in/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/&ved=2ahUKEwiy47_bwuTdAhWKOI8KHdWLBAUQFjAAegQIBBAD&usg=AOvVaw1dl_KozKUK3hHWc8sda1Zw[2] https://www.google.co.in/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=https://www.hackerrank.com/&ved=2ahUKEwi5irCSw-TdAhXMOo8KHdUsCSkQFjAAegQIBRAD&usg=AOvVaw04BnYscQa-eADGvsV1QAzI

question: How is life in SRM CSE? How is the faculty and coding culture and placements?
answers: Depends very much on the path you take Some students prefer to enjoy their life and have lots of fun and focus on studies only during the cycle tests and the university exams. For these people, life here at SRM CSE is really pleasant with faculties being very friendly in terms of scheduling the classes as well as giving good marks. You always have one extra hour given per week for most of the courses which can be used as compensatory classes in case class is lagging behind or it can be cancelled. So we end up somehow getting classes cancelled when we want them to as per our convenience. If you are more into research and academic things, even then you will find that most of the faculties have some research experience or would be working on some projects or other and they would be quite eager to take you in for the project. As far as the placements are concerned, students of CSE department got a lot of dream offers in the ongoing placement season and 75–80% of the students who opted for placements are already placed with many of them getting 5–12 lpa as starting package itself. The mass recruiters also took a lot of students who got 3–4lpa package. So overall placements have been really good here. Edit : For the placements part, the placement cell trains students for the coding challenges that students will face during the placement exams.

question: Can a first year SRM KTR student take the last attempt of the JEE 2018 and get into NIT?
answers: First of all before answering this question let me question you what are your future ambitions after “bachelors in engineering” ? I will try to list out some of your answers you might have thought by yourself.. 1.Placements: 1st thing that should have struck your mind might be to get a decent percentile during your course years in order to sit in placements & then grab a exciting package. so let me tell me if you solely working for getting placements & belong to CS, IT or ECE department in your college then don't even think about preparing for JEE. SRM KTR has very good Placement records in thes Continue ReadingFirst of all before answering this question let me question you what are your future ambitions after “bachelors in engineering” ? I will try to list out some of your answers you might have thought by yourself.. 1.Placements: 1st thing that should have struck your mind might be to get a decent percentile during your course years in order to sit in placements & then grab a exciting package. so let me tell me if you solely working for getting placements & belong to CS, IT or ECE department in your college then don't even think about preparing for JEE. SRM KTR has very good Placement records in these branches & the college will provide you enough exposure which will help you to find a nice job. 2. Further Studies: If you planning to pursue higher studies like M.Tech, MS, CAT etc. Then irrespective of the branch you are having you can think of preparing for JEE exam. Target for Top NIT’s only then only it will make any sense of the decision you made for preparing JEE Mains for the 3rd time, moreover you also get good mentoring & guidance from your teachers for clearing the exams for these entrants. 3. Government Job: The last but not the least according to me will be preparing for exams of government jobs like UPSC, SSC, PO etc. So for this also your college won't matter anymore but preparing for JEE in this condition might result in lose of your 1 precious year as there are only limited attempts & there is strict age limit criteria also. .. So finally summing everything it isn't a good idea for preparing for JEE Mains again & if I would have been your place I shouldn't have even thought of preparing and taking the risk, but still if you are determined & optimistic for getting a good result then start preparing for JEE right from now Friend because there is not much time left, the clock is ticking..!!

question: What happens if a student takes a drop of one semester at SRM University, Chennai?
answers: You are allowed to take a break of one semester at any point of time. But once you take a break remember that you will be lagging back and you will have to study for one more semester, because as per UGC regultions a student needs to complete 8 full semesters to earn a B.tech Degree. For example : If you take a break during the 3rd sem, but all your friends are still studying and the next sem when you rejoin they will be in the 4th sem but you will be rejoining from the 3rd sem. So basically you will be lagging by one semester. And after all of your batch mates passout you will have to study for one more semester. Take a break only if necessary.

question: Will 67% in the 12th CBSE board affect my campus placement in the SRM KTR campus?
answers: Yes ofcourse it will effect your placements but it's not that you will not be placed. During placenta there will be so many companies coming and few of them will surly give percentage criteria for short listing but most won't. So if you are interested in just getting placed percentage doesn't matter but if you want in top notch company then every thing matters. This year the criteria was 60–60–60 in all 10 ,12,eng with no standing arrear so the is a chance with much less effect.

question: Will 67% in the 12th CBSE board affect my campus placement in the SRM KTR campus?
answers: Yes and no both.. but mainly yes. Mass recruiting companies like TCS, Infosys ask for 60% in both 10 & 12 whereas core companies may ask 70/75 or even 80% percent in either of the two or both. Some companies even ask for 90% in 12th but those are very few. Most of the companies' eligibility criteria falls between 70–80% in 10 or 12th or both.. Also as the competition is very high, the companies try to eliminate as much students as possible so if you do not clear the eligibility criteria you will not be allowed to sit nor you can argue about it. It's better to stay on the safe side.. Cheers :)

question: What is the procedure for completing the pending arrears (backlog) at SRM University after your 4 years is over?
answers: As per the rules you have 7 years to complete your B.Tech degree. So you can attend the exams for 3 more years (6 attempts) after completion of 4 years. At SRM according to the regulations the internal marks are taken into count for the first 3 attempts (1 regular & 2 arrear attempts) From the 4th attempt onwards 100% weightage is given to the End semester Examination and to pass you need to score a minimum of 50 marks in the exam. For example if you have an arrear in physics in the first sem The internal marks will be taken into count till the 3rd sem and accordingly the grade will be given bu Continue ReadingAs per the rules you have 7 years to complete your B.Tech degree. So you can attend the exams for 3 more years (6 attempts) after completion of 4 years. At SRM according to the regulations the internal marks are taken into count for the first 3 attempts (1 regular & 2 arrear attempts) From the 4th attempt onwards 100% weightage is given to the End semester Examination and to pass you need to score a minimum of 50 marks in the exam. For example if you have an arrear in physics in the first sem The internal marks will be taken into count till the 3rd sem and accordingly the grade will be given but from 4th sem onwards you just need to score 50 in the end sem to pass. The advantage of this system is that when you have low internal marks and its difficult to pass you can easily clear that course in the 4th attempt.

question: How are the girls hostels at srm university?
answers: Your answer made me smile! Fortunately for me I'm an alumni. So, I am at much liberty to explain in detail the atrocities students face in this college. Okay, what do you look for in a good college? Good infrastructure, education, technology, placements etc. First of all Chuck all that! Don't even expect the college to provide you clean drinking water or clean restrooms. I'm a 2016 pass out and the CSE department used to be much less crowded like we had hardly 250 people in our batch. Most of the times, the water purifier will not be working and there will be no water to drink. You must carry wat Continue ReadingYour answer made me smile! Fortunately for me I'm an alumni. So, I am at much liberty to explain in detail the atrocities students face in this college. Okay, what do you look for in a good college? Good infrastructure, education, technology, placements etc. First of all Chuck all that! Don't even expect the college to provide you clean drinking water or clean restrooms. I'm a 2016 pass out and the CSE department used to be much less crowded like we had hardly 250 people in our batch. Most of the times, the water purifier will not be working and there will be no water to drink. You must carry water from home (luckily my home was quite close) to stay hydrated throughout the day. There was this one time we found a worm in the drinking water and when we complained to the floor in-charge, she promptly whisked away the bottle. She said the problem is being looked into and returned an empty bottle (not that we are going to upload it online or something but the things these people do to cover up stuff). 70% of the time, the restrooms will be stinking and the yucky smell will be gracing the classrooms too. And the best part they will lock the restrooms promptly by 4. I mean, is somebody gonna steal something from there? Food (poor hostellers!)- this one is from them. Though they paid 80,000 mess fees (in 2016, I'm not sure about the fees now), most of them ate food from outside. There was an infamous video on worm infested tea can being used to serve tea in the boys hostel. And 90% of hostellers start living outside from 2nd year to save money paid (rather wasted) as hostel and mess fees. Now that we have covered about your basic needs, let's move to why you are actually there. Education: Books: They will steal money in the name of book fees right under your nose. Rs. 15,000 for some 20 books, 5 records and an E.G set. The best part? None of the books were from the given syllabus. We protested and started buying books on our own from 3rd sem.Faculty : 90% politics, 10% knowledgeable. Very very few professors are actually knowledgeable. Rest are just there to torture you to show other faculty that they are being strict, prim and proper. If you talk back, you might as well sign your death warrant. You'll have to beg them, pacify them blah blah for them to sign your records. Oh how many times they will make you walk back and forth for that dumb record! Rumors fly people! The faculty are more kiddish than the students. And don't wait up for somebody to teach you. No one will. Take a print out of the syllabus paper. Rush to the library. Pick up the needed books. Start learning. Don't expect any faculty to teach you new programming languages or something. You ARE on your own.Labs: Oh! Our good ole' computer labs. Hardly 10–15 systems worked properly among the 60 or so systems in a lab. Be ready to share.Infrastructure : Dude! Have you seen the cracks on the buildings? And the ongoing construction work? Be ready to navigate among the steel rods, cracked roads, swamp created during and after rain. Don't be fooled by the look of admin office. It's the only decent looking building in the campus. The CSE block has 8 floors of which 7 floors have classrooms. There's only one lift. You might as well start climbing the stairs. Oh, no playground and be ready to navigate from one block to another for VAC class. Placements: The ultimate reason why people fall into this crappy institution. My batch is the last one to be a part of placements held in KTR campus. That 1000 something companies come there only. Now, SRM Ramapuram is no longer a part of those placements. So, basically you'll be attending your placements with Easwari people and I'm very sure not so many companies come. And that 100% placements record? If you are not placed by the end, you'll be forced to take up BPO job offers so that they can maintain their record. Dress Code: Subject to changes by the floor in-charge. If they are in a good mood, kurti and leggings are allowed. If they are having a bad day, they will literally call you and scream at you for wearing tight clothes. If you are a hosteller, they will ask you to go change and then come attend the classes. What have I learned in the 4 years? Well, I have learned to educate myself, to handle tough people and tough situations. My patience level has gone up after these 4 years. And I did meet and network with a lot of people. Your interpersonal skills will see a boost. DISCLAIMER : These are my personal experiences. Please note that this happened 1–2 years back. Things might have changed (though I highly doubt that) now. And do keep in mind that 60–70% of private engineering colleges have these same problems. Some colleges don't even have placements. So if you are not getting seat in a govt. colleges,

question: How are the girls hostels at srm university?
answers: Hi, I'm a final year student of SRM University and I study in the Ramapuram Campus. Rather than suggesting improvements, this is my honest opinion about whatever I've seen here till now. I was an innocent little kid who came to study engineering here so he could become like my hero, Steve Jobs. But today in my final year, I smoke on an average 6-8 joints a day. Now, I'm not blaming anybody. I know that I'm not a bloody genius but how the hell have I never scored a GPA below 7.6? I wonder what sort of education they provide.Placements: I'm studying Electronics and Communication Engineering and IContinue ReadingHi, I'm a final year student of SRM University and I study in the Ramapuram Campus. Rather than suggesting improvements, this is my honest opinion about whatever I've seen here till now. I was an innocent little kid who came to study engineering here so he could become like my hero, Steve Jobs. But today in my final year, I smoke on an average 6-8 joints a day. Now, I'm not blaming anybody. I know that I'm not a bloody genius but how the hell have I never scored a GPA below 7.6? I wonder what sort of education they provide.Placements: I'm studying Electronics and Communication Engineering and I was able to get into a "core" company. A lot many companies come to SRM and also offer high packages but don't forget about the previous point. (Most) People here are just not competitive enough to get those good packages. Also, If you opt to sit for placements and you get a job, the college will refuse to give you a Letter of Recommendation if you later decide to study abroad (i.e while you are in college). Well, inspite of being "India's Number 1 Private University" most students don't get a package of more than 4 lakhs pa.World Class Infrastructure: I'll talk about Ramapuram Campus first. There are no drinking facilities anywhere. You'll die of thirst but you won't find water in the water coolers and then the lifts don't work. There aren't even dustbins in the classrooms or in the corridors. When it rains the roof leaks. Lab equipments don't work. AC doesn't work anywhere, not even in the library. I don't know when was the last time money was actually spent on repairs/maintenance. Though SRM people are very proficient in opening new food courts to raise more money. In Kattankulathur campus, they have good marvellous buildings but if you look at them, you'd see that they are only marvellous from on side, and the rest three sides are still under construction. The Tech Park got flooded in the Chennai floods and then it got fire about a week ago. So much for world class infrastructure.I pay 1.5 lakhs pa as my tuition fee and on top of it, I'm being forced to shell out an additional 20-25k pa on placement training and value added courses. First of all, they are not a part of the curriculum. Second, these courses are conducted by institutes owned and operated by SRM (like Sai Career). Placement Training is compulsory even for students who don't wish to sit for placements and even for people who don't need them. Who is SRM to decide if I need to attend placement training classes or not? And I have to compulsorily buy books from the college book store.There is no grievance redressal anywhere. If you go against the management or the faculty, they'll harass you till the point you lose all your self confidence.Teachers are not world class as advertised. The Curriculum sucks, it can make you well educated not not talented. The curriculum in no way can help a person who just wants a job. Academics and Vocational Training are two different things. If somebody wants to do well in life, that somebody can't rely on any "SRM". I hate the fact that I had to sit and waste my time attending classes given by stupid teachers. My HOD doesn't even have a PHD.When I sat for counselling, there were about 100 seats per stream but when I joined the college, I had 300 students in my batch in my department alone. And then they write on their website that they don't have a management quota. Now, I sit with stupid incompetent people who are only here because they had some extra money on them.SRM in my opinion is a huge money making scam. Mind you, education should be not for profit. SRM here makes people attend stupid placement training classes for the whole four years and now I ask you, can four years of placement training not make you good enough to get a job? But sorry to say, four years of placement training will get you a job, but not skilled enough to stay on the job. Most of the people here still don't know in which field they want to work in. Every year, thousands get placed from SRM mostly for jobs that pay not more than 3.5 lakhs pa and then SRM runs advertisements on all national papers but they don't say how much on an average a SRM graduate earns. Then thousand sit for SRMEEE and then many join SRM. SRM in the end earns a lot of money and nobody has a clue about what it does.This is just my opinion and if you feel that I'm wrong, please, let me know. And if you think I'm right, please let's do something about it. Consumer Court? We've been promised a future and in the name of it, we've only been taken advantage of by these greedy immoral giants.

question: Are mandatory courses like value education considered while calculating the CGPA in SRM KTR?
answers: Yes. They have credits assigned which do affect your CGPA. A word of advice, you’ll have people come and tell you that 1st semester is for chilling and relaxing and that your overall CGPA won’t be affected much.Stay away from those people. That’s the biggest nonsense you’ll hear in your first year. Every point counts if you want to maintain a decent GPA. I scored a CGPA of 9.5 in sem 1 and that was the only reason why I could maintain an overall GPA above 8.8 (my CGPA at the end was 8.906) even after I scored much lesser GPA in subsequent semesters. It was because of my first Sem that I could  Continue ReadingYes. They have credits assigned which do affect your CGPA. A word of advice, you’ll have people come and tell you that 1st semester is for chilling and relaxing and that your overall CGPA won’t be affected much.Stay away from those people. That’s the biggest nonsense you’ll hear in your first year. Every point counts if you want to maintain a decent GPA. I scored a CGPA of 9.5 in sem 1 and that was the only reason why I could maintain an overall GPA above 8.8 (my CGPA at the end was 8.906) even after I scored much lesser GPA in subsequent semesters. It was because of my first Sem that I could stay afloat. So score as much as you can in Sem 1 as scoring a good pointer in the later semesters will be difficult.

question: How are the placement going on for 2018-19 batch in SRM?
answers: So far, the placement process has been quite satisfactory, with the companies displaying absolute clarity in the hiring. Like always, two months into the placement season, I have seen many students, notably from CSE, IT and Software being the ones, who meet the eligibility criteria for most of the companies due to the job profile being coding oriented. The mere presence of such students gives them an edge over the core branches like Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, etc. Apart from them, ECE students too have been in the company shortlists for rounds, beyond the online tests. Companies like TCS (Di Continue ReadingSo far, the placement process has been quite satisfactory, with the companies displaying absolute clarity in the hiring. Like always, two months into the placement season, I have seen many students, notably from CSE, IT and Software being the ones, who meet the eligibility criteria for most of the companies due to the job profile being coding oriented. The mere presence of such students gives them an edge over the core branches like Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, etc. Apart from them, ECE students too have been in the company shortlists for rounds, beyond the online tests. Companies like TCS (Digital, not the mass ones), Ninjacart, State Street, Amazon etc. have virtually hired from CSE,IT and Software, based on their coding expertise. Others like Mu Sigma, KPNG, Latent View etc. have few core branch students, apart from the usual coding students. This is still an initial stage of the entire season and with the inevitable arrival of mass recruiters, things are slated to improve for other students. question: How are internal marks normalized in SRM Institute of Science and Technology?
answers: The internal marks awarded to the students are first normalized and combined with the normalized marks of end semester examination. Subsequently letter grades are awarded for the normalized marks. To pass in a course with earnable credits a student has to score a minimum of 50% of the total normalized marks secured in both the internal and end semester examination. Internal Marks are given based on the students performance in the cycle tests and assignments. Internal marks carry a weightage of 50%. End semester exam is conducted for 100marks and then converted to 50. Grade is awarded based on the total of both internal and external marks out of 100. For the Grades please refer B.tech Regulations.

question: Are the university degrees received at branch campuses the same as the degrees received at the main campus?
answers: I teach at Florida State University’s branch campus in the Republic of Panama. Many students study here for two years then transfer to our main campus, or to other universities in the USA, but some students complete their degrees here. Some students come here from the main campus as well, to study for a semester or two in the Republic of Panama. We only offer a limited number of options for students who want to complete their degree on this campus, but the degree they receive is exactly the same - it is a degree from FSU, and we always have at least one senior administrator from the main campus participating in our degree ceremonies. Florida State University is accredited by SACS, (Southern Association of Colleges and Schools) and every time SACS inspects FSU (SACS carries out regular inspections on all the institutions it accredits), some of the inspection team visit our campus. Every instructor here is approved by the main campus. Some faculty come from the main campus to teach classes here. Also, we’ve had people visit from the main campus to give us training sessions, and to include us in the process of developing the curriculum.

question: What will happen if someone gets low marks in the cycle test at SRM?
answers: The internals in SRM are framed in such a way that every point you score adds up to your GPA which is your semester result. Now there are three cycle tests, a surprise test and a quiz. So the weightage shall vary accordingly. I am sure you know this. Make sure you do well in the upcoming exams and assignments. That shall help reduce the impact of the low score in CT 1. PS: Chill out! You’ve got this!!

question: What will happen if someone gets low marks in the cycle test at SRM?
answers: Low marks in cycle tests affect your semester results. CT1 however has just 10% weightage so low marks in CT1 won’t hurt much. However, getting low marks in all the cycle tests would bring down your internals considerably which will negatively impact your GPA. Don’t be disheartened if you get low marks in CT1 but also on the other hand take CTs lightly.

question: How was the area in which the Ramapuram tiger operated?
answers: Let me first of all express my delight and surprise to find a lady who seems to be an avid reader of Kenneth Anderson. We belong to a rare breed. Cyberspace is a wonderful place to discover like-minded friends.Congratulations indeed. Please note that the timeline of this wonderful naturalist was the first half of the twentieth century, and from the story it appears that the Ramapuram man-eater operated in the nineteen twenties or thirtees. Coimbatore, north Coimbatore more so is a gateway to the Nilgiri hill station of Ooty or Udhagamandalam, parliamentary constitution of S Raja, infamous for 2G scam. The plains are lush green. At the foothills greens give way to sparse vegetation interspersed with rocky areas and some streams. Ramapuram from its description appears to be situated in lower slopes of the foothills. In those days it was a tiny hamlet, inaccessible and remote. Being in the foothills rains should be heavy, yet summer should not be that savage as in the plains of South India. Ooty is pretty chilly, lovely place though in off-season. The coffee plantations are panoramic. The tiger would have operated in the scrub jungles, along the stream beds and jungle paths winding through bamboo groves and undergrowth. Somewhere dense, somewhere sparse, somewhere rock-strewn approach to isolated hamlets like to Ramapuram must have been a daunting task. To the poor, helpless villagers that tiger must have been a nightmare. Sparse population, inhospitable jungles provided the tiger freedom to roam unchallenged and strike at will. Please excuse me for a rather long response.

question: Which college is better for engineering, SRM KTR (main campus) or KJ Somaiya Sion?
