question: What happens to my attendance if I am suspended from attending classes for 20+ days at SRM University?
answers: Hey there, I have also completed my btech from SRM University kattankulathur campus. I am from bihar and that was the first time when I went outside of bihar in 2011 , for starting I used to stay at avadi airforce area (cousin sister's place) which was very far from college around 40+km, everyday I use to take suburban train from avadi to potheri and most of the time I had missed my morning lectures and over the period of time my attendance went below 75% (which was the criteria for 11-15 batch) but later I got to know that I can submit medical certificates, for those days but It has to be continuous, the benchmark for medical is 65%, Below 65% you need to talk to your CI, you have to repeat the semester if your attendence fall back. BUT most important try not to bunk more classes because there are 5 marks for attendence also try to achieve that 75%criteria

question: What is your view on Valliammai Engineering College of the SRM group?
answers: I am a 2019 passed out student of Valliammai Engineering College. Every students' first view on this college is the level of freedom offered to the students. Since now it became autonomous, the freedom has been even more increased. We can talk to girls, even can wear decent jeans and t-shirts (for both boys and girls too).They won't force you to study hard and hard by keeping cycle tests, revision tests, pre semester tests and all. They would just teach the lessons well by some really experienced staffs and would just conduct internal tests as per Anna University norms. Nothing more than that. Continue ReadingI am a 2019 passed out student of Valliammai Engineering College. Every students' first view on this college is the level of freedom offered to the students. Since now it became autonomous, the freedom has been even more increased. We can talk to girls, even can wear decent jeans and t-shirts (for both boys and girls too).They won't force you to study hard and hard by keeping cycle tests, revision tests, pre semester tests and all. They would just teach the lessons well by some really experienced staffs and would just conduct internal tests as per Anna University norms. Nothing more than that. The important thing is that they won't provide you internal marks. You cannot get easy 20 internal marks like in other colleges. They would conduct three tests and based on the average of those three tests they provide your internal marks. Getting 20 internal or even 0 lies in your hand. Talking about the placement, I heard the placements has been increased after the autonomous grants. Not sure about that though. The placements were low during my time and not upto the mark. The only major placement happened in my time is Accenture and it's a bulk placement. Being a Valliammai student and placing in Accenture is a bed of roses but if you miss that opportunity there won't be any rescue companies to save you, atleast in my time. Not sure about the current status. Canteen food would be good and as I am a hostellate there, I can also say the hostel facilities are also good and neat. In simple words, liberal college, good teaching, neat lab facilities, slightly low placement (in my time), tidy canteen and hostel.

question: What happens at the first day of SRM Haryana?
answers: I’m a 3rd Year student from SRM University: Top Engineering and Management University in Delhi-NCR. I’ve had my fair share of experiences in this university and I think now I am more capable to write this answer. Orientation: Before the commencement of classes, we have orientation programmes at the auditorium. The first day at the college is held in mid August (mostly) and the teachers usually begin teaching their subjects without wasting much time on the introduction part. First week of college is for induction where you have to spend half of the day listening to boring lectures from dignitaries. Introduction: You get plenty of time to settle down before the actual classes starts. Then comes the ice breaking sessions where you get to know your fellow batch mates. Then starts your lectures where faculties guide you about exams,rules and everything. Seniors are very cooperative. Interaction with VC: There is also motivational interaction with the VC and they introduce to the various clubs and groups working in the campus.Other than that ,basic interactions, better mess food, new Whatsapp groups and hostel celebrations are done. hope this information helps you. All The Best!

question: What is the procedure of OD in SRM University main campus?
answers: Just ask for the OD form from CI in case of medical or from event coordinator in case you want an OD for the event. Do note that there are two types of OD: PRESENT OD : You will get attendance irrespective of your current attendance percentageABSENT OD : In this you will only get attendance only if your attendance falls below 75 %.So do ask the type of OD which is being given because if you are aiming for 95% and above in attendance you need to get present OD. You will only get to see the updated attendance including OD at the last working day Cheers:)

question: Where can we get the first year books in SRM Kattankulathur?
answers: I just finished my B.Tech from SRM Kattankulathur and as per my knowledge, the college has stopped providing books to the students. Hence, you'll have to arrange all the textbooks yourself. There's nothing to worry though as you've got various options to choose from. I'll put them down one by one and you can choose as per your requirements and convenience. The college library where you can go, sit and read or even borrow whatever textbooks you need.Greenline and such Xerox shops in Potheri which is a 5 minute walk from the UB. The only issue there is that you'll get the Xerox or Black& White priContinue ReadingI just finished my B.Tech from SRM Kattankulathur and as per my knowledge, the college has stopped providing books to the students. Hence, you'll have to arrange all the textbooks yourself. There's nothing to worry though as you've got various options to choose from. I'll put them down one by one and you can choose as per your requirements and convenience. The college library where you can go, sit and read or even borrow whatever textbooks you need.Greenline and such Xerox shops in Potheri which is a 5 minute walk from the UB. The only issue there is that you'll get the Xerox or Black& White printed versions of the books and not the actual book.If you don't feel like studying from the black & white binded books, you can find a lot of second-hand book shops which will sell you at around 60% of the present MRP of the book. Almost all of such books will be new because only a few B.Tech students study from them.Moore Market, a 2 minute walk from Chennai Central railway station which is purely a books and stationery market where you can find all sorts of books related to your field. (If you wish to go to Moore market, just take a Tamil-speaking friend with you, even better if you yourself speak Tamil. Oh and yes, don't mention them that you're from SRM otherwise they'll charge you more). Don't forget to bargain properly.Hopefully this long-ass answer will help you find whatever you're looking for.

question: Where can we get the first year books in SRM Kattankulathur?
answers: Just go to Star Xerox in the University building and request for the full set of 1st semester based on your Batch. They have fixed rate and will provide you the Xerox of all the books. Also Green Line in Potheri have the same set and at the more negotiable rates.

question: What should a first-year student of SRM University know before joining?
answers: The struggle is going to be real.Food in hostel is basically SHITThe locality is not that good.Freshers have to climb 5 floors to reach classes.There is no canteen in college only shops.Faculty might intimidate you but they will go easy on you.Start doing online courses as soon as you get comfortable with curriculum.There is minimum diversity in freshers.If you are going to be hosteller, i would rather recommend to stay in PG, its cheap and more functional.College fest are not on Grand Levels.The campus is OKish.you will get assigments in first two year at exponential rate.Be friendly with facContinue ReadingThe struggle is going to be real.Food in hostel is basically SHITThe locality is not that good.Freshers have to climb 5 floors to reach classes.There is no canteen in college only shops.Faculty might intimidate you but they will go easy on you.Start doing online courses as soon as you get comfortable with curriculum.There is minimum diversity in freshers.If you are going to be hosteller, i would rather recommend to stay in PG, its cheap and more functional.College fest are not on Grand Levels.The campus is OKish.you will get assigments in first two year at exponential rate.Be friendly with faculty.Get ready to give exams 3 internals and 1 external + practicals every semester.If you are going for CSE then Start learning OOPS for starter and stick to a language until.all concepts are clear.Do learn Data Structures and Algorithm , Design and Analysis of Algorithm very seriously, you can do courses online, that would be better.We don't study with books so get ready to be used to study with PDFs.
